Reviews.Title: “A Secret Gem”
Reviews.Author: ramrtn68
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent a week at the Villa Montana Beach Resort in March of this year. Originally, we had been looking to spend the week on Vieques, but while researching places to stay there, we decided to open up our search to Puerto Rico, and found this resort. We had never been to the western part of Puerto Rico and weren't quite sure what to expect. We flew into San Juan, rented a car, and drove ourselves to the resort. The drive was at night, but mostly highway, and took us just over 1 1/2 hours. Finding the resort was a little tricky once we got off the main roads. Signage was quite poor at night and we drove by the entrance on our first attempt. We arrived just before 11pm, and were able to catch the front-desk person to check in (otherwise, you check in with security). Much to our disappointment, there were no options at the resort for a drink or food at that hour. The only restaurant open while we were there, Eclipse, stopped serving around 10pm. Apparently, there is another restaurant on site, but it was not open during our stay. Our single room was cliffside, which was a short distance from the beach, pools, etc. The room itself was nicely decorated, clean, and had a small refrigerator. The room was on the third floor of a townhouse, which consisted of one larger unit comprising the first two floors, and another single room adjacent to ours. We had a small balcony from which we could hear the ocean (and even glimpse a part of it through the trees). What we didn't realize about the resort until we arrived, was that the townhouse, much like most of the villas on the property, were privately owned. The resort is essentially run like a time-share property, where units are owned by individuals, then rented to vacationers. Knowing this is important, I think, because it will help set your expectations for service (see below). After our first night, we decided to upgrade to a one-room villa, and were happy that we did. Again, we were cliffside, which does sacrifice proximity to the beach/restaurant/pools, for more space. Our room was very nice, with a full kitchen, washer/dryer, huge living/dining space, separate bedroom with adjoining bath, and a very large patio. We decided to enjoy coffee and breakfast on our own each morning on the patio while listening to the birds and the ocean. It was a perfect way to start our day. And while we were a short walk to the beach, we came to enjoy our strolls through the grounds each morning on our way to the beach. The service overall was fine. Front desk staff were friendly, and as helpful as they could be, but unlike a true "resort", you won't find a concierge here with lists of area restaurant recommendations or things to do in the area. There is no room service, but if you choose to stay in one of the villas with a kitchen, you can drive yourself to the local supermarket (a short drive), stock up, and prepare a meal or two on your own. My partner was celebrating his birthday during our stay, so prior to our arriving, I had spoken with one of the front desk staff about the possibility of arranging for a bottle of champagne and cake to be delivered to our room on his birthday. I was assured that this could easily be done by emailing a certain person at the resort with my request. She was to get back to me with a list of options, and then I could make my decision. This never happened. I never heard from this person, and when we arrived,much to my chagrin, I learned that it was not possible to have anything like that delivered to our room. Luckily, I was able to arrange this through the restaurant, however, I had to order the champagne and dessert, then carry the champagne, ice bucket, glasses, and dessert back to our room, and set it up myself. Any other resort/hotel I've ever stayed at has been able to accommodate this sort of request. Time share properties simply don't do it, and that's what this place is. That being said, the property itself is stunning! The grounds are lush and pristine and filled with birds and iguanas. When you arrive to the beach, you're immediately struck with how pristine and primitive it is. The waters are notoriously rough on this part of the island, but not so rough that you can't enjoy getting in for a swim, and we did that repeatedly every day. Located on a part of the island that seems to be surprisingly under-developed, we were able to take a stroll for several miles one day along the beach and passed exactly two other people! I don't think you can still find many places like this in the Caribbean today. We spent every day in two of the chaises set up on the grass, at the edge of the beach just reading and dozing, with surprisingly few other vacationers around. It was exactly the kind of quiet, private retreat we had been hoping for. Most evenings, we had dinner at Eclipse, the resort's main restaurant. The menu does not offer a huge selection, but what it does offer is delicious. I had fresh fish every single day, with the variety dependent upon what was caught and brought in that morning. How great is that?! We had many of the same waitstaff for the week, and they were all truly wonderful--friendly, attentive and eager to chat without being intrusive. One small incident at Eclipse on our last night there, did leave us feeling a bit irritated. We arrived for an early dinner and were told to take any seat we desired. We immediately went to one of two available tables at the edge of the restaurant, closest to the beach. When we sat down, one of the wait staff approached us and asked us to choose another table, as the one we were at was reserved. No big deal. We immediately got up, and sat ourselves at the other available beach-front table. Within thirty seconds, another of the wait staff approached us and told us that we would have to move again, because that table was also reserved. Earlier in the week, we had tried to make a reservation for dinner and were told that reservations were not accepted for parties that had less than six people. Fair enough. After moving to our new (third!) table, a party of two were seated at the first beach-front table we had been asked to vacate. Minutes later, a party of four were seated at the second table we had been asked to move from. From bits of conversation, we gathered that the party closest to us were some of the villa owners, so I'm assuming they were given priority seating over other guests (us). This, again, would likely not have happened at a true resort. Customer service is typically a high priority at such places. We felt a bit slighted and mildly insulted by it. In spite of a few shortcomings, we did have a wonderful vacation at the Villa Montana. Now that we know what to expect, we would definitely consider going back and have already recommended it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for a 4-5 day get-away!”
Reviews.Author: Emilia001
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a little less than a week at this very nice resort, located in the northwestern part of the island. It is a gated community, with a fantastic beach, excellent restaurant and very friendly, helpful, hospitable staff. We stayed in the hotel part of the resort (not in one of the villas) and although it was not as luxurious, it was still very nice. We had our own private balcony overlooking the grounds. The room was spacious enough, although we would more likely to take a suit if we ever go back. There is just not enough room to dry wet clothes, store food etc. the room does come with a small refrigerator, which was good to have to store some cold drinks. I used the pool only once, the water was clean but on the cold side, so I swam in the ocean instead. I also did some snorkeling for which the hotel provides you with the equipment, and it is very good snorkeling indeed. My husband did his jogging along the beach, which goes on for Ike's on end. The food at the restaurant was outstanding and reasonably priced. For breakfast we had the oatmeal and also the cornmeal which were definitely our favorites for Tate and health! The staff was uniformly very attentive, friendly, helpfull and deserves a 10! The only drawback about the resort is that it is 90 miles wet of San Juan and the drive from SJ is horrendous. It took us 2 1/2 hours and the latter part is like a very ugly Rt. 1 with more stoplights than you can shake a stick at. Fortunately, the resort is quite a ways from that road, so once you get there it is wonderful. I would suggest to fly in to the airport that is just a few miles from Isabela, it would be worth the extra cost. Make sure you do th horseback rides which is located right next door to the resort, and also visit the caves only 45 minutes away... Just ask the staff they know..

Reviews.Title: “A little piece of heaven - ahhhhhh!”
Reviews.Author: Joe and Maria S
Reviews.Content: If you want to know what heaven feels like, Villa Montana Beach Resort is the place to experience it on vacation. Enjoy peace and tranquility, private and pristine beaches, beautiful landscaping and accommodations, away from tourist attractions and crowds. Romance is in the air for couples! It is also a Yogiâ€™s dream vacation to a surferâ€™s delight. Villa Montana is inviting to all. There is a deep respect for the environment and the people and it has the most conscious and caring working staff. There is a coral reef preserve for miles. Therefore, no noisy motor craft of any kind is permitted. My husband and I have special diets and their expert chefs created fabulous meals for our entire stay. The food and all the service is just divine and the wonderful people there made our stay that much more enjoyable. All of our friends cannot wait to experience Villa Montana. It truly is a well hidden gem!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location, OK rooms”
Reviews.Author: Fitzofva
Reviews.Content: Villa Montana is located on a beautiful, somewhat secluded property and beach, but the rooms leave something to be desired. My wife and I agreed that this property is really a 3.5 (rather than a 4), but the property itself - and the adjoining restaurant - are wonderful. There is a good deal of old coral reefs in the adjacent water, so swimming is limited and you can definitely *not* let the kids go by themselves. One benefit of the reefs is that there is some surfing further out, and kite surfers abound, but this is not for beginners. One of the highlights for a visit here is a horseback ride on the beach, though a visit to the local bar, Ola Lola, which is run by a Michigan retiree, is worth it, too! The rooms are in definite need of updating, though the rooms and the grounds are well cared for.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent resort”
Reviews.Author: Joe_Mc_Hon
Reviews.Content: Great place to relax. Very limited cell phone service around the resort which for the most part added to the relaxation. The resort was booked up but it did not seem so at all. The beach was nearly emply, the only gathering of people was at the Eclipse Restaurant. The food the the restaurant was very good, the serice is laid back and can be a slow. I was here on busness and the room had Wifi but only cell service was from balcon which worked out perfectly for a relaxying busness stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful wedding location”
Reviews.Author: Patricia N
Reviews.Content: We had a large (175) wedding at Villa Montana with many of our guests staying there. The resort is lovely, the villas and rooms are spacious and beautifully appointed, the staff is outstanding, and the food is delicious. We recommend it wholeheartedly.

Reviews.Title: “Valentine's Day Weekend at Villa Montana”
Reviews.Author: AdventuresTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Villa Montana during Valentines day weekend and overall we had a beautiful time and excellent get away. This is truly a charming place on a beautiful beach. But, it's not really a "resort" as it doesn't offer resort like service. If you are accustomed to a certain level of resort then VM falls short but it's still very beautiful, charming in a low key way. I would imagine that anyone traveling to the west coast of Puerto Rico should know that this is probably the most upscale as it would get. The grounds are very lush, and tropical. The beach is beautiful and the overall feeling is very laid back and relaxed. They have a parrot by the entrance to the reception desk that greets you with a "hola" That was adorable. The service at the front desk was below average. They got the job done, but there was almost no signs of hospitality. It was more like an experience at the post office and not the start of a beautiful vacation. It's not a deal breaker but a smile doesn't hurt anyone. I'm a little confused over the rooms at this place. The first room we were given was in terrible condition. The sofa had a massive stain on the cushion and a ton of little stains all over. The closet doors were falling apart, over all it looked like this room had been neglected for a while. And it was full of mosquitoes, I was attacked within the first 3 minutes in the room. After calling the front desk to inform them of the room condition, in just a few short minutes, a very nice man came to escort us to view another room. This room was in much, MUCH better condition. We happily moved here. I'm guessing the villa's vary but the one we ended with had an old Spanish decor, full kitchen with everything you could possibly need. The room had a laundry room with a washer dryer. Housekeeping did a very good job. Eclipse bar and restaurant was excellent. The place was beautiful. The attention to detail in decore was truly amazing. The place is right on the beach.. It's breathtaking. The staff was AMAZING to us. This isn't a stuffy white glove type of place but more of a low key, chill on the beach with staff who become your friends in a matter of minutes. These guys were truly good people and provided great service. The drinks and food were EXCELLENT. Every menu item we tried was delicious. The beach was lovely, they had comfy loungers on the beach and lawn. While we were there is was never crowded and we got to sit anywhere we wanted and enjoy the peace and beautiful sunset. Areas in need of improvement: The towel set up was bad. You had to get towel from the front desk. It's not very convenient if you want them for the beach or pool. I can overlook this fact but the towels were in very pool condition. The room had some items that didn't function. The tv in the bedroom wasn't hooked up to the cable and we just never bothered calling anyone to correct this. The stereo was outdated. I think it was a cassette player. One of the speakers was stained. Not sure what's up with this.. but it was odd. There is no safe in the room (at least not one I was able to find) The walls in the hall way of the villa had a lot of scuff marks in them. For the price we paid for 4 days I think the place should be superb condition. Didn't look like the pool was cleaned daily, it was full of little leafs. Close to the airport. We now know the schedules for the evening flights in Aguadilla because every single night were heard the airplanes fly right over us at the same times. They sound VERY close and loud. I gave this resort a 4 rating because my overall trip was excellent. I am being generous with this rating if they had a 3.5 I would have given a solid 3.5. I stayed in other areas in PR in the past and I feel Villa Montana was much better than some of the higher rated hotels in SJ.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service in the Eclipse Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: mxalpert
Reviews.Content: We were told that the Eclipse Restaurant in the hotel was the best in the Isabela area, but the service was so slow that it didn't matter. We were there for almost 3 hours and most of the time we were waiting for something to happen. The food was tasty when it did come, but it was expensive and not worth it or the wait. I wouldn't even write this review about the poor service, but everyone we spoke to said that same thing.

Reviews.Title: “Take me back tomorrow! Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Paco M
Reviews.Content: We had the best holiday we could ask for in Isabela and everything was just perfect. The hotel staff are very welcoming and the level of cleanness was very good. The rooms are of good size and the set up as expected. But we did nto go there to adore the room because the beach and the lovely area was so good that we spent little time in the room. The beach is very clean and the hotel food was great and priced correctly. This was a very relaxing stay for us and I can see ourselves going back with more friends.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it!”
Reviews.Author: ivoryours
Reviews.Content: I did not stay a the Villa Montana Resort... but would love to on my next trip back. I toured the grounds and what a beautiful place its like a tropical Rain-forest / Fantasy Island. I found it to be one of the best places on the Island. Clean, the views are incredible! I did eat at the restaurant, which was very good, all the staff was very nice and kind. And it was great to eat and look out at the ocean view. I would have NO reasons not to come back. And would love to stay at th resort on the next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nearly ruined our vacation”
Reviews.Author: Heather M
Reviews.Content: The a/c didn't work, the toilet flushed only intermittently, and there was no hot water. We were offered a different room, which we thought was reasonable. However, we declined this offer because two men entered my room without knocking while I was sleeping with my daughter. I no longer felt that we (and my belongings) were safe at the property and informed the manager that we would be leaving early as a result. She didn't seem to think the incident was a big deal and told me that I would incur a penalty for leaving early (full price of the room). Since then I've spent over seven hours on the phone trying to resolve the issue to no avail. I strongly recommend against staying here, there are many better choices on the island.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Blanca V
Reviews.Content: A beautiful resort with nice staff and amazing food! The beach is a absolutely beautful aith magnificent sunsets. Water a little rough but pools are a great alternative. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Birthday party celebration in style!!”
Reviews.Author: Meganzub7
Reviews.Content: Wanted to say that my husband and I just celebrated our 30th and 40th birthdays there with 20 other family members and friends and it was outstanding!!! Mara and jeremie exceeded my expectations and helped me organize the best event ever! The food was 5 star quality and I highly recommend the chef jeremie! Mara helped us organize very elegant dinners that our guests thought were outstanding!!

Reviews.Title: “Restaurant needs attention ASAP!”
Reviews.Author: PRP1
Reviews.Content: We recently visited Villa MontaÃ±a restaurant Eclipse. We always do when we visit our family in Isabela because that is where we got married, and we have so many great memories of the place. The hotel grounds are very nice, well maintained. The view is spectacular! But, the restaurant needs SERIOUS attention. Eclipse menu is very appetizing but the service is horrible. We were seated right at 6:30pm which is I believe when the restaurant opens. There were maybe two other tables busy, but the restaurant was not full. The waiter was very nice, we ordered our food right away. We waited over 45 minutes for a salad and soup for appetizers and over an hour after that for our main dishes. I ordered a churrasco, it was super cold not very tasty and my husband ordered the risotto which was ok. We were so tired of waiting that we could not even enjoy our food. Definitely not coming back for dinner at Eclipse restaurant. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to relax and enjoy nature.”
Reviews.Author: Eleduard
Reviews.Content: Nicely located in front of the sea and with country accents. Beautiful rooms and facilities. Restaurant is just in from of the ocean and is very welcoming and relaxing. The only dislike, it is just a little expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Wedding---Peaceful / Tranquil Setting”
Reviews.Author: TD9
Reviews.Content: Our daughter chose Villa Montana for her October 1 destination wedding, and the setting was amazing. We had 26 people attend from various US locations, and all were very complimentary. The wedding, at sunset, by the ocean, was truly magical. The three wedding coordinators, Diana, Mara and Rose did an outstanding job of ensuring that all details were addressed and that the ceremony and reception went smoothly, The wedding itself was on the beach....and the reception was under a tent on the beach. The food was catered by the restaurant (Eclipse), and was excellent. A dance floor was installed under the tent on the beach. I must admit that I was apprehensive leaving so many of the wedding details to someone located so far away, but the flowers, make-up, hair, reverend, DJ, food, bar, cake and details were coordinated flawlessly. All of the coordinators are extremely conscientious about ensuring a memorable experience for everyone associated with the wedding. The remainder of the review is for those visitng for reasons other than a wedding. VM is a secluded, gated community of 1,2 and 3 bedroom villas owned by individuals......but rented out and cared for by an on-site management company. Many of the units are rented out ...while others are occupied by the current owners. Some are simple hotel rooms, while others have multiple bedrooms, sitting areas, and kitchens. The accommodations are very nice, but the experience is very different than one would experience at a large resort hotel. The setting is serene....no bright lights / late night activites....but rather a peaceful co-existence of you with nature. There is a long stretch of beach, most of which is very rocky and not suitable for swimming. The lounge chairs on the beach are very nice, and the atmosphere is very quiet. There are 2 pools on the grounds....one close to the restaurant/bar, and a larger one centrally located on the grounds. There is also a tennis court and rock climbing wall. The facilities are extremely clean and the grounds well kept. Each individual unit is decorated as per the individual owner's preferences....but maid service and maintenance needs are attended to by the management company....and any needs / requests are quickly responded to. Robin, the General Manager, can oftentimes be seen walking the grounds, talking to visitors (and owners). It is quite apparent that he has a great feel for the pulse of VM and really goes the extra mile to get to know everyone. The Eclipse restaurant has an excellent chef, and he has trained his staff well. The food is extremely well prepared. None in our party experienced long wait times, and most were at VM for 4-5 days. As we had many individual meals at the restaurant (in addition to the wedding), everyone had praise for the quality of food, selection and presentation. As mentioned in other reviews, VM is not for everyone, but if you are looking for a peaceful experience with nature, and an excellent restaurant, this facility in western Puerto Rico would be an excellent choice. The resort is about 10 minutes from Aguadilla airport....and 2 hours from San Juan airport.

Reviews.Title: “Where i want to live....”
Reviews.Author: David_T_1970
Reviews.Content: This is the first place I stayed in Puerto Rico, and rather than being like a hotel it's like living on an exclusive gated estate. With pool, tennis courts, horse riding and other activities all on site, a beautiful mile long deserted beach and and a beach-side restaurant/bar, Villa Montana was the perfect base to explore the west of the island from, but also great for just relaxing indoors or on the beach. The room was spotless, the service unintrusive but there when required...ok, its not cheap - but it's worth the money....i can't wait to go back....and one day, I WILL be able to purchase one of their villas.....

Reviews.Title: “Just what i needed!!!”
Reviews.Author: Natasha S
Reviews.Content: Thank God i found this place! Thats literally what i kept thinking throughout my trip. Im from miami and really wanted to find somewhere with nice weather, just more relaxing, i wanted to GET AWAY and get away did. The place is very cute! Its a bunch of small individual villas on the beach, so great views. I had a simple hotel room with a King bed for my boyfriend and i, and the room was fully loaded (i guess you would say?) it had a little kitchenette, bath tub, tv/dvd/cable/, balcony, etc etc The areas were also very nice, everything is green green palmtrees flowers etc! The staff was great, cant complain, they would walk through the beach taking drink orders all day.. I dont even have that much to say because im so happy with the entire trip, were plannign our next visit to Villa Montana since its only like a 2hr flight to miami, we want to visit monthly!

Reviews.Title: “A very, very nice beachfront hotel”
Reviews.Author: cnkNewYork
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights and enjoyed it very much. Our room was a 'cliffside' room, in a building towards the back of the resort. It had a view of the water that could be seen through the palm trees ( probably a good view when the trees were smaller), with a nice terrace outfitted with a table and chairs. The room was large and well appointed. It was furnished with heavy carved mahogany furniture, very nice sheets, and had a frig and coffee maker in the room. The only downside was that the room was on the third floor, and we carried our luggage up the stairs. Because alot of the villas are privately owned and probably vacant alot of the time, the whole resort is very quiet, and feels almost unoccupied. The beach is fine, this was a great place to unwind and relax.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced terrible service”
Reviews.Author: Robert F
Reviews.Content: While the grounds are very pretty and this should be a nice place, the staff, the maintenance of the rooms, and especially the restaurant are terrible. The rooms are not as nice as pictured on the website and have measurable amounts of dust on the floors and heavy cobwebs in the corners. The restaurant, the only place to eat at the facility, is truly horrid. The staff is rude but the wait times are outrageous. For one bowl of soup for our daughter we waited over 45 minutes. When I asked when the meal would arrive, after an hour of waiting, the waitress snapped at me "this is not a fast food restaurant!" - as if I had never been to a restaurant in my life. Literally, no one at the facility said please or thank you. A mess!

Reviews.Title: “Strange and unnecessarily disappointing place”
Reviews.Author: ChrisWashDC
Reviews.Content: This is one strange place -- on one hand, in a beautiful secluded setting with a nice (albeit rocky in places) stretch of beach. It has what appear on the outside to be tastefully designed rooms and villas on or near the beatch. There are two nice pools, a playground, and a restaraunt. But looks are very deceiving at this place (something the Lonely Planet review clearly missed regarding this hotel). As others have painfully noted, this appears to be some kind of time share as well, and the hotel customers seem to be treated like second class citizens -- a stunning indiference from management given the price of this place. For example, the first room we were offered (a single) was dirty and despressing with water and burn marks on the furniture and a bathroom straight out of a roadside motor lodge. The two bedroom we upgraded to (at our expense) was fun for the family, but also had strange obvious signs of neglect. Incredibly, each morning we were there starting at 9am for two hours or so, there were people with ear piercing leaf blowers all over the property (at times blowing a few wet blades of grass over a mind numbing period of time when it could have been done with a broom in a few minutes). Forget about eating or sitting outside each morning -- or enjoying the pool for that matter during these times. Once there was even a staff member leaf blowing wet seaweed on the beach after a strorm! Then throughout the day the staff would buzz around on incredibly loud 4 wheelers with apparently no mufflers -- simply incredible for a high priced resort. Finally, one night (a Wednesday) we took our lilttle kids to the ocean front restaraunt at 6pm or so only to be overwhelmed by a loud DJ -- and again indifference to guests who might want to have a reasonably quiet meal with others (who knows how people in rooms dealt with the noise blasting from there for hours). Management seemed indifferent and or oblivious to the distirubances for guests (or long terms time share owners one would think as well) that all of the above created to the otherwise secluded property. Sadly, this place is incredibly overpriced for the quality and service. We stayed in a reward-points room at the Sheraton in Old San Juan after this visit before flying home and were treated like royalty compared to the Villa Montana -- although anything would at that point!

Reviews.Title: “If you are handicapped this is not for you!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jr3833
Reviews.Content: The handicapped rooms are very hard to access and the parking lot is not at all close to the unit. The rooms are very small which make it hard to manuver around in a wheelchair. There are no grab bars in the bathroom . My husband is an amputee and it was murder staying here for a week. The place itself itself it lovely as is the beach and gardens that surroud it however handicapped acessible is a stretch.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise facilitated”
Reviews.Author: Suwongruiz
Reviews.Content: A little trepidation from all the mixed reviews but we had nothing to worry about. Either we got lucky or the management has changed. no problems with service at all - everyone encountered were friendly & professional. This is like a gated community with a private beach & a pretty sensationally appointed restaurant. If you're looking for direct oceanfront views, look elsewhere. If looking for secluded beauty, this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Don't book this hotel”
Reviews.Author: nickcorey
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were wanting to go to Puerto Rico for the first time and saw Villa Montana and thought the experience would be something amazing. We flew in from SJU and not only did it take us 4 hours to drive there but it took us 4 hours because every time we called for directions the workers told us a different route. No one knew where to go. They don't even have an address. THIS PLACE IS NOT ON THE BEACH FRONT. You literally have to drive to the beach. Once you get to the beach, it is DIRTY and MOLDY and we didn't even get into the water because of all the mold. The resort was private and quiet but it was also not as advertised and too expensive for something not even on the beach. They also only gave us one towel each for our 5 day stay, did not change our bed sheets, did not change our trash. We had several times where our trash was overflown and we had to pile it on top of other trash. Also, for two of the days we had to take cold showers because the plumbing was out. We also couldn't flush the toilet. This was a horrible experience! Last thing: at all times of the night, even at 3 am, you hear planes flying by.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect setting for our daughter's wedding”
Reviews.Author: MarSolyCoqui
Reviews.Content: Our daughter got married last month along with 50 family members and close friends from PR and the states with blue skies and an endless ocean as a backdrop. The food prepared by Chef Jeremy for the rehearsal dinner at the O room on Friday night, and during the cocktail hour and reception on Saturday at the Eclipse restaurant were outstanding. The flowers were gorgeous, and the bonfire after the reception dinner was a lot of fun. The staff at VM, especially Mara, our wedding planner, Diana, our flower coordinator and Angela, in charge of room reservations made it a dream come true. They made planning a destination wedding an easy task. Everyone from the front desk to housekeeping and the restaurant staff was friendly, courteous, and willing to help make our stay a memorable one. The villa accommodations were great and the outdoor shower was a hit. We are looking forward to going back to enjoy this piece of paradise off the beaten path. Muchas gracias.

Reviews.Title: “Most romantic wedding”
Reviews.Author: Annette212
Reviews.Content: We had the most perfect afternoon wedding at Villa Montana. Every thing was just perfect , The wedding was coodinated by Mara Morales , a very professional , friendly,young women as well as her coworker Diana, From the biginning untill very last moment every detail of our wedding was taken care of. The beach was picture perfect , the restraurant wonderfull , the food exquisite and the room was just right and also loved the extra touch of rose petals in bedroom , strawberries and champagne. It was a wedding to remember, a dream wedding. Loved every moment of our stay. Thank You very much to the Villa wedding coordinators and personel. Definitely will recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: 2trvlppl
Reviews.Content: The location feels as if you have just fallen into quiet time. It is beautiful. Just understand that this is a time share community with full time residents and that this is not a night life hotel. Also understand that the units are not really on the beach. The restaurant area is gorgeous, and the dining is absolutely delicious...so much so that we still are talking about the meals. The waitstaff is fun and efficient, and the desk staff is helpful. The maintenance staff is simply the best. Housekeeping, we did not see, and they must not have seen too much of our space, either. It is a good thing that maintenance was the best because those men were needed everywhere. Our stay was relaxing, and we really wish that it could have been perfect because the location would be great for an extended stay. However, the cleanliness and the supplies in the room and the working order of the room really were disappointing...almost a two star hotel. We were looking for a place to book for an extended stay later; there were too many issues at the price charged to make a return visit a possibility. That is a shame because the restaurant is wonderful and the location lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Need a lot of caring!”
Reviews.Author: carmen_trias
Reviews.Content: The beach is pretty, as all the beaches of Puerto Rico. The landscaping is beautiful. The village was in very badly state and dirty. It needs a remodelacion urgently, and a better care. I can't walked barefoot , the floor was so dirty. The sofa bed was broken and full of ants. Better another place.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Location for A Wedding!”
Reviews.Author: shadow1980
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time at Villa Montana - it was my second time there and we went there to get married. My wedding was amazing! The staff is very friendly and accomodating. The location is gorgeous and it's not touristy. Beautiful snorkeling at the beach in front.

Reviews.Title: “A resort with NO amenities or service”
Reviews.Author: busnbay
Reviews.Content: After a ton of research on Puerto Rico, I booked a vacation for my family in the less bustling and commerical town of Isabela. Isabela is known for great secluded beaches. This resort is actually closer to Aguaduilla. Upon arriving we noticed that the resort is not quite on the beach. The restaurant and two or three small villas are the only places with sea views. We were staying in Unit C5. We drove around the complex for five plus minutes trying to find the buidling as the sign with the unity number was missing. A housekeeper lead us there. There of course was not a bellman or anyone to take you or your luggage to your villa. We were also given four bath towels to use as beach towels and were told we would be chanrged if they were not returned. The beach is very rocky and dangerous for swimming. the views are beautiful on the beach and they had very nice beach and pool furniture. The staff was not very friendly and extrememly slow at the restaurant. The main restaurant was closed for a wedding on one night of our stay. We also asked to use the bicycles they list on their brochiure and on line and were told they did not have any. We then asked about kayaks and were told they don;t have any. We finally asked for the snorkel equipment and they only had three sets for our family of four. Although the unit was very nice and quite large, it was not worth the money . Our room was not cleaned until 6:30pm one of the days and I was told to be patient they did not get to it yet! When I spoke to the manager about my concerns , she put together a list of thinkgs to do in the area (a few free), most that were additional charges that we could drive to. When I asked for local restaurant menus they also did not have that! Oh yes, and our final day, we went in the early am to get towels for the day and they did not have them yet. The service is non existant. If I were to go again I would try Villa Tropical which is on the beach, less advertised but looks even nicer. Their units are on the beach and in front of a wonderful and calm swimming area.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, releaxing, beautiful grounds, with some caveats”
Reviews.Author: Glob3trotterz
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 days in April '11 in search of peace and relaxation and that's exactly what we got. If you are looking for a party this is not the place for you - you will be bored. VM is a small resort made up of a series of 1, 2, and 3 storey buildings that house studio through 2-bedroom suites and villas - all are individually owned with many that are rented out as lodging through the VM office. The quality/amenities of your unit will depend on the individual owner's desires and tastes. Check in is at 4pm and it didn't seem like exceptions were being made for early arrivals. Some of the buildings have a top floor (2nd or 3rd) containing 'hotel rooms' that have basic amenities such as queen bed, closet, bathroom, mini fridge and coffee maker. The hotel unit we stayed in was simple, but nicely furinished with hand-carved furniture and was very clean. The bed was surprisingly comfortable and the towels were softer than one would expect. Our unit was in the back of the resort against the limestone cliffs and we didn't mind the extra 3 minutes it took us to walk to the beach. We did not see the inside of the suites or villas. There are two restaurants, Eclipse and 'O'. Eclipse is the beachside restaurant and bar and has a serene, spa-like feeling to it with billowing white cotton curtains and warm carved wood tables and chairs. We ate a variety of meals there and they were all very good. We did not eat at O as it was only open on Saturday of our visit, but it looked fantastic and served North African cuisine. Eclipse food prices are on par with NYC/Chicago/SF prices so that might be a bit higher than some would want. If you have a suite with a kitchen, we recommend hitting the Econo grocery store in Aguidilla just after you leave the airport and stock up there. Pros: Gorgeous, serene resort with beautiful, well manicured grounds. Igaunas, herons, and parrots outnumber the people. The two on-site pools were mostly empty except for a couple of families with small children. The resort's beach goes on for miles in each direction with literally no other beachside development either way. We walked for an hour in each direction each day and barely saw a soul but did see quite a few folks on horseback on the beach Cons: Staff was friendly but didn't go out of their way to be helpful unless asked and even then it wasn't Ritz-like service. The wait time for food at Eclipse was exceptionally long - 30 mins at a minimum but it wasn't unusual to wait 45-60 mins. Not sure why, as Eclipse only seats about 30 people. The beach, while beautiful and deserted, is not great for swimming, especially for small children. It is somewhat rocky and being on the Atlantic has a strong current and heavy wave action (which the surfers seemed to enjoy). There was a protective reef at Shacks beach about 100 yards away that looked more calm and we saw families going there. As one other reviewed mentioned, they do a lot of weddings there - both Friday and Saturday night during our visit. What this means is that Eclipse will be closed and you will hear music until about 10pm if you are in one of the oceanfront units. We didn't mind it, but if you think that will be a problem, call ahead and ask if there are any weddings scheduled during your stay. If you do need to eat out, just up the entrance road is a wonderfully simple restaurant shack called Ola Lala's where the owners cook up excellent local food in their carport and garden. They draw a crowd of locals and visitors but are only open on Fri, Sat, Sun, Mon. There are a few restaurants in Jobos but neither the Happy Belly or Oceanside were remarkable other than for their breathtaking beachside location. The food at both was mediocre at best - go for drink at sunset. There is a small fitness center with 1 treadmill and 6 cybex weight machines and a set of Bowflex SelectTech dumbells. We never say anybody using it during out stay. To reiterate, this is not a party resort and your party options in the area are limited. However, if you can be self-sufficient, this is a solid place to get away, unwind and disconnect.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved This Place”
Reviews.Author: jmstorm
Reviews.Content: But you might not if you are looking for big metal+glass resort with five restaurants and a night club. Villa Montana is a group of cottages and larger buildings with a variety of room styles. Some are rather small. Some are almost as big as your house. All are nicely decorated. But it is the location and ambiance that sets this place apart. Everything moves slowly; the breezes blow; you are really removed from the cares of the world in this quiet corner of Puerto Rico. It was wonderful for the little kids, a little pool (in addition to a bigger one) and a great jungle-gym thing. Adult "activities" are a bit limited, especially when the surf makes ocean swimming difficult. (It never was when we were there, but it is the Atlantic, not the Caribbean, so it can be rough.) The resort is self-contained, and you can just loll around your whole vacation, but we would recommend renting a car, viewing the countryside and getting out to other restaurants .

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location. Memorable family vacation.”
Reviews.Author: jmv227
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed with our toddler son in a hotel room. Pros: Feel of seclusion, very not crowded. Wide open spaces, very well-maintained. Our son loved to wander around and it was a treat to watch him explore and see for the first time ant colonies, birds (gulls, egrets, changos, hummingbirds, parakeets...), iguanas, lizards...there was a flock of egrets just outside the resort. A beautiful beach. To the left is miles of wild beach to explore and not see a single soul. To the right is great reefs to snorkel and a calmer tidal pool area perfect for young children. Their beach was nice umbrellas and beach chairs. So few people that you can spread out and never have to worry about a place. Two nice pools. They put a lot of effort into maintaining the grounds. The staff is personable. Ramon is the guy to go to for the inside scoop on where to eat and what to do. The villa residents are friendly and will do the same. Very easy to get to from BQN airport. Unfortunately, times are a little weird these days (red-eyes and such). The restaurant is good. Judging from other places, this seems to be the highest-end place in Isabela/Aguadilla. Insides of rooms nicely decorated with beautiful tile floors and yellows and oranges to give it a zen monastery vibe, also wooden furnishings such as the bedframe. General manager knowledgable about outdoor pursuits. Cons: shower was unreliable. one day water stopped. hot water not consistent, not top of the line stuff. have to go back to main lodge to exchange beach towels. loud airplane noise, sometimes at night. Not too frequent though a bit far removed from other places so a car is a must if you are to escape overpriced restaurant (only one open while we were there). A bit disorienting at first. The resort's business is divided into villas which are purchased or rented and then the hotel side, which at points seems like an afterthought. The effect is that their hoteling is not up to snuff at times. You have to ask around about which restaurants are recommended rather than their offering this to you. Something was just missing comparing this to say JW Marriott or Doubletree. No newspaper (maybe that's a good thing). Also, spotty cell service on the resort. NOTE: do not book this through jetblue vacations. they charge more than if you were to book the hotel and flight yourself.

Reviews.Title: “I couldn't have asked for a nicer spot for my wedding”
Reviews.Author: TenderLeigh
Reviews.Content: This exceeded my expectations. Granted, this is not a five star hotel. But we are average working class people, so I was pleasantly surprised. I was scared from some negative reviews, but decided to have my small wedding there, sight unseen, and at the last minute too. Am I so glad I did ! The Gazebo at the beach was the perfect spot. The beach backdrop was just lovely. My wedding coordinator, Mara was awesome and couldn't have been nicer. I did everything on short notice and she pulled everything off. In fact, every staff member I spoke to was very nice, helpful and cordial. We stayed in two, 2 bedroom garden villas. They were spacious, roomy and had everything from a fridge, stove, microwave, toaster, washer dryer to a living/dining room with a nice patio. Our grown children all in there 20's/30, had a good time at the beach and pools. The food at Eclipse was wonderful for the wedding and a good time was had by all. The waiter assigned to our party was wonderful. One of my guests said he would definitely be back with his family for a vacation . I will be back for an anniversary or two without the family ! Since they do one wedding at a time on the weekends and focus a lot of their energy for that wedding, I would recommend staying during the week for a regular vacation. I recommend doing the wedding planning Mondays through Wednesdays. Although they were able to do my last minute wedding and I couldn't have asked for more, I would advise planning in advance to reduce the stress and explore all options.

Reviews.Title: “The most relaxing place and best wedding location you will ever find....”
Reviews.Author: firebirdgirl
Reviews.Content: We recently had the pleasure of having our wedding hosted by Villa Montana. The 3-day event was 18 months in the making, all via e-mails and telephonically, which makes it a little difficult for wedding planning. If you do decide to choose VM as your wedding locale, just remember that they do this every weekend so they won't miss anything. The background is SOOO spectacular that you really should not nitpik about anything else, and you and your guests will enjoy the whole experience. We had a welcome/rehearsal dinner the Friday night before at the "O" Restaurant. The food was delicious, the restaurant beautiful, and the staff attentive. After dinner, everyone headed down to the beach for a bonfire. Our guests brought liquor, beer, and beach snacks purchased at a nearby grocery store, and we had a grand old time enjoying tunes at the beach on a beautiful evening. On Saturday, everyone had enough time to enjoy the beautiful beach weather during the morning and early afternoon while watching the staff transform the gazebo to a beautiful ceremony location. Our wedding coordinators, Diana and Mara, even pitched in to help take our lunch orders at the Eclipse Restaurant so that we could get in and out before getting ready for the wedding. The wedding was absolutely gorgeous - take your breath away gorgeous. The reception was so much fun. Everything was top-notch as far as food and service througout the entire stay. Contrary to some reviewers, we had a nice wedding cake, in addition to a trio of awesome desserts to serve our guests. Also, remember that you are on vacation, so take a chill pill, relax, and just expect that the service will be slower than what you are used to. The grounds were immaculate. The rooms were clean, very spacious and comfortable. The only complaints from our wedding guests were the following: 1) shower water was lukewarm at best. Luckily it is warm outside, so it is not so bad. Don't count on ever getting a scalding hot shower. 2) the shower and sink drains were a little slow. 3) the mixed drinks were a little weak. I think it was because we ate soooo much good food to soak up the alcohol. 4) some of the rooms were not ready by check-in time of 4:00 pm. They were ok with this though, as they just strolled around the grounds, enjoying the scenery, until the room was done. 5) one group was getting ready immediately prior to the wedding ceremony when the maids came by to clean. They asked the maids to come back in 30 minutes when they would be at the ceremony. Instead, the maids never came back and never cleaned the room or provided towels. (We didn't even know about this until we came back home). Otherwise, this was the perfect location for our wedding. The backdrop is so gorgeous - the sunset, the lush greenery (as opposed to ugly highrise hotels in your wedding photos), and the beach! If you are also looking for a beach wedding location, I highly recommend this place. We are already planning on going back next year for our anniversary. Thank you Villa Montana for making my wedding dreams come true!

Reviews.Title: “Our third visit--it's still great.”
Reviews.Author: Manhattan2
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a delightful 10 day vacation at Villa Montana, our third visit to the resort. Villla Montana sits on the northwest corner of Puerto Rico.and is a short 31/2 hour flight from New York into Aguadilla on either Continental or Jet Blue. The resort is only a 15 minute drive from the airport. That said, Villa Montana feels cozy and secluded. The resort sits on a lovely beach on the Atlantic side of Puerto Rico that offers larger waves than the Caribbean. Walking west on the beach for about 20 minutes there are huge, beautiful rock formations and along the way tidepools of marine life. Walking east the white sand beach stretches for miles and there are many areas for snorkeling. Next door there is a stable that offers horsebackriding on the beach. We stayed in a one bedroom bungalow steps away from the beach, but staying anywhere on the resort grounds is a short walk to the beach. Villa Montana is under new management and it shows. There are new lawn chairs, the employees are still friendly and accommodating and refurbishment of the grounds and the rooms is in progress. We used the bungalowâ€™s mini kitchen for breakfast and lunch but dined at the resort restaurant every night. The food was great, the service excellent and the location, right on the beach, was lovely. Listening to the surf break while dining by candlelight was peaceful and romantic. There are many local restaurants and while we did not try it, we were told that the local Thai restaurant was outstanding. The resort provides a small gym and a spa although the spa was not operating while we were there due to renovation. . There was a wedding during our stay but it did not inconvenience us in the least. I would highly recommend The Villa Montana for a quiet, relaxing holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be worst!!!”
Reviews.Author: isamar10
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed in such a bad hotel. They treat us like we were nothing, from the manager, recepcionist, to the wedding coordinator, everybody. They show you the best pictures of the resort, what you get is a humid, smelly room, the beach is all rocky so you can't swim at all unless you are an expert. The restaurant is run by the worst chef, meaning, fancy names for everyday food at a price of a 5 star rest. The wedding coordinator was very disrespectful, she even offer a wonderful cake for the wedding. Wow, what a dissapoinment, what my sister got was the most horrible cake a bride can have from the look to the taste. Not only that, she didn't even apologyze for it and my sister had to pay full price for it, $700. Don't waste your money in this place, there is many places to go a lot cheaper and much, much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Be prepared to age mightily before you get any food”
Reviews.Author: Quinoy
Reviews.Content: For the first time ever I am embarrassed to be from Puerto Rico. I had guests at the Villa Montana and have always prided myself in the fact that service on the island was not the nightmare of the other southern islands. Today I was proven wrong. Where do I start? It took nearly three hours to get lunch! Never OK but less so when you have ordered a salad and a ham cheese sandwich with fries for two kids under 4! Three times talking to the waitress to at least get the kids food out a d three times the same vacuous "let me check with rhe chef" response. Ok so then let's get a drink. PiÃ±a Colada please just to hear rhe we don't have any. Followed by yes we do but we can make it with vodka! Who runs this place! Coco Lopez, canned or fresh pineapple and rum are readily available everywhere on the island. I can even stop at a roadside station and get this! And after all this amazing dini g experience they expect a big tip and reco. As a puerto Rican it pains me to say that we have list the sense of service and just have no clue. No wonder the Dominican Republic is getting all the the tourism.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous place. Staff too busy.”
Reviews.Author: travellingflower38
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in February 2010. Gorgeous setting and nice rooms, but management seemed harried dealing with a wedding while we were staying there. In the morning, the Eclipse restaurant was closed in preparation for the wedding. That was a problem because it's such a remote setting--no other options. They eventually opened the "O" lounge for a continental breakfast and charged $20/person for the fruit and yogurt. We were obviously disappointed in the food service, but the hotel and resort itself were just beautiful and we hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “Surfers YES, Weekend w/the boys YES; Special weekend w/girlfriend NO...”
Reviews.Author: KDGS-Traveler
Reviews.Content: Restaurant/bar great, friedly staff; but outdated/old/poor condition rooms. Pictures on web site are very mis leading. We saw 3 rooms till we gave up and bit the bullet (and paid an upgrade cost) on the last room. The property is very beautiful, but the accommodations are not. The staff does the best w/what they have. This is not the stay we were expecting.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular setting, comfy room and great food!”
Reviews.Author: TravelGuru1000
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Villa Montana, and loved the layout of the resort in small separate "bungalows" which included several guest rooms each. Our room had a nice balcony overlooking the resort, which featured tennis courts, two pools, and a wonderful restaurant (try the seafood Mofongo and Shrimp Lemongrass soup!). The chef is top-notch and was recognized as the top chef in the Caribbean in 2009. The highlight of the resort is a stunning beach, which is very picturesque and not crowded at all. Also, they had an adorable parrot who tells guests "hello!" and climbs right over to meet you in his cage:) The resort is in the NW of Puerto Rico, which is known as a prime area for both regular and wind-surfing (Isabela hosted the 2010 World Surfing Championships), but is also supposed to be nice for snorkeling and scuba diving when waters are calmer (the waves were quite strong when we were there in December). It is in a fairly remote area, so it is best for visitors looking for a quiet, romantic experience. If you want a lively night scene, you're better off staying in San Juan or a larger resort. The only negative experience we had during our stay was our first guest room, which had hot water problems. However, the resort addressed our complaint by transferring us to a new room that evening. Overall, a wonderful resort which we highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “A Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Newb0mb
Reviews.Content: "My wife, two daughters, 9 and 7, and I just returned from our stay in Villa Montana and have nothing but great things to say. We had stayed 2 days in San Juan and drove the trek to the northwest. The drive from San Juan was very easy and took about 90 minutes. The pictures don't do it justice. The villa was clean, beautiful and had everything we needed. My daughters slept in the pull out couch. The kitchen had everything we needed although we needed to buy simple things such as condiments, salt and pepper, etc since their were no stock food items, which is understandable. The place is supplied with two snorkel sets in good condition, a beach cooler, clean sheets and towels. The washer and dryer was convenient. The only drawback was I could not hook up to the wireless internet, hey who needs to be connected when you should be relaxing, right? Villa Montana itself was beautiful, easy-paced, and friendly. The kid's playground was nice. The two pools are beautiful and the restaurant, The Eclipse, had delicious food as we ate there two nights. The service is a bit relaxed, island pace, but attentive. The location to the beach was an easy walk from our villa. The surf was up a bit and made snorkeling a bit difficult with a bit of wavy water and a slight current. Late spring and summer are best when the water is calmer. The beach is rocky in spots and was difficult for swimming for the kids with the waves and rocks. Down the beach to the east, right, had more protected swimming and snorkeling areas past Villa Tropical. The beach has extremely comfortable beach chairs with umbrellas, great for lounging. I used my stand up paddle (SUP) board to paddle around and surf about 100 yards off at Shack's Beach. We walked the deserted beaches both ways for a mile or two to explore and just to be at ease. We did two stints with the family at Tropical Trail Rides, which is right next door. The guides were friendly and the horse are well taken care of. Our daughters, who have only had a few riding lessons, had no problems with their horses. Everyone was so helpful and friendly. We had quick and easy access to the grocery store and restaurants a few minutes up the road. We took excursions to Crash Boat beach. I also did two excursions to Wilderness to surf with Jose from Aquatica Dive and Surf. He was more than accommodating and helpful with my SUP rentals. This place is great for both the active and for those who just want to relax. We plan on coming back next year.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: islandshoppers
Reviews.Content: The trip was San Juan was 2 1/2 hrs not 90 mins and the signs for the resort were very hard to see in the dark. When we finally arrived they couldn't find our reservation; luckily, we had all of our documents from the travel agency. Instead of a cliffside room we were 'upgraded' to a room closer to the beach. If this was an upgrade I would have hated to see the orginial room. This room was very small! We had to ask 3 times during our 7 day stay for an additional washcloth and hand towel - they would only leave 1 of each. On Thanksgiving night we were awaken by the people next door talking loudly and slamming things in a sink. Calling the front desk only received voicemail. The next morning was awaken by someone blowing their nose and coughing. The rooms are not very well insulated. The service at the Eclipse was very slow for the evening meal even though there was only a couple of other tables occupied. Food wasn't good and felt it was overpriced. Breakfast was very good and Nicole was very pleasant! Found a very friendly resturant closer to town and the food was great! With the resort being close to an airport it was very noisy and seemed to be more during the evening and late evening. I live close to an airport with a National Guard base, but there was a couple of times at thought a plane would be coming through our room. The beach was a disappoint since they recommended not to swim and it was rocky. We'll return to Puerto Rico, but not this resort.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite hotels”
Reviews.Author: kkennedyy
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd stay in Villa Montana and weÂ´ll be back in 2011 again. This hotel runs like a clock and the staff are a real asset but the best thing they have to offer is the location; away from the madness of this world and a place to wind down. Rooms are very clean and always smell nice and fresh and the food is better than many michelin star restaurants we have been to. We cannot fault this hotel one bit and we just adore it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for our wedding. But, Horrible wedding planners, management, etc.”
Reviews.Author: ccarazo
Reviews.Content: We started our September 2010 wedding planning in February of 2010. We live in the U.S. and though it seemed like a lot to plan in 7 months after talking with the wedding planners over the phone we felt more comfortable that all would work out. We flew to Puerto Rico in March to hash out all of the minor details. After spending two days at the resort, again with the wedding planner we thought everything was great. We discussed the ceremony private table for myself and my spouse (sweetheart table), discussed that though a wedding was planned the day after ours that during our weddding - their rehearsal dinner would be on the other side of the beach so that our events wouldn't disturb one another, we discussed a pig roast, we discusseed the rooms for my entire family of 30, discussed the flavor of our cake and the design, etc. However, as we were getting closer to the event we realized that though everything appeared to be going great - IT WASN'T!!! The more downpayments we paid and the closer we got to the date the more unorganized the wedding planners were. The wedding planner we THOUGHT was handling our wedding ended up giving all of her responsibilities to another wedding planner which ended up in numerous phone calls to myself having to reiterate and explain EVERYTHING we flew to Puerto Rico to organize. But that was just the beginning! Once arriving in Puerto Rico, 5 days before the wedding, everything just went crazy!! Most of the rooms that were booked for my family were double booked. Meaning, I was charged the deposits for many rooms twice. Do the math for 30 guests! In addition, many of my family when checking out were over charged - the most was over $1,000.00 and they had to file a dispute with their bank! The day of the wedding things that were promised to me when organizing our wedding were all of a sudden forgotten. The rehearsal dinner was RIGHT next door to our ceremony, the cake flavors were completely wrong. Oh, and where were we sitting for dinner AT OUR OWN WEDDING!! They forgot our table! The flowers were completely different than what we ordered.... You get the picture. Luckily, we had a great photographer and though the nice wedding planners we had at the begininning ended up being the most unorganized, unprofessional people I HAVE EVER MET, at least the new General Manager would take care of us after our departure. We were overcharged for our wedding by almost $1500.00. We ae still watiing for almost $500.00 of our money which is still in dispute! Great location for a wedding. My family is from Puerto Rico and was excited to get married in a country where so many of family is from. To get married there was wonderful. It could have been so much more wonderful if only Villa Montana was run proficiently. They are so unorganized and when we get frustrated they look at us like we are complaining! However, when you pay close to $20k for a wedding that is the least that we deserve.

Reviews.Title: “Take me back any day”
Reviews.Author: ifaloves2travel
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels in my life but for some reason the magic of Villa Montana has enchanted me so much that I had to write a review about it. This hotel was perfect for us and the friendly staff, the location and the friendly service we received at this hotel were just out of this world. It is ever so romantic and so charming that I would especially recommend it to honeymooners. My regards to all Villa Montana staff and I am sure that we will see you next summer. xxxIfa

Reviews.Title: “Ignore childish bad comments. It exceeded our expectations.”
Reviews.Author: MaggieAlwaysRocks
Reviews.Content: IÂ´m more of a reader than a writer but felt I had to step in and clarify a few points about this hotel. This is a fantastic hotel and way exceeded our expectations! Please ignore the few negative comments as they are untrue and very misleading. Infact I almost booked somewhere else because of them but I am so glad I didnÂ´t. It seems some ignorant poeple that have obviously never travelled much expect 6 star luxury at these prices! I do not exaggerate and can honestly say this is a very good standard hotel and is fantastic for what you pay. A good value hotel in a great location with friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “10 out of 10!”
Reviews.Author: karina1057
Reviews.Content: What a trip! One of those vacations you are still talking about and recalling memories of years later. The hospitality of the staff and beauty of that beach will stay with us forever. Food was great, rooms were lovely and the whole experience was fantastic. If you are questioning which place to stay at in P.R. donÂ´t...this is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Ripped us off”
Reviews.Author: stevemak
Reviews.Content: We booked an ocean view room for 3 nights here via Expedia. When we arrived, we were notified that there were no ocean view rooms available, but one would be opening up the next day that we could move into for the rest of the stay. When we attempted to switch rooms the next day, we were told (after 2-3 hours of waiting around in the afternoon) that there would be no ocean rooms available for the rest of the weekend. We were told that if we chose to move to another hotel (we did), we would be refunded for the two nights that we didn't use. Not only were we not refunded the money for these nights, we were not even refunded the difference between the regular room we were placed in and the ocean view room that we booked. I made more than twenty phone calls to both the hotel and Expedia, but we were always told that "the manager" wasn't around to process the refund. So my advice to anyone that stays here: don't book an ocean room, and call to make sure there isn't a wedding during your stay (the main restaurant was closed for the entire weekend).

Reviews.Title: “NOT a RESORT as New Englanders would imagine”
Reviews.Author: JunkYardDogCt
Reviews.Content: The beach is definitely was makes this place but other than that not much going for it. The Eclipse restaurant is nothing to brag about and the accommodations are lacking. Our room is soooo small. It has a queen size bed with one side table, a small dresser and a refrigerator. The room does not have a chair or anything where you can lay your stuff on but kudos for the nice mahogany four poster bed. I'm not sure if this is a timeshare kind of place .... but it certainly seems like it. The road where our room is located has a small kids basketball hoop and a skate board ramp just left behind on the road. It's not like an Aruba, Jamaica or Punta Cana type of a resort. Beach is often empty and lots of beach chaise lounger with umbrella's. Again, if you're just looking for an average accommodation with a great beach - this is ok but if you're looking for more luxury resort type -- this is not it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Wedding!”
Reviews.Author: travelbug1422
Reviews.Content: Villa montana is a beach resort that is hidden away in the mountains. It has limited wi-fi and basically no cell phone service, which has it's pros (quiet/relaxation away from crazy life) and cons (no contact with friends and family lost on their way to VM). The beach is relatively small and rocky in some areas. VM does provide some comfortable beach chairs, and the beach is never overcrowded with people since it is only for guests. The villas are all a little diferent. Some are multi-level villas. They are all decorated differently, depending on the owner of the villa. The older villas are closer to the beach and the newer/nicer villas are the furthest. The only con about the villas and hotel rooms is that they are dusty and some have bug (cockroaches & ants) problems. After living in PR for a year, I can understand how hard it is to get rid of those bugs though. VM just needs to have the friendly pest control visit more often. What I loved about VM is that it helped bring my friends and family closer together during my wedding weekend. My friends and family stayed here all weekend. They hosted villa house parties and hung out on the beach. I had an amazing rehearsal dinner on the beach with a bonfire plus a campfire for smores. The wedding was decorated wonderfully, the food was amazing, and the VM staff gave us five star service for the most part. However, as a bride I couldn't help but see a bunch of tiny flaws that my guests probably didn't notice. The only one that really bothered me was the fact that the wait staff was too eager to take our half finished drinks and to clear off the party favors from the tables. Some of my guest had to hide their fans in their purses so that they could keep it. Overall, my wedding weekend was a great. I had a few guests mention that it was the funnest wedding they have ever attended. no joke! It was 1.5 years in the making and the planning process was a little painful because there were a lot of turnover with the wedding planning staff and reserveration staff. Plus, the planners are not the easiest to get in touch with or to get follow ups. They work best via phone or in person. The end result turned out great though. They are totally committed the weekend of the event. If you're looking for a quiet beachy wedding location and are willing to put in the planning effort with Villa Montana, you and your guests will not be disappointed on your wedding weekend.

Reviews.Title: “A more than perfect wedding....”
Reviews.Author: BRW_2010
Reviews.Content: In 2008 we went to Villa Montana as getaway near family. We saw a wedding take place and vowed that if we were to marry this would be our location. Two years later we did exactly that. Planning from NY in less than 8 months is no easy feat yet Mara made it as easy as possible. She took care of guests' medical needs, last minute changes and my dietary needs. She, along with Diana, created an unimaginable floral arrangement. Jeremy was an amazing chef and had people still talking about the fish from the bonfire days later. Manny hooked our guests with the "Manny special." While there is a small staff which contributed to delay, they took the time to get to know our guests and welcome them. The bonfire, the wedding, the brunch were all ABSOLUTELY AMAZING!!!! This was better than imagine and planned because the intimate staff ensured that we were taken care of! Gracias por todo!

Reviews.Title: “We are coming back!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dorchesterst
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Villa Montana in May and my wife, daughter and myself loved it so much that we have changed all our plans to spend Chrismas in this hotel for a second round. I think that the BIGGEST compliment to the hotel is to say that we are coming back!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! This is a super hotel and we can not think of anything that needs to be changed. We made a few good friends on this holiday that we are staying in touch with and we just hope that nothing has changed. The staff are hard working and welcoming as we have ever experienced and we canÂ´t wait to see them all. If you are after quality time with your family, in a wonderful setting, this place is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Totally relaxing, but needs work”
Reviews.Author: Jaquiboy
Reviews.Content: We went to Villa Montana for friends' wedding this past weekend. It was a beautiful location--which was surprising, given the ride to the hotel. It had a wonderful beach, and the decor of the two restaurants were outstanding. We stayed in a one bedroom villa, which was located very close to the beach. The takeway is that this place needs to invest in a larger staff. When we arrived, none of the rooms were ready, and we were told they wouldn't be ready until 4pm. We were happy to get in at 3pm. No one helped with our luggage. The villa itself was disappointing. It was small, dark, and did not have a any of the amenities the website claimed. We realized that all of the villas are decorated differently, and that a two or three bedroom villa was quite different from ours. Nevertheless, we were there to celebrate the union of our friends, and made the best of it. Service at all of the restaurants was horrible--although the food was good at almost all of our meals. It was clear they were unprepared to deal with our group--which was not a large group at all--the wedding had about 75 people. They ran out of white wine at wedding! Also, the servers appeared very frazzled and confused throughout the weekend. Additionally, none of the spa services were available, nor were any of the water sports listed on the website. On the upside, the place was immaculate, and it was truly a getaway for me and my spouse. It is very remote and low-key, and a nice change from the Marriott resorts we usually frequent. I would recommend it, but do not expect a high end vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Our Amazing Dream Wedding - July 17, 2010”
Reviews.Author: larosalinda38
Reviews.Content: Villa Montana We Love You!!! Eddie and I are soooo very happy. You gave us the wedding of our dreams. You will always be in our hearts. Our children had a wonderfule time. If you are looking for a perfect place to have a destination wedding, Villa Montana Beach Resort in Isabela, Puerto Rico is your place. Everything was absolutely beautiful from the villas, rehearsal dinner at the "O" (food was amazing) -- Chef Jeremy - You're the Best. The wedding day was spectacular even with the rain we experienced. Planning a destination wedding can be nerve wrecking, but with wedding planners like Diana and Mara, your day will be blessed. General Manager Robin was very attentive and accommodating when our guests began to arrive. Our primary wedding planner was Diana Perez. She was the best -- Very professional, detail oriented but most of all, she was a guiding light when little things went wrong. She was on top of everything. Our flowers were beautiful, gazebo decoration were breathtaking and all the vendors she recommended were perfect from Reverend Francisco Gonzalez's beautiful wedding vows, Victor the guitarist playing during the arrival of the guests and the ceremony. Mara was that second reassuring hand. If Diana was busy taking care of wedding details, Mara was there to attend whatever we needed. She was an absolute pleasure - very professional and on the same caliber as Diana. They were just an amazing tag team. Our wedding was a small intimate wedding of 25 and DJ Ricky made it seem like we had a wedding party of 50. Everyone danced that night even my mother who was in a wheelchair. My boss and his wife that are american danced all night long. Everyone -- absolutely everyone danced all night. Chef Jeremy's food was delicious. What's great is that it wasn't the typical wedding banquet food you get in the U.S., it was a new fresh modern take of latin food. Just amazing. You have to go down and taste it yourself. Rosita.... We can't forget about Rosita. Rosita took care of our rehearsal dinner. She was our head waitress at the rehearsal dinner. She was a gem. Very personable and attentive. You just love talking to her. She makes you feel right at home. Before, during and after the wedding Rosita was always a friendly smile. She took care of you as if you were her own family. My in-laws were enjoying themselves at the beach and she took it upon herself to wait on them. She knew our children and made them feel comfortable. She pretty much knew everyone by name. Once we checked out, we headed out to San Juan to the Caribe Hilton for a couple of days for our honeymoon. It was just not the same. The moment we arrived, we wanted to head back to Villa Montana. Although Caribe Hilton is a nice a glitz hotel, it does not give you the personal attention, nor warmth. I regretted leaving Villa Montana. In arriving back home to New York City, all the feedback we receive from our guests were all positive. Everyone had a great time and have all said and I quote..... "It was the best wedding they have ever attended." Thank you Villa Montana for our memorable wedding. Can't wait to go back. Love Rosita and Eddie Martinez July 17, 2010 wedding PS: If you want to see a few quick pics of our wedding please go to www.joseaguilo.com/blog and click on his July 22nd entry.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Beautiful. Breathtaking Experience.”
Reviews.Author: danrocks1950
Reviews.Content: What a place! After staying here I felt compelled to write a feedback about this awesome hotel. The staff are very professional and made us feel so special. They really work hard at making your stay as enjoyable as possible. The public areas are beautifully decorated and very stylish. We saw a wedding being held at the beach, organized by the hotel, and it just took your breath away. The setting was simply stunning....what a day to remember for all involved. The food served at the hotel was freshly cooked and delicious every time we ate there and everything was pretty much perfect. We will recommend it to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: enjoyit2
Reviews.Content: We had never been to Puerto Rico and booked this as our anniversary treat. I was a little worried before we arrived that we should have booked somewhere a little closer to the city, but once we got there I forgot that the city even existed! It was amazing. The pace of life so laid back, the beaches like that out of a movie, the food fantastic and the rooms and service unbeatable. All the staff were friendly and made you feel like you lived there.....I wish I did! If you want to get away from it all and really unwind then visit this place. You wonÂ´t regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find for a Better than Imagined Destination Wedding!”
Reviews.Author: scheichls
Reviews.Content: We had our wedding here w a group of 20 family and friends at the end of May. This was a fantastic internet find! I don't know how we lucked out, but the resort did not have 100% occupancy that weekend, and it was like our own personal paradise! The owners/ coordinators/ servers all took amazing care of us during our stay. If you fly into San Juan, it is a bit of a drive in traffic (3 hours or so w traffic), and you see some rougher areas as you drive. But don't get too nervous, bc once you pull up to the gates, you've entered a lush paradise! Our rooms were great. The grounds and beach were impeccably kept. It is so beautiful, it almost looks fake! You arrive there, walk out to the beach and wonder how this place is such a secret?!
