They decor in the Eclipse restaurant and the 24hr pool have been updated since the pics on the villamontana.com website. It is gorgeous! Even the stray dogs were friendly! The Eclipse restaurant is casually enough that you can head in for lunch from the pool, but the food is still an amazing presentation (even the salads are beautiful)! The wedding festivities were all handled for us, all we had to do was show up! if you are looking for a wedding where someone else will take care of all the details so you can enjoy time w your friends and family, this is a winner! If you are easy going and ready to enjoy your stay, i think you'll find that their wedding offerings exceed all levels of expectations. The presentation of everything was 110%- the BBQ rehearsal dinner on the beach (great sangria), the bonfire, the ceremony, the reception decor/ table settings, the food and cake were outstanding!! we were even greeted to a decorated wedding suite w flowers and candles at the end of the evening. Absolutely wonderful!! The resort is happy to recommend a photographer for the wedding services. We partnered w Orlando Negron, a local professional in PR, and were beyond pleased w the resulting photographs! If you are looking for a great, trustworthy, and easy to work with professional, we would recommend Orlando and his crew. The only disappointment we had was very minimal. on their website, it said that they have bikes and sea kayaks that are free to use. unfortunately, due to upkeep and maintenance costs, they have discontinued offering these. We did not know this until we got there, and were looking forward to using these. Thanks again to all that were an integral part in making this a memorable occasion for both us and our friends that joined us! A huge thank you to Jessica, Mara, Diana and William, each of whom put in 110% to make this an unforgettable vacation! Our friends are already talking about a reunion in a few years at the resort! thanks again- The Scheichls

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location. Loud music.”
Reviews.Author: islandgirl00907
Reviews.Content: This place is a dream, hidden behind cliffs and along a secuded beach. The only problem was on Saturday night there was a wedding that lasted until 2:30 in the morning with very loud music that I could hear throughout our villa as if it right in our living room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but wedding planners screwed me over w/ a photographer”
Reviews.Author: bbrat
Reviews.Content: Let me first write that I had a beautiful wedding there and loved the staff and the chef was absolutely amazing. I was willing to overlook power failures, screwed up bookings, my guest having to be shuffled from villa to villa b/c the setting was gorgeous and my wedding of 40 people had a great time. What I CANNOT overlook is that the wedding department of this resort recommended the photographer Rafael Sotomayor to me even after i told them I felt uncomfortable about him before signing the contract. It has been one year since my wedding and I have no album, crappy photos and the resort has not helped me at all and I know they are still recommending him to brides even though I have since found out he has done the same thing to other brides at the resort in previous years. This photographer has made me miserable in the last year and I now forget all of the good things at my wedding and can only focus on them lying to me about what a great photographer and how trustworthy this person is. If you go to get married there just DO NOT select Rafael Sotomayor as your photographer. The staff was friendly, the food fantastic, but service is slow so if you are coming from the US do not expect to be served speedily. If you are getting married and can afford it, you must do the seafood bbq on the beach. It was truly amazing as was the food at our wedding ceremony. Chef Jeremie is the best thing about that resort. The only other problem was that my father had to be hospitalized during our stay and there was no one to contact in the evening for help in an emergency situation.

Reviews.Title: “Scout vacation that went well”
Reviews.Author: familyman80
Reviews.Content: My and my wife have been vivid travellers beginning with our honeymoon, and every consecutive aniversary. We have gone to Sandals, Cancun, Germany, and cruises. Since our daughter was born we had to cut back on the travelling and had begun doing "local vacationing". I enjoy the beach a lot and so my daughter. My wife pleases us on this. I did a three night vacation and took my time for planning. I decided to try this place knowing that local beach resorts of unknown brands can be a gamble. The reservations personnel were outstanding. I had a map of the location and could choose exactly what I was looking. The beach front is very beutiful, most of it has rock, but there is an ample spot that is very nice. The sorroundings are extremelly well preserved and maintained. The room was OK, it requires some TLC in minor maintenance. I pointed it out when leaving and they were honest in acknowledging it. They are going to start a renovation program. They have two pools, but only used one. There are some details that were missing, but were not significant for us. They don't have a formal booklet in the rooms with services and amenities (web site counter balances this). Apparently they don't have a 24 hours desk service. Their opportunity for improvement is definetively the restaurant facility "Ecilpse". I don't want to have this a restaurant review, but is fair to mention that food is good, but service is slow, and personnel is not well trained. I only had dinner and lunch once and then decided to go elsewhere. There are a lot of places to go around. I want to give it another try next year, but want to be sure that I pick a nicer room, probably wiyth two rooms and laundry. I paid $258 per night and was much better deal that the crappy room at Haus at $183 per night. That was really run-down.

Reviews.Title: “Canceled reservation due to poor cust svc before stay”
Reviews.Author: lmc89
Reviews.Content: I had a reservation at this hotel and I itried to call a few times to confirm it. The reservations department is awful, they do not answer you calls. For that reason I decided to cancel my reservation. I called the reservations deparment for a week, nothing. Finally one of the front desk personnel went ahead and cancelled my reservation and guess wha? they charged for a night. I have sent an email to management and still waiting for an answer. I cannot comment on the facilities, restaurants or other personnel. But if this is the way they treat their customers before their stay, I'lll never go there.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking wedding, beuatiful resort, lifetime of memories”
Reviews.Author: arroyom28
Reviews.Content: Recently married at the Villa Montana Resort, wedding coordinator, resort owner and each and every member of the staff treated our entire group like royalty. Accomodations were amazing, not a single member of our group of 50+ guests had a complaint. Mara our coordinator left no stone unturned to ensure we had a picture perfect wedding, no request was too big and no detail too small. The vendors recommended by the resort were 1st class and lived up to their billing. We can't with words describe our experience, it is one that we'll never forget. Thank you Mara...Thank You Villa Montana, we'll ceratinly be back for future rest and relaxation at your wonderful resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience - a few room issues”
Reviews.Author: willgohere
Reviews.Content: I have travelled to PR more than a dozen times over past 20 years and stayed predominantly down on the west end of the island where Villa Montanas is. My wife, six year old daughter and I stayed there the last week of March and overall had a very enjoyable trip. The grounds are spread out along a beautiful beach. These are 1 and two bedroom freestanding villas. We had a oceanfront unit (1031). There is some snorkling right off the beach if the waves are calm, also surfing and kite boarding is popular there. Part of the beach is sand, part has rocks. My daughter loved the rocky tidal pools at low tide. Staff was very friendly and responsive. Nice playground, two pools. Two tennis clay tennis courts (need some upkeep). Guests were predominantly families with kids. Many of them are unit owners from San Juan. Not the place to find wild nightlife. Beautiful open air restaurant and bar on the oceanfront. Our room did have some minor issues. The toilet valve stuck constantly. Function was OK but it was noisy and wasted a lot of water. Back door lock functioned only from the inside. Bathroom was small and outdated. No blinds in the bedroom so the sun comes blasting through the gauze curtains at about 6:30AM. The restaurant onsite is good and there are several others down the road to the East towards Playa Jobos. Wife gives the masseuse two thumbs up. Overall a very relaxing and enjoyable stay at Villa Montanas. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “BAD CUSTOMER SERVIC E EVEN BEFORE THE STAY”
Reviews.Author: TravelerFeedbackHH
Reviews.Content: I normally don;t write revies, but given that this hotel never responded to my questions and did not honor the offer stated on their website, I felt I had to share. Carlos Luengas (aka manager) never responded my questions and they did not honor the promotion on their website. I let you decide if this is a place that you want to stay ...

Reviews.Title: “Nice Facility with Mediocre Management”
Reviews.Author: Kestrel18
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on a lovely beach, and the grounds are attractive. Bar and dining area are out of doors, overlooking the Atlantic. But our "cliff" room, which I was told had ocean views, only looked out on treetops--not terrible, but not what I had been told. The real issue was the very nice but completely ineffective management. Staff was always agreeable when asked to provide extra towels etc--but never followed through. The bar was understocked and restaurant service was very slow. One night they neglected to tell guests that the restaurant/bar was off-limits to guests due to a wedding, so we arrived hungry and thirsty, only to be led to a makeshift dining area where there was inadequate staff and a long wait for service. Check-out took forever!

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal setting.....”
Reviews.Author: ukiah17
Reviews.Content: The setting of Villa Montana is pretty terrific. Apparently it was/or is set up for time sharing and the grounds are beautifully kept and very quiet. My husband and I stayed in a room with a queen size bed - nothing special, but clean - on one of the rows behind the ocean view villas. Interestingly, besides the bed, a TV on a stand, a mini fridge, and one lamp on a night stand, there wasn't even a single chair in our room, but plenty of empty floor space. So we brought in two metal chairs and a little side table from the patio out front and it made all the difference in the world. In doing so, it relieved our frustration factor immensely. There are several lounge chairs for guests along the fabulous beach, as well as an open air restaurant that situated a few feet from the waves - really an awesome setting. While it is a bit pricey as other reviewers have mentioned, the thing we liked most was the food which was prepared by Chef Jeremy Cruz. This fellow has won several well deserved awards for his culinary excellence and in our estimation, was ultimately worth every penny and probably reason enough to go to Villa Montana. If you plan to stay there, I would strongly suggest making a reservation well in advance of your arrival and getting a confirmation number before your arrival. Trust me on this.

Reviews.Title: “relaxing vacation spot”
Reviews.Author: badtrips
Reviews.Content: The hotel is rustic, yet modern, arranged in a easy to get around manner. The service at the hotel was at times inconsistent. The employees assigned to thefront desk were accomodating and friendly, but more often than not, inundated with handling everything from ringing phones to towels, to reservations. The room was small, but clean and comfortable. Beach was very clean & nice sand. However, the pool is located a distance away, hidden near the tennis courts. The fitness center is small, but adequate. The Eclipse restaurant was located on beach. The menu, as well as the food, was excellent. There is a very nice (off property sponsored) horseback riding excursion along the beach as well as excellent snorkling.

Reviews.Title: “Great fun”
Reviews.Author: casaubon
Reviews.Content: I see some comments here about service and i kind of get it but i don't need obseqiuous slavery even at a resort. The staff is friendly and while it may not be danny meyer level they did go out of their way several times to make us feel comfortable. Bar staff, front desk, security everoyone. The rooms are terrific, beach is great. Resaruant is good not quite great. Not the cheapest but a really good time. Bottom line i'd go back in a heartbeat. Overall great spot. tips - rent a car or motorbike - get good directions, getting out of the airport is tricky the rest is pretty easy - go to http://www.ola-lolas.com/ its prety much the best place ever

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but a little pricey.”
Reviews.Author: Anintentionaltourist
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our long weekend. Nice people, nice decorations and ambiance. We had valentines dinner at O and it was delicious. The service, at least our server Joel, was great. The continental breakfast needs improvement. Want to return!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful beach, lovely property, good food, great service, what more could you want?”
Reviews.Author: Manhattan2
Reviews.Content: First, you have to have realistic expectations. The Villa Montana is not a five star Ritz (and it doesn't pretend to be) but then you are not paying Ritz prices. Nor do you have the pretentious attitude. The Villa Montana is a small, quiet, unpretentious resort. If you are looking for a highly active vacation, this is probably not the place to go--stay in San Juan. But there are certainly things to do. A car is a necessity. You can drive to Rincon, about an hour away or explore the local area. There is snorkeling off the beach of the resort or the resort can arrange snorkeling and scuba trips. Next door there is horseback riding on the beach. The grounds are beautifully designed and well maintained. As for a lack of service reported in other reviews, we had no problems at all, although when we stayed, the last week of January, the resort was not full. We booked a flight/accommodation package through Expedia and got a great deal. Fly into Aguadilla and it's a ten minute drive to the resort. We stayed in a one bedroom ocean view villa that was clean and well appointed with a comfortable bed and thick towels. Housekeeping was friendly and efficient. The kitchen was only efficiency size with a half fridge and two burners but it was adequate. There was only one restaurant open during our stay; the Eclipse. It serves breakfast lunch and dinner and all the food we ordered was very good. Yes, the prices are high for Puerto Rico (but about average by New York standards) but you can go to local restaurants like Luna Marina which serves great snapper or go to Happy Belly's or any of the places along the main road in Isabela. The service at the restaurant can be slow, but who cares? You're on vacation so a two hour dinner is great, especially when you're right on the beach and the sound of the surf is all you hear. The resort staff is very friendly and eager to please. If you are polite and patient, they will do their best to help you. The beach is beautiful. Yes, the surf can be rough at times (although we swam regularly) and the beach has some rocky areas, but if you walk a short distance in either direction there are calmer beaches. The resort pool is small but who would use a pool when you have that great beach? My recommendation to the resort is to replace the older lounge chairs at the beach and add beach umbrellas. Otherwise, it's a wonderful gem in Puerto Rico. Go, you'll love it.

Reviews.Title: “Choose another resort”
Reviews.Author: LTN55
Reviews.Content: I went to this resort with girlfriends who picked it based on representations made on the web site and its locations and proximity to dive sites. I planned to golf and not scuba dive. The resort is in a remote location, not near any thing. The amenities were not as promised on the web site. For example, there was no kayaking because the kayak paddles were broken!! The web site invited us to place an order for groceries on the web site, which would be delivered to our room on arrival. This did not happen until the next morning because no one knew about the order, or it was lost somehow. When the order came, it was not correct, although an attempt was made to give us approximately what we wanted. The service was poor in that they resort is severely understaffed. We had a large leak from rainwater that was never addressed so we mopped it up with our bath towels, which we had to wring out repeatedly. There was no HOT water, only tepid water barely warm enough to shower. The rooms need tender loving care, the couch was ripped, there were signs of warping and water damage to the vanities, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: Annyuta
Reviews.Content: We have a terribly poor experience-- we had to call repeatedly to even book the room, then call again repeatedly to try to get early check in. We were told we could check in early, then arrived to a fairly long wait for our room and were told that they couldn't actually guarantee early check in (even though they told us they could). Once we got to the actual room, it was awful. It smelled, there was no internet despite the fact that we were told there is. Honestly, we just picked up and left. Save your money. THis is NOT a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, needs some maintenance”
Reviews.Author: pepperbluemd
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights after the New Year in a 2 br, 2 Bath villa. The layout was great. The kitchen was poorly equipped, one wine glass, and the dishwasher was half filled with water. We told the front desk the next morning, and were told that they would have maintenance fix it. Not on our stay! The sinks and showers drained slowly. The food in the beautiful restaurant was good, but pricey, and service was slow, but we were in no rush. The housekeeper was very friendly and thorough, she was great. I think they need to work on upkeep to keep the places nice, or have the villa owners have the work done. The surf was too rough to swim safely, but the beach was nice and the pools great.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful place but HORRIFIC service”
Reviews.Author: seasand55
Reviews.Content: We currently live in San Juan, PR and decided to get away from the hectic city and go to the beautiful west coast. Even though this resort was recommended by a friend, we left completely dissatisfied and will never return. It all started at check in, the girl in the front desk was super slow and she sent us to the wrong building. It was really hot, we had our dogs with us (one of the main reasons we chose it because it is pet friendly) and we wasted an hour walking around looking for our room. It is a large place with lots of buildings all around. Of course I came back to the front desk to verify that she was sending us to the right place, and she again reiterated our room was in building 12. We again walked everywhere, asked cleaning people around, to no avail. Until finally, another cleaning lady saw us & took us to building 1 where our room was, in the opposite direction of where the front desk girl had told us to go. We were not happy! So we decided to go the beach & cool off. Upon arriving there, we found there were no beach towels available & the atmosphere was stuck up with snobby people all around staring. It was quite uncomfortable. The staff seemed to be concentrating on a wedding that was being set up by the beach & were not helpful at all. During the few times I had to go to the front desk, I chatted up other guests who were just as unhappy. Another couple had booked a spa day & were told no massages were available after all. We agreed this is not what was advertised... Later on that evening, since we had brought some wine with us to have prior to dinner (there's fridges in the room), it took the front desk an hour to bring us a wine bottle opener after we made several calls. Then, it was raining that night so despite not wanting to eat at the resort, we felt like we had to because the area is not well-lit for driving at night. The service at the restaurant was good but slow, and the food was ok, but seemed overpriced. We live in the Condado area in San Juan and are used to great restaurants, so as much as this resort has been raved about, it certainly wasn't worth the trip. There are gorgeous beaches all around the island, and this place might be beautiful but so are lots of other hotels/resorts with beachfront views/access. The service was so terrible we will never go again & don't recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Way beyond our expectations !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: maxfactor51
Reviews.Content: My baby sister got married to a wonderful man in this hotel and the way Villa Montana handled the whole event was with outmost professionalism and integrity and I admire and thank them for everything. We had a choice of many different flower arrangements/food/music etc. and they really wanted to create that once in a lifetime experience for our special day. Of course nothing was free and we paid for the service, flowers, cake, wine and everything else and seeing how well they handled everything prior to the wedding we expected a good service and we got it. We knew that perfect does not exist when you have so many guests in one party, but still the service was beyond what we paid for. The accomodation was within our budget and we were impressed. So much so that my sister told me that she will celebrate her first anniversary in Villa Montana. The rooms are absolutly fine and the public areas of this property could well be from any super luxury property. The gardens are beautifully manucured and the public areas are just stunning. If you are considering a wedding or special occasion in P.R. this is the place to be. Thanks, from the Myers family.

Reviews.Title: “My kind of Hotel. A+”
Reviews.Author: santamonicafun
Reviews.Content: We arrived to this hotel late on a Sunday evening and within minutes we knew that Villa Montana was the perfect place we had been searching for. My husband and I were looking for a picturesque place with a calm atmosphere and we had a dream come true holiday. We have stayed at many luxury hotels around the world and we rate this as one of the best weÂ´ve ever stayed at. The saddest thing was to say goodbye to this layed back style and go back to our busy lifestyle. Perfect does not exist but this hotel is pretty close to it and I mean everything. We usualy do not go back to the same place twice because we like to visit new places every year, but this is one of the places that we might consider going back to once more.

Reviews.Title: “Superb and highly recommended !!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: myworld3040
Reviews.Content: Hi, We stayed here for 5 nights with my husband and daughter for some quality time together, and from the minute we arrived, we were greeted by the friendly staff as if we were the most important people in the world. Many 5 star hotels should learn from these guys. We found the room well above average, bright, comfortable, clean and up to date and could not fault anything. So many positive things about this hotel that any small negatives have no impact. The cuisine and the presentation of food was just great, but be prepared to put on some weight, yes it is that good! The location and the beach is second to none and we will certainly return and have already recommended it to friends. All in all I would say that it was a great choice and worth every cent.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience...would never return!”
Reviews.Author: mardnise
Reviews.Content: My husband, friends and I stayed here for a wedding. For the 6 of us, we reserved the 3 bedroom villa which consists of a one bedroom villa on the bottom and then a seperate 2 bedroom villa upstairs. We got there about an hour before check-in time, and were told that the upstairs unit was ready but the downstairs unit was "still being cleaned" and that they'd let us know when it was ready. While heading to the ready unit with my friends, we wanted to peek inside the one bedroom unit and no one was in there and it looked cleaned so we went to the front desk to get our key. The one bedroom unit was horrible! It was like a dungeon because it was so dark and there were mosquitoes EVERYWHERE! They were literally congregated right outside our front door and the moment the front door is open, you could see them all flying right in! We tried to turn on the light but we soon discovered we had no power in the living room! That meant no TV, no stereo, no ceiling fan and no lights! I called the front desk two different times that evening and it never got fixed! Another ridiculous problem was that we had NO hot or warm water to take a shower with! We seriously took cold showers the three days we were there and there was NO water pressure! My friends in the unit upstairs all had to share one bathroom even though they had two bathrooms in their unit. That was because one of the showers was broken and had no water pressure either. Thank goodness we were so busy with wedding activities all weekend that we weren't in our room much but when we were in our room, I spent my entire time trying to kill all the mosquitoes that totally infested our room. I'm allergic to mosquitoes so I made it my mission! You would think they'd provide mosquito nets over the beds or something. So we went to checkout and I complained about the lack of power our first night and they gave us half off our bill for that first night. Another thing is the food. We went to the breakfast buffet our first morning there and it was good. Unfortunately on our last day there, the wedding couple hosted a brunch and it was the same exact food as the buffet. Too bad they couldn't mix up the food a little bit. The only good thing about this place is the nice private beach. It was beautiful. I guess this is a good place to stay if you're an outdoor person who's used to camping and you like to experience the elements. I'm not one of them! And for $450/night in the 3 bedroom villa, that's some expensive camping! Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at allll!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: NicoleMiamisBest
Reviews.Content: Nice big villa with great bed and plasma tv! What more could you possibly want?! How about a view?!!!! The resort seemed like a quiet place when we first got there but we really enjoyed out stay. The breakfast was great, when I ordered the fruit platter I didnâ€™t get any of that typical pre-cut old watermelon cubes stuff, they actually gave me fresh strawberries and mango and some â€œparshaâ€� puertorrican fruit which was AHmazing! The beach was nothing more than 20 feet away from our villa, it was literally as if we lived on our own island, between the villa, the room service and the pool/beach, it was the best vacation ive ever haddd!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: KyleRoseanne
Reviews.Content: Villa Montana Beach Resort is just what it says: a beach resort. If you donâ€™t like spending time relaxing outside surrounded by nature then you wonâ€™t like this place. If you do, then great! This is the place for you! For less than $200 a night we got great accommodations, complimentary breakfast and paradise! The resort is located in a wonderfully kept campus of green grass and blue seas. My wife described our vacation as the best weâ€™ve had in many years, because it was so different from your typical hotel with a pool and bar. I think this is the property for anyone who is sick of being caught up in big city stress!

Reviews.Title: “Our Dream Beach Wedding”
Reviews.Author: mtorres217
Reviews.Content: This past weekend 9/20/2009, my wife and I celebrated the best day of our lives with over 70 friends and family at Villa MontaÃ±a Beach Resort. Words cannot even begin to describe the happiness and joy we both felt having had the best wedding anyone can ever imagine. The staff (Gina, Diana, Cecilia, Mara, Chepo, Chef Jeremy, Shakira, and Carlos) sorry if I forgot anyone were absolutely amazing! All of my friends and family really complemented their diligence and of course, their courteous service! They did an amazing job during the rehearsal dinner, the ceremony, cocktail hour, the reception and the many after parties that followed our wonderful event. My wife and I recommend Villa MontaÃ±a to anyone who wants a very peaceful, beautiful and "away from the city" experience in Puerto Rico. Interestingly enough, for my family that live in Puerto Rico, this was also a destination wedding for them since my family is from the east (Metro Area) of Puerto Rico. They enjoyed themselves and the FOOD was to die for! We look forward to returning in the near future!

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy with our stay”
Reviews.Author: KarenMatthews1
Reviews.Content: Very happy with our recent stay at Villa Montana. Great staff that were eager to make your stay comfortable. There are plenty of major sights at a close distance, not to mention all your beautiful surroundings in the resort. Rooms very precious, decoration was tropical but in a minimalist way, not overpowering at all, we felt very comfortable, my children loved the plasma tv and we stayed in one night watching movies in bed (they do room service which was great at 11pm) . Best of everything was the bottom pool by the restaurant/beach, there was like a 20 step walk between all three so we could enjoy afternoon drinks at the restaurants bar while the kids played by the pool, or we could relax in the beach hammocks while the children ate their dinner close by. We cannot recommend Villa Montana enough to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: RichardToppel
Reviews.Content: My wife is half puertorrican and this is the 3rd time I visit the island. We usually stay in the city of San Juan, in Condado or Isla Verde but this time decided to visit explore a little more of the island and chose the West side. We stayed in VM for 5 nights and 6 days and can honestly say we were never bored. The place is packed with things to do, my wife and I are avid travelers, explorers and love nature. We went hiking, swimming, rock climbing, played tennis and even rode horses. The hotel experience was great, 5 stars, we were very well taken care of by all the employees and felt very welcomed. Check out was somewhat slower than we expected considering there were 4 other groups checking out at the same time and only 3 staff members in the front desk, however this really didnâ€™t impact our trip or our opinion of the place. Our villa was very charming and private and housekeeping came every morning and left the place spotless. We rented a car (cheaper rates for staying at the hotel) and decided to explore the area a little, many beaches nearby, lots of surfers and young people, definitely very laid back beach town feel. We went to 3 restaurants less than 10mts from the resort: rosalindas which was great Mexican, Pomodoros, Italian food, was OK and then Chess, typical PR food, good place, we recommend this place, but the best dinning was clearly villa Montana, nothing could beat the views and food was exquisite. Our trip was really wonderful, stay in this side of the island rather than san juan if you really want a puertorrican experience.

Reviews.Title: “Would come back in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: StvnBS
Reviews.Content: Coming here was like arriving at paradise. My wife and I live in hectic Chicago and were looking to get away on our saved vacations, finally 10 days of peace! Come here If you want to feel like youre alone in a private island, the service is great and the staff is very friendly, margaritas by the pool all day long. Our room was tropical and beautiful, everything was clean, air system and kitchenette were in good working condition. Our only complain was waiting 30mts to get extra towels when we needed them one night, not a big deal. We really liked Villa Montana and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Overall great experience”
Reviews.Author: kimmyzacks
Reviews.Content: Just visited here this past weekend with my sister and her daughter (12). Check-in was fast and friendly, we felt very welcomed, and our rooms were pretty and quite large, although the tv wasnt working very well in my nieces room, the sound wasnt coming through properly, we called the front desk and they took care of it rather quickly, within the first night. the place is very well taken care of, we were near the tropical restaurant, service was a bit slow but the food was well worth the wait, price was reasonable, and really the view was just so calming and gorgeous we couldnt really be bothered with anything. This was my second time visiting here, i came earlier in May with my husband for a relaxing weekend and had such good memories i decided to come again this year; the place looks better than it did a couple of months ago and i noticed one of the pools was redone and just looks great, very enjoyable, very private. Once again i had a great time and will probably be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for my beautiful wedding!”
Reviews.Author: AliciaYBrooks
Reviews.Content: My husband and i just hosted our wedding in Villla Montana Beach Resort this past weekend og August. We want to sincerely thank everyone at the resort; Shakira, Diana and especially Jessica, as well as all the staff that made our dream come true. After working with Dianna, our planner provided by the hotel for over a year, we couldnt have been happier with the outcome. I really praise this beautiful resort for their amazing location, beautiful facilities and truly great staff. Must admit we were a little scared of having a destination wedding to Puerto Rico (neither of us had ever been to the island, plus the way the economy is at the moment we werent sure we could afford it) but as soon as we came to visit we were at easy. Everything from the decoration to the service, the beautiful nights and days, gorgeous villas and landscapes was more than we expected. Thank you once more for this beautiful memory, and see you next year!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place, great service!”
Reviews.Author: JessicaSteinmart00
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted to take one last trip with the kids before school started and our eldest left to college. We had always wanted to visit Puerto Rico and decided to stay at this resort after we read its good reviews in a magazine. Overall I would say this was one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in. W e had some doubts considering we had never been to PR but just fell in love with the place. The villas are big, clean, and decorated beautifully- we stayed in a 3 bedroom garden view. The service was excellent, both at the restaurant and the front desk. The landscape is just breathtaking, gorgeous beach and greens. This place was more than we had expected, especially considering what we paid, we stayed at a 5 star resort in all honesty. I would definitely recommend this hotel, you will fall in love.

Reviews.Title: “great getaway!”
Reviews.Author: AlexLewis
Reviews.Content: I dont usually take the time to write these reviews, but I recieved an email and decided to go ahead and applaud the resort for such a wonderful stay! I arrived on a thursday (early)with my finace, and was greeted very well by the front desk staff (they were nice enough to let us check in 4 hours early!). During our 5 say stay we went to the beach every day (most amazing beautiful blue I have ever seen) and ate at the Eclipse restaurant most of the time (great service, great view, delicious food), we also ordered room service, and went to a nearby mexican restaurant Rosalindas (8mts away at most). I have to say that the best part about staying at this resort (apart from the value) was the secluded feeling you got, we felt like we were on our own private island! Overall, the service was great, the beach was beautiful, rooms were well kept (we stayed at a beach-front villa) and we felt pampered 100% of the way. Go to this resort if you want a romantic or relaxing couple of days away from the city stress.

Reviews.Title: “NIGHTMARE!! WORST MNGT EVER!!!”
Reviews.Author: natpac
Reviews.Content: I got double charged on my debit card for my dinner at the Eclipse restaurant, they are under staffed, service was absolutely horrible(I understand "island time" but this was over the top ridiculous)and when I was trying to resolve my debit card issues from the states, know one would call me back, claimed they didnt get my 4 voicemails I left for the accounts manager, and supposedly didnt receive any of the faxes I or my BANK faxed them. I almost had to start a fraud investigation because of the lack of cooperation. and i finally had to get a family friend to personally visit the resort and fix the whole mess to credit me back the money someone "stole" from me. Please be warned, these people are idiots and bring CASH!

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking retreat; rent a car and bring your own food.”
Reviews.Author: hectorjuan
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3-night stay at this resort and we stayed at a Beach-front one bedroom Villa. Although we are local residents in Puerto Rico, we had never stayed here. We decided to book our stay at Villa MontaÃ±a because it is right next door to our favorite place to ride horses and we had seen the resort many times during the rides. You have to see this place to believe it. It is absolutely beautiful! Imagine waking up every morning to take your breakfast on your back porch, with the greenest grass all around you, the brightest sun shining in the bluest sky above, and the ocean waves a mere 40 steps away ( I counted them!). And wait until you see the sunsets! It is truly breathtaking. The grounds are very well kept and it is a very relaxing, romantic, secluded, laid back and out of the way resort. However, I must advise you to bring your own food and a car. The beach is secluded and there are no crowds, In fact, there is hardly anyone on it because the coast is rocky and the surf is sometimes too strong. If you want the beach only for sunbathing then you will be fine, but if you plan on entering the water you better be a good swimmer. For snorkeling it is okay although there is not much to see. If you want a better beach, you will have to drive somewhere else. Isabela to the east and Aguadilla to the west have excellent beaches. Or you could drive to Aguadilla and go to the water park there, which is excellent. The food in the restaurant is excellent but pricey. It is very well prepared and presented, and the taste and quality were very good, but for the price, you would expect far better service. There was only one person in charge for seating us, taking our orders, bringing the food, and finally the check. For breakfast they have complimentary Continental breakfast of toast with a small cup of fruit, and a small cup of yogurt, with juice and coffee, or one pastry with fruit, yogurt, juice and coffee. Good thing it was complimentary because it costs about 12 dollars each. Again, if the service were better you could understand the price. But we had to wait about 35 to 45 minutes for this breakfast. For dinner it was worse. We had to leave without ordering dessert because we had already been there for almost two hours, and there was only one other family in the restaurant that night. The Villas have a kitchenette, so we prepared our own food and breakfasts the rest of our stay and we were fine. So, bring your own food. The small freezer in our small refrigerator had not been defrosted and we had to smash away the ice from it. The pools were plain, and small. The rooms were clean, the AC were functioning, the TV was great for the kids, and the bathroom was clean and adequate. All in all, we had a great time. And we got an upgrade from a garden view villa to an ocean view villa with a free night.

Reviews.Title: “Were in love with Villa Montana”
Reviews.Author: AliceBrown
Reviews.Content: Never usually write reviews but had to take a moment for this one. Just got back from our second trip to Villa Montana in late may (boyfriend just graduated law school!) and once again fell absolutely in love. The place is breathtaking, the colors, the views, just beautiful. The staff is great, very friendly, you can tell theyve been working together for a while now and have a good rythim going on. Last time we visited we stayed in a regular hotel room (which was perfectly fine), but this time, due to the celebration, stayed at a beach-front villa and wow. Nothing could be better than waking up to the beautiful carribean sea every morning. All in all, the resort is great, not the best place to meet singles because its a very romantic, couples or families stay, very secluded very relaxing, you end up feeling like youre the only people there and its fantastic! i highly recommend this stay to anyone looking for a few days off the fast-paced city. Love it!!

Reviews.Title: “If you like seclusion and boredom, then, why not?”
Reviews.Author: FleetingDasein
Reviews.Content: Villa Montana Beach Resort is located in Isabela, roughly 1 1/2 hours west of San Juan. My boyfriend and I booked two nights through Hotwire. We thought the price was a very good deal. We arrived at Villa Montana at around 3pm. We were quite tired from the long trip. We were told check-in was not until 4pm. So we waited, and waited. We got to our room at around 4:30pm. The room was great, although a little bit small. I loved the decor. The A/C barely worked. The bathroom was average. There was a locked door at the end of the hallway. We would hear noise coming from the other side of the door at night. We weren't quite happy about that. There is no internet in the rooms, so if you want internet you have to go to the lobby. The flat screen tv was the best thing in the room, and I don't think that's a good thing. I've got to admit that the resort is beautiful and well kept. The pools were small, and quite ordinary. The children's pool by the restaurant was always crowded. You'd think the pools would have a little waterfall, or a waterslide, but no. Next time, I'm staying at the Hyatt. The resort boasts 3 miles of private beach, and sure enough, this is what you'll be getting. Problem is, the beach is not enjoyable. It is full of rocks, and the tide can be quite dangerous. If like you constantly stepping on mossy rocks, while being pushed back and forth by big waves, then this is the resort for you. Puerto Rico has beautiful beaches, and this is not one of them. We ended up driving to a different beach 30 minutes away. The rock climbing wall was out of order. The restaurant was expensive, and not worth it. There was nothing to do but swim in the pool, and watch tv. I've got a tv, and pool at home. The resort was pretty much dead after 8pm, and it's an hour drive to Aguadilla, the nearest big city. The front desk personel were not very friendly. We had to wait like 20 minutes to ask for towels. They were talking on the phone and wouldn't even look at us. At least check-out was fast. I couldn't wait to get out of that place. Bottomline, if you want to get away of it all, and if you enjoy seclusion, this is the resort for you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, But Not Worth the $$$”
Reviews.Author: TJTT
Reviews.Content: While Villa Montana is in a beautiful, somewhat isolated location, the service was underwhelming. A lot of smiles, but exceedingly slow responses to simple requests for extra pillows and beach towels. At check in, staff did very little to make us feel that we were welcome. We tried to check in early and were told the room would be ready in 30 minutes. That was fine, but the wait was over an hour an a half. We would have been OK if they just told us up front to come back in two hours. We called the front desk a few times but it took at least three calls to get someone to answer. We are frequent travelers and usually don't complain about service, but at $300 per night, I expected better.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth your money”
Reviews.Author: CoquiNYC
Reviews.Content: The grounds and location on the oceanfront are beautiful but looks can be deceiving. The pool area smells of the sewer fumes from a drain nearby. The trash overflows from the can in the public restroom. Both breakfast and dinner with the restaurant were terrible. The worst $100 I ever had to spend on food. The wait stiff disappears for minutes on end. The quality of the food was poor, complete with "grissle" to chew in my NY Strip and dirty coffee mugs and creamers. We had a room that looked charming on the surface, but the toilet only worked sporadically and the bathroom a bit run down. We only stayed one night on our way to another location , and we couldn't wait to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful secluded location”
Reviews.Author: PatAndMax
Reviews.Content: The restaurand/bar was amazing, with table views of the ocean just yards away. You can watch the sun set while you eat. The compound was very nice. It was an amazing resort. There are several surfing beaches nearby, and you can even surf right in front of the resort. There aren't many restaurants and bars nearby, so if you're looking for lots of nighlife and people to meet, this may not be the best place. I'd recommend this for couples or families. I can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “My Paradise Wedding”
Reviews.Author: Fabwedding08
Reviews.Content: My wedding at Villa Montana Beach Resort in March 2008 was absultely beautiful. The ladies there planned and prepared everything I wanted perfectly. My cake came out exactly the way it was in the picture and the taste was amazing. My flowers were very bright and and beautiful(orange and bright reds roses and calla lillys with touches of greens in between). I had about 40 guests and everyone complimented the decor,food and atmosphere. I would have liked the D.J. to motivate the crowd a little more and would have liked to have more lighting illuminate the dance floor, but overall my wedding was something I will never forget and was truely a dream beyond all dreams. I hope to visit this coming June to recapture all the wonderful memories I have of my wedding. Thank you to all the staff who work hard in making this a wonderful day for me and my husband and sorry it took so long for me to get this review on tripadvisor

Reviews.Title: “beautiful wedding destination”
Reviews.Author: travelingGangof6
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a place to stay on west side of island, pictures of hotel made us decide to get married on our vacation. Villa Montana staff was wonderful in planning simple small inexpensive wedding. We had a dream come true wedding on the beach at sunset. The restaurant provided a wonderful dinner for the small wedding party that could not be topped. The hotel staff even cleaned up our room and prepared it for the wedding night with flower petals on the bed and candles all aound. Totally romantic and beautiful. We topped off our honeymoon with romantic horseback riding on the beach and snorkling in the blue hole (equipment provided by hotel). Fabulous!!! Fabulous!!! Great Staff!!!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to get away from it all!!”
Reviews.Author: Patty2Rome
Reviews.Content: My family just got back from a wonderful 4 day vacation at Villa Montana. We wanted a vacation where we could relax with our college age children in a warm, beautiful place....and that is what we got! We stayed in a very nice 2 bedroom, ocean view villa. The view from our front porch was gorgeous, and we spent lots of time sitting there, relaxing and enjoying the scenery. The ground are beautiful, and the trees are full of birds, including wild parrots. The ocean directly in front of the resort is gorgeous, but pretty rough. If you want to swim in the ocean, you would probably need to walk down the beach to a calmer spot (about 5 minutes away). The staff was extremely nice and helpful, but very unobtrusive. We ate one night at Eclipse, the on-site restaurant, and had a really good meal. We went to the grocery store (5 minutes away) for lunch and breakfast food (our villa had a kitchen). We ate off-site at Happy Bellys and Luna Marina, and also had good meals. Happy Bellys hangs right over the ocean, and is a very fun place. We did the 3 hour "Discover Scuba" with Aquatica, a dive shop which is only 5 minutes away. They do a great job! We also did the horseback riding with Tropical Trail rides, which is right next door. It was also a great experience! I would recommend both activities. The rest of the time, we relaxed and enjoyed the beauty of the area. This is NOT a good place if you enjoy tons of people, shopping or night life. It IS the place to go for natural beauty, quiet and lovely weather. Also, this is not the place for you if you expect Ritz-Carlton-like perfection. Our water didn't get very hot, and the twin beds in the second bedroom weren't very comfortable. We didn't care....we were too busy enjoying the rest of it. We also enjoyed the neighborhood dogs that wandered through, the lizards and the sweet cat in the open-air restaurant. I would definitely recommend having a rental car for going to the grocery store, etc. Our college age kids enjoyed hanging out on the beach and recovering from final exams...don't bring teens or older kids who are expecting clubs or nightlife. We really, really liked this place and want to come back. Next time, we are going to try to fly into the Aquadilla airport, which is only 10 minutes or so away from the resort, although the drive from the San Juan airport wasn't too bad (2 or 2 1/2 hours because of road construction).

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot”
Reviews.Author: craig2
Reviews.Content: We were really surpised with this hotel. Reasonable price, friendly staff and nice room. Terrific location.

Reviews.Title: “Private, lush, relaxing resort”
Reviews.Author: HeartMath
Reviews.Content: On this, my third trip to Villa Montana in about 18 months, I experienced total tropical heaven. The location is in the more rustic north western coast of PR and the resort is private, safe, and beautifully landscaped. Staff is friendly and helpful. There are no giftshops or hair salons and things are low key. There is a small gym, free kayaks and bikes, two pools (one for adults only, although on all my visits there were never more than a handful of kids at the resort). Walking around the grounds each morning revealed exotic flowers and many varieties of palm trees. The clean, private beach is furnished with huge lounges with thick, bright cushions. The rooms are varied -- these are villas, not a high-rise hotel. The two-bedroom I was in and the three-bedroom unit my famiily was in were clean, with well appointed kitchens (we like to cook in breakfast and lunch). While not perfect (the washer broke on a Sunday afternoon and wouldn't drain and the A/C was uneven in one bedroom), housekeeping responded quickly to our calls for help. The restaurant (Eclipse) served lobster that must have just strolled out of the ocean, it was so fresh. The bar served drinks with plently of "punch" accompanied by great service. The tennis courts need a refurbishing, but that's about the only major complaint. Would I go back again? You betcha!

Reviews.Title: “Middle of nowhere”
Reviews.Author: HenriNewYork
Reviews.Content: If you stay two nights you may accept one single day in the villa Montana, but forget a longer stay : rocky and dangerous beach, dark rooms without any view except the parking lot, unexisting service, excessive food prices (the breakfast is just awfulk for the price), rooms/appartmenets owners who party during the whole night ... In all cases, rent a car to be able to escape. This resort really is in the middle of nowhere

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, wonderful place! thanks Cynthia!”
Reviews.Author: Carinanne
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 10 days at Villa Montana in a 2 bedroom villa (we have 2 children, ages 19moz and 3.5 years). The villa was amazing, the staff was friendly and very helpful. Whenever we needed anything they came right to our aid. The pools were wonderful, the kids loved them. The beach is a bit treacherous, the waves are pretty strong...but it is beautiful. Eclipse restaurant was a great place to have breakfast or lunch (with the kids we didn't get out for dinner!)...the food was fine and not over priced. Having just spent 3 weeks on a very rustic adventure elsewhere in the Caribbean, we were thrilled with the ammenities and wonderful service at Villa Montana. Cynthia (general manager) and her crew were wonderful, we would definitely visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Cynthia Saved The Day!”
Reviews.Author: MotherPup
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked for a week's stay at the Villa Montana for what would be a most excellent vacation. Though the beginning was a bit rough ...there was a problem with the room we were initially booked into... Cynthia Rodriquez, the General Manager (as we found out later), came to our assistance and the situation was resolved far beyond our expectations. The remainder of our stay was truly wonderful! We ate incredible meals at Eclipse and Chef Jeremy, his staff, and the bartenders were all very friendly, efficient, and fun to spend time with. We enjoyed ourselves tremendously. It was our first visit to Puerto Rico...our first time at Villa Montana...and I can say with all certainty...we will definitely be back. Thank you again for a lovely stay! Katy and Joe Read

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort (esp. for the money)”
Reviews.Author: luckynaka
Reviews.Content: We are young couple (age 28 and 26) on a trip to i) find a wedding location and ii) vaction over 4th of July weekend. Our experience was generally great. We had cheapest room, yet we got separate bedroom and living room close to the ocean. We paid $352.80 for two nights. The beach on the property was nice and can swim/snorkel. It was hard finding the resort at first as Puerto Rico roads did not have many signs. To get there, you want to go east on 110 then turn on 4466 then there is a villa montana sign that is hard to see off a steep turn (if you drive correctly it should only take about 15min). Good -- Close to the Aguadilla Airport (BQN) -- Nice rooms -- Free snorkel gear rental, tennis rackets -- Eclipse restaurant has good food and great view. -- Staff was friendly and helpful Bad -- Hard to find the resort initially -- Electricity went out one night for about 12hrs, did not get anther room, instead gave us couple candles. -- hot water goes out sometime (but I believe it's Puerto Rico in general) In the end, we had a good experience there. This would be great for traveling with many friends or with family + kids, but for a wedding we were not completely sold on.

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: j1adc
Reviews.Content: Our stay was less than pleasant. Our room was not very clean and we had a 7 hour power outage during the evening, which resulted in no lights, air conditioning or hot water. When we went to check out, the computers were down and the man at the front desk was not able to give us a discount on the room despite this large inconvenience. Nor were we able to check out at the time. Further, the food at the restaurant was not very good and there was a cat there begging for food, and eating a lizard during our meal. This was not worth the money for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: TKlash
Reviews.Content: The property is situated directly on the beach. Wonderful views from the restaurant. Good food served by friendly staff while the ocean breeze flows through the dining room. I especially appreciated the attention to detail of service offered by the manager, Cynthia. This is the right place for a very relaxing and enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Our beach front wedding...”
Reviews.Author: Pepifray
Reviews.Content: My wedding at Villa Montana can only be described in one wordâ€¦ EXTRAORDINARY. Currently living in Mexico, all the planning was done via emails and phone calls. The wedding department staff took care of every detail and contributed with ideas. Curiously, what I wanted for my wedding ceremony, had never been done beforeâ€¦ which was an ocean side wedding. Villa Montana offers their gazebo as part of their wedding package, which is wonderful. But since my sister had her wedding at the gazebo I wanted something totally different. And they made it happenâ€¦ I had a bunch of ideas for the beach ceremony, but I have to say that Mildredâ€™s job on the design and outcome was just wonderful. For the cocktail I had ice cream trays which were a great complement for the beach ceremony, and Sandals were given to the guests. Dinner was beautifulâ€¦ I have to say thanks Jeremy for that!!! My Brazilian friends were dying to know the recipe for the arroz mamposteaoâ€¦ In the end, everyone was psyched about everythingâ€¦ the ceremony, music, cocktail, dinnerâ€¦ and I have to sayâ€¦ it was all what I dreamedâ€¦ different and CHIC! - F. Bosques

Reviews.Title: “WOW...what a wedding!”
Reviews.Author: Besos15
Reviews.Content: My sister and I were on a mission to find my wedding location. We stayed at Villa Montana for one night to explore the grounds. The night of our stay we watch a wedding ceremony and it was absolutely gorgeous! The on site wedding planner Mildred was awesome! During the wedding reception, she took time to attend to my questions. Thank you SO much Mildred for your time :) This resort has a rustic feel with a touch of Asian flare. We did not dine at the resort but would definetly return for some R&R.

Reviews.Title: “Great but...”
Reviews.Author: PhxED
Reviews.Content: The best things about this resort are the beautiful grounds, an exceptionally friendly and helpful staff and the beautiful beach-side bar area. If you need to be on the West side of Puerto Rico, between Mayaguez and Isabella, this is the best place to stay. However, we have found the best beaches and resorts on Vieques Island near San Juan. We stayed in a one bedroom downstairs villa that was larger than the ciff rooms but still pretty small. The full size bed was squeeky, hard and had seen better days -- we didn't get a single good night's sleep...villa needed some maintenance. With all of the awesome restaurant reviews we thought that the Eclipse would be great -- however, the whole time we wondered if perhaps they had changed chefs. The food was ok but certainly not worth our time even though the restaurant itself was breathtaking-- we found great fresh local fare at Luna Marina down the road.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Location, Relaxing Week.”
Reviews.Author: Jess451
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the Villa Montana (stayed there 4/16-20). We were a little nervous when booking the hotel, and there seemed to be two types of travelers â€“ those that had a wedding there and loved it, and those that stayed there not during a wedding and thought it was so so. QUICK SUMMARY. Great location, Amazing grounds, good rooms, Restaurant not worth the cost. Definitely would stay there again. Had a great vacation- came back totally relaxed. PRE-VACATION I was extremely worried before our trip. I emailed to ask about a couple of their services and never heard back from them. How hard is it to answer an email?? I wanted to request a couple of the more expensive services and just never heard backâ€”weird and not a good start. GETTING THERE We flew into San Juan. The drive to the hotel was about 2 hours but it was an easy drive--- pretty much a straight shot. Thereâ€™s this one point, when you first see the ocean in front of you (going down a hill near Isabella) and itâ€™s like youâ€™re entering another world. Note if you have a gps, it will get you to the villa but it thinks the road is unpaved but itâ€™s paved. THE GROUNDS We need to start out by saying that this was one of the most beautiful places Iâ€™ve ever stayed at. The grounds were amazing. The pictures do not do it justice. The resort is small so everything is within easy walking distance. I canâ€™t say it enough, this is one gorgeous place. Wild birds (including a family of parrots) are right on site. ***Pools*** There are breathtaking two pools, one by Eclipse with bar & rest rooms and one a short walk away. Both pools were breath-taking with the best lounge chairs Iâ€™ve ever used. The pools were quite, had plenty of shade and sunny spots. We ended up spending most of our time at the pool not near the Eclipse. The shaded area had two double lounge chairs and a hammock! Hubby spent most of his time there. So relaxing!!!!! ***Beach*** This is a surfers beach so donâ€™t expect to swim here. However we did have a number of long walks along the beach. Slightly to the right of Eclipse restaurant you can walk over some rocks and find the Blue Hole snorkeling areaâ€”weâ€™ve heard. However, we were never able to find it, however it was April and the ocean was roughâ€”not the resorts fault. The Beach resort area had about 20-25 lounge chairs (NOTE TO MANGEMENT: you should get more). The grounds staff do a great job keeping the beach clean and free of debris (I totally donâ€™t understand a few of the reviews). THE ROOM We stayed in one of the garden view rooms, #3062. It was about 11x13 (maybe) with a queen bed, coffee maker, small dorm refrigerator, tv & vcr, iron & ironing board and closet organizer system (note no in room safe). The bed was extremely comfortable and covered in white linenâ€”so comfortable we had no problem sleeping at all. The room was nicely decorated with terracotta tiles and dark wood furniture. There was a ceiling fan, personal room air conditioner and two side tables with lamps. Even with the three lights, the room was dark (think more mood lighting than regular lighting) The room had the ability to open up to a larger room (think of adjoining room hotel rooms). So the room had a funky â€˜extraâ€™ door on the way to the bathroom. I canâ€™t think of any additional way to state it. The bathroom was a good size (larger than some NYC apartment bathrooms). The bathroom was dark tooâ€”I think the bulb wattage was too low. There was a large French door that overlooked a small slate patio that had two chairs and a small table. There were a few minor issues with the room. When we first got to the room, the A/C sounded like a wind tunnel. The bell hop said he would send maintenance. After an hour, we called the front desk and was told maintenance was gone for the day. However the bell hop came back and did something. However the A/C wasnâ€™t sounding loud by that time-- Maybe it was the start up issue. So it became on non-issue. It worked and kept the room at a constant temperature. The other issue was with the hot water. Three times the hot water just stopped. The hot water wasnâ€™t really hot so I would take showers without any cold added. I swear the water stopped â€“ no trickle- no cold water just me standing there with soap in my hair and no water. About 4 minutes later, it just started back upâ€”weird. ROOM SUMMARY Overall it was a charming room, and more than met our needs. If I had a family I would definitely want to rent a full villa with kitchenette. The personal patio definitely made it worth it. Next time, I would want to have a balcony room (verses the patio) but it definitely was pretty great. The patio was a favorite addition, every morning we had coffee & breakfast there. THE RESTURANTS The website claims to have two restaurants, the Eclipse and the O. However the O is open only Saturday nightsâ€”so really the only restaurant is Eclipse. We never did eat at the O, but did have our first dinner at Eclipse. The restaurant is beautiful! Itâ€™s right overlooking the beach, long white curtains flowing in the breeze, lanterns handing throughout. Absolutely breath-taking. The food was a disappointment. Weâ€™ve traveled throughout the Caribbean, Mexico, Europe and live in NYC. We ordered the bruschetta, sushi tuna appetizer and then shrimp tortellini and a meat dish (the first meal my husband wanted wasnâ€™t availableâ€”which I thought was weird it wasnâ€™t a big menu to begin with). The only thing that was really good was the tuna appetizer, the bruschetta was on this cracker thing, the tortellini wasnâ€™t cooked enough and the meat was ok. However for the quality, we felt the meal was over priced almost $90 inc tip without drinks (we had water and no alcohol). This was the only meal we had there. I did look at the lunch menu and it looked like for two it would be $30-40 w/o tipâ€”not worth the gamble. Also double check your bill, be were charged incorrectly for one of the appetizers. RESTURANT SUMMARY Service wasnâ€™t as bad as some posters had; we completed our meal in about 2 hours (more European/Caribbean pace than US). We liked it. However, value for the price makes it not worth it. THE STAFF Didnâ€™t see the staff too much. There did seem to be some disorganization in the processes. For example, we came out one night to see an entire family sitting outside (one was holding a very young baby). They apparently locked themselves out of their room (youâ€™re only given one key??). They said they have been waiting for over Â½ hour to be let in because no one had a key. (how did housekeeping get in?). Donâ€™t bother going to the Eclipse restaurant (next to a pool and the beach) for towels, go to the front deskâ€”the restaurant didnâ€™t have any when we went. I guess this may be an overall thingâ€”as of today still donâ€™t have a response to the email I sent to the resort. RESORT OVERALL We would definitely stay at this resort again. The quite atmosphere made it feel like we were the only oneâ€™s there. There were two or three weddings during our time there and we never felt that it overshadowed our time. Wouldnâ€™t eat at the restaurant again. If we were to go again, I would have the resort purchase items for the fridge ahead of time (itâ€™s an option on their site). I think if you think of it as a hotel verses a â€˜resortâ€™ youâ€™ll be happier. The term Resort is means activities, activity coordinators and helpful staff. Itâ€™s hotel, where you need to make your own fun and if you need constant entertainment, this is definitely not the place for you. If you are a person that like to plan your own stuff (guidebooks, internet etc) this is perfect for you. Oh side note to mention, I didnâ€™t get any cell signal there (Verizon wireless) so if you need to be constantly connectedâ€”note this. I did see others using their cell so maybe it was just Verizon. SUPERMARKET After dining in the restaurant, we chose to go to a supermarket to buy snacks, stuff for breakfast and lunches. About 10 -15 minutes away you can find the Economico (or something like that) supermarket. Large, clean and plenty of parking *directions: The supermarket is located on the west side of Isabella _ you can stop there on your way to the resort even. Otherwise from the resort take 4466, to 466 E to 459 E. its on your left right has you enter Isabella TREBOL BAKERY We had breakfast here our second day. Great espresso coffee and ham & cheese sandwiches. Its to the East of Isabella -- Take 459E to Carretera 113 (parking is in front). AMANDAâ€™S This place had amazing Monfungo (mashed plantains forming a bowl, filled with shrimp, chicken or meat (your choice) and peppers, onions and a red sauce.--- mmm our best mealâ€”great appetizers and good wines. Directions: take 4466 to Carr 110. Address is 8.8 km Carr 110.- 10 mins away. OCEAN FRONT RESTURANT This was really good, on Carr 4466E about 5 minutes away. Large wine list for the Caribbean. Walk in, and walk though the bar to a clean, efficient and yummy restaurant. We had dinner there and it was awesome. Definitely a good meal. While youâ€™re waiting, you can go outside and watch the ocean on their private deck or you can eat outside in the outdoor restaurant. HAPPY BELLIES Slightly farther down Carr 4466E from the Ocean Front, total dive bar atmosphere on the ocean. Beer, burgers, fries, excellent quick eats. Kids will defiantely like the food here, but us adults did too. Cheap cheap eats-- $30 inc tip beer burgers and appetizer.

Reviews.Title: “Puerto RIco's Best Kept Secret”
Reviews.Author: apetura
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been to Villa Montana numerous times - first for work (I shot a fabulous wedding there in April 2007) and then for our own wedding this past January and a few times in between. We have traveled around the world visiting more than 20 countries on nearly every continent and these are by far the most friendly and welcoming people we have met. From the second we stepped foot onto the Villa Montana property we new that we had found a special place - a place we knew we would be revisiting for many many years to come. It is unlike other vacation destinations that are crowded and overpriced. Villa Montana is an extremely relaxing, low-key place to sit back and unwind. Once relaxed, adventure is right around the corner - we have enjoyed the horseback riding, snorkling, and surfing the area has to offer. The food is absolutely amazing - that was one of our top reasons we selected Villa Montana for our wedding location. Chef Jeremy and his staff at the Eclipse Restaurant and the "O" do a wonderful job. The food is perfectly prepared and presented beautifully. Everyone on the resort staff continues to treat us like we have been friends for years. When we returned to the resort a few months after our first visit we were greeted by name - we nearly fell over! This place is truly like no other. We have stayed in a variety of rooms - from the ocean front villas to the hotel style rooms up by the cliffside - all are beautiful, well maintained and very relaxing. The views, the food, and the people are first class. A special thanks go out to Angelica, Melany, Diana, and Jessica for making our wedding a day that our guests continue to talk about months later. I wish we could do it all over again! We fell in love and will be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: herbnkim
Reviews.Content: A co-worker and I stayed at the Montana Villas from March 10-13 on a business trip. The resort was well kept and the beach was like a dream. It goes for miles and there is almost no one there. Can you say "picture-perfect". After being in busy Playa Del Carmen, Mexico on a family vacation just a month earlier, the quiet and relaxing atmosphere was very refreshing. There seemed to be a lot one could do right at the resort, but not a lot for very small children. There is a nice playground though so if you have small children and don't want or need a childrens program, the resort may work for you. It seems like it would be better for kids more in the eight years and older range. My only disappointment was the limited time we had at the resort. Breakfast on the beach was fantastic, but after that we had to leave and work all day and well into the evenings. We will be coming back on business again in a few months and will be staying there again. Except this time I hope to stay an extra day or two for fun. And my wife has been planning to join me. I'll be working and she'll be relaxing on the beach.... :-) I would recommend this resort for people who want a very relaxing vacation free from the hustle and bustle one gets in the big hotel/resort zones. Don't expect to see any vendors on the beach because there are none. You can go for a walk on the beach by yourself - as in not along with 500 or 5000 other people. You can relax on the comfy lounge chairs and not have people trying to sell you things every fifteen minutes. And you won't even have to worry about pushy sales people trying to sell you time-shares. They don't exist there. Quiet, relaxing, nice.

Reviews.Title: “relaxing”
Reviews.Author: vista4u
Reviews.Content: i stayed for a week last year and am surprised to read recent reviews. the resort staff were very attentive and cordial. the room i had in a villa was small but adequate, a very short walk to the beach where the oversize lounges had thick comfortable padding, some near large umbrellas. i found it very relaxing and quiet. a car is a necessity for getting around to nearby towns for restuarants, etc. their onsite massage was worth it, the only negative were the mosquitoes at night.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: vischa
Reviews.Content: The good: nice setting, lovely beach and great swimming, snorkeling. Good food at Eclipse Restaurant. The not-so-good: marginal service. We arrived 1/2 hour before check-in (after 7 hours of travel) and were told that we would have to wait 90 minutes before we could drop our bags in the cottage and change. Housekeeping showed up at 5pm every day despite our requests for them to come earlier in the day. The floors in our rooms were not clean. Though our lone dinner at Eclipse was very good, it took 2 hours for our entrees to arrive and 45 minutes for dessert. 3 hours in total is a bit much. The desk staff was less than insightful when asked about suggestions for things to do off-site. Overall, this is a lovely spot but we couldn't help but feel as if it were a bit down at the heels. It felt slightly neglected and so did we.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: LottyPotty
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Villa Montana for 6 days/5nites. Grand place. Ocean waves were 25 feet high which was very unusual. I was there for a Destination wedding and the staff took care of us. Were there some problems, sure. Some plumbing difficulties, etc... But nothing one couldn't live with. The staff was friendly, mostly. All were respectful. Prices at lunch and dinner were reasonable. Will I recommend? Absolutely.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful setting, not so beautiful service!”
Reviews.Author: TLL2008
Reviews.Content: The Villa Montana resort is a lovely setting and our rooms were equally lovely. However, we had reserved (& paid for) an ocean front 3-bedroom villa & were told there weren't any. Eventually we were moved closer to the ocean, but it took LOTS of persistence and the help of the agency we used to book our reservations. Our showers had no hot water & the kitchen was barely stocked. There were no bikes, snorkeling equipment or spa. The fitness center equipment did not work. The climbing wall didn't have all the necessary equipment. Service was always friendly and always at a leisurely pace! On the plus side, it's clean and peaceful with amazing views.

Reviews.Title: “Vacationer Beware!!”
Reviews.Author: corgs78
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at Villa Montana in Aguadilla for a week in March and it was horrible. We are both avid travelers and have gone to many Caribbean destinations and this was by far the worst. The rooms were nice and the maid staff is very helpful. However, we never felt welcomed anywhere. The beach is small and you have to hunt down a chair to sit. Service at the restaurant is so slow and overpriced. I shouldnâ€™t have to go on a Caribbean vacation and have to hunt down the bartender to get another drink, a bill or even water. The locals are disrespectful and rude. Nothing is more unattractive than sitting on a beach and seeing locals throwing beer bottles into the ocean. They take no pride in their island and they treat tourists with disgust. There is no island atmosphere here. We couldnâ€™t wait to pack to go home. Save your money and go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Neutral - ok but you can find a better place”
Reviews.Author: billerm
Reviews.Content: The good: The property is beautiful with lovely gardens. There are two pools, two tennis courts, a climbing wall and a playground for young kids. There are two restaurants on the property. The people who work there are very friendly. The apartments are comfortable and it is lovely to sit outside on your veranda to enjoy the birds chirping. The not so good: There are two areas on the beach through which you can enter the water. Otherwise, there is too much coral to make it safe to enter. The water is nice but choppy. The beach is hard to run on even though it is 3 miles long as the brochure tells you. Other than housekeeping, there are really no services in this hotel. They say they have tennis raquets, bicycles and kayaks that you can use but they are so limited in numbers that you really don't get to use them. It would be better if they rented them out to you so that they would have them available. Many of the units are owned and used by locals who bring everything with them and it seems like the hotel feels that there is no need to provide the typical amenities that tourists require. The distances on this part of the island are very big so you are kind of stuck here unless you want to drive 1 hour plus to go to another town or beach or rain forest. There are no restaurants outside of the hotel to speak of and the local supermarket is kust so so. We went to Rincon which is about 1 hour from this hotel. There is more to do there and it is closer to the southern coast where the waters are calmer and there is a lot more to do so that might be a better bet.

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful wedding!”
Reviews.Author: Innqueen1
Reviews.Content: My daughter was married March 2008 at Villa Montana and both she and I couldn't have hoped for a better wedding. The staff had worked to provide the setting that she wanted (she and her fiance had traveled there the previous April) and so there is always the uncertainty of what the flowers, cake, bouquets , tables will look like. Let's face it with destination weddings you are putting alot of faith into the hotel's final choices. But, happiness prevailed and the bride was relaxed. You get to know everyone for a few days before the main event. From Grandmas to college kids, fun is had by all. There were times when we waited a long time for food, or the tv in a villa needed fixing but who cares? Really, It's Puerto Rico where the pace is slower and overall the ceremony is why we are there and the hard working wedding staff does a supreme job. Mildred is the bomb! Thank you Villa Montana for giving us memories we will never forget. Innqueen1

Reviews.Title: “Amazing room, but two weddings left them understaffed”
Reviews.Author: panicbutton
Reviews.Content: We stayed just one night here, but two days on our way to other Puerto Rico destinations. Glad we stayed just one night, as the beach was very rocky, surf rough and beach not so pretty. I realize I just don't like the Atlantic for a vacation, not the hotel's fault. We booked a one bedroom suite instead of a room. WOW! We walked into a huge one bedroom apt. with a living room/dining room combination the size of my apt in NYC with a matching terrace outfitted with a gas grill and nice outdoor furniture. A full kitchen with laundry room were also there with a hotel-room sized bedroom (queen bed) and regular, combo bathtub/shower. Very nice room furnished beautifully. I felt like I'd borrowed a friend's apt. Unfortunately, the hotel had two weddings there that weekend so the restaurant was closed for dinner the night we were there.
