Also, glad we arrived in the daytime because the hotel is in the middle of nowhere, but only about 15 minutes from the Aguadilla airport. The town is a surfer village meant for younger folks than us - more bar scene than culinary delights. But just fine for an overnight and we were on our way to Rincon and Ponce. Very nice staff and ultra clean. Two tiny pools and tennis courts we didn't use. Right next door to a riding stables with a horse ring on the hotel's property. Decent fitness room for a hotel this small. They were definitely understaffed this weekend with all the emphasis on pleasing the wedding parties. This place is not for people with disabilities as room was two flights up and elevator broken. Seems like a condo community for PR residents of other parts of the island that use it as a weekend place and occassionally rent it out. Would be good for quiet getaway if I planned a relaxation or romantic stay. We were a family with an active teen, so it wasn't the place for us to stay more than a night or two.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the Money!”
Reviews.Author: TravelHungry
Reviews.Content: Our family with two teenage boys stayed one night at Villa Montana over Christmas vacation 2007. The Villa Montana is incredibly expensive, and was very disappointing in many ways. The stand-alone villa we were given turned out to be owned by someone. We learned this when we walked in are found someone had left the closets open with prescription medications and other personal affects. When I called the front desk they said just to leave them alone and that the owner was supposed to lock the closet. The Villa Montana website said there was "beach fishing", and when I asked at the front desk they looked at me with a blank stare. In general, the attitude at the front desk was rude and unhelpful - especially shocking given the prices. The restaurant service was very slow. There was a party outside on the grounds and they would not lower the music at 11 pm. At the fitness center the treadmill, bicycyle, and stairmaster were all broken. When I reported these at the front desk they were not apologetic. The bedspread on the bed was old and worn looking. My advice - drive further and go to the Copamarina Resort in the South - Fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing family vacation”
Reviews.Author: BEL123
Reviews.Content: My husband, young son and I spent a week at Villa Montana and were very happy with our vacation. We had a two bedroom garden view villa which was extremely spacious and comfortable with several balconies. The kitchen was reasonably well equipped and housekeeping cleaned the entire villa thoroughly every day. The grounds are beautiful, two pools, a great playground, tennis courts and beautiful beach. It is very relaxing and lowkey which was perfect for us. The garden view villas are less expensive than the ocean view, but still no more than a three minute walk from the beach. The staff was unfailingly polite and pleasant. There is wireless internet access in the hotel lobby and near the restaurant. I would be very happy to go back again. A few critiques/drawbacks, things you should be aware of: Although the website said that the resort was 90 minutes from the San Juan airport, it was took us two hours to drive on a Sunday afternoon. I was told it can take significantly longer on a weekday when there is traffic. If you can, I would recommend flying into the Aguadilla airport which is about 15 minutes away. Many people appeared to have trouble checking in. Although we had reserved and paid for a two bedroom villa, we were shown to a one bedroom and told no two bedrooms were available. After some persistence on my part, they found a beautiful two bedroom for us. I witnessed several other people checking in who seemed to be having problems as well, and when we checked out early on Sunday morning, the young man at the desk couldn't figure out how to run our bill properly. The hotel staff seemed slightly overwhelmed on the weekend when a wedding was taking place, and the more casual restaurant was closed to accomadate the wedding. We had planned to eat with our son in our villa that night, but if we had expected to eat in one of the hotel's restaurants, it would have been problematice because the nicer restaurant is not really appropriate for a four year old. The beach at the resort is not great for kids because it is rocky and rough. If you have young kids who want to spend a lot of time in the ocean, it might not be ideal. On balance, the positives far outweighed the negatives for this beautiful resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - family friendly”
Reviews.Author: texasmom13
Reviews.Content: Villa Montana Beach resort is a dream come true vacation location. We travel with our three kids and so we have to find a place where there is lots to do and where we can have a villa so that we can cook our own food and spread out. We found Villa Montana on the web because we had never been to Puerto Rico â€“ honestly I did not think I would like it with all the night life and crowds. But Villa Montana is on the west coast, away from the crowds and easy to get to with Aguadilla Airport literally 15 minutes from the resort. I donâ€™t know where to start is how happy we were. The kids loved the snorkeling, swimming, horseback riding, rappelling, hiking and biking. My husband and I loved that they loved it, and of course for us we could participate in all the action or just find a hammock and relax to read a book, or walk that beautiful long stretch of deserted beach. This is one of the few resort websites that was truthful. The place was even better than it looked on line. The restaurant can be a bit pricey for a family of 5 to eat in every night, but we did eat there because the food was so good and one of the restaurants was right on the beach. We could not resist. But most of the time time we cooked in our villa, ate on the patio and felt like kings. We are going back and telling all our friends. This place is secluded, relaxing, fun and has very nice people that work there. What a perfect vacation

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing - but not much more...”
Reviews.Author: Vornadito
Reviews.Content: My wife & I recently returned from the Villa Montana - we stayed there from February 8 â€“ February 11, 2008. We went for a destination wedding. ARRIVAL: We flew into BQN (Aguadilla) not San Juan. I would highly recommend you do that as well. Friends who flew into San Juan had to rent a car and take a 1.5-2 hour ride from San Juan to the resort. We did have to fly out of a less convenient airport to fly into BQN, but it was well worth it! Check in was fairly easy and they drove use to our room on a little golf cart. ROOM: We had a Garden View room. It was small. There was a small TV and a bed. Maneuvering around with 2 people was frustrating at times...The closet was ok and there was an empty mini-fridge in the room for us to use...but the room was disappointing. GROUNDS: - The grounds were ok. - There is a decent gym available - There were 2 restaurants ---1) Eclipse - a breakfast/lunch/dinner type place. Overpriced but decent food. Be warned that a meal will take anywhere from an hour to 3 hours - they are SLOW... It overlooks the ocean - so it is a nice view - but a nice lunch for 2 with a drink will cost $40-$60 and dinner with some wine will cost $100 for 2... 2) I think the other restaurant was called "O" or something like that. I was some sort of asian-fusion type place, but only open on Friday and Saturday...never ate there. STAFF: - The staff was friendly, just "Island-Slow" ACTIVITIES: Not much to do there aside from sitting by a small pool or on the beach. There are a couple of kayaks - you can try to snorkel, maybe wind-surf if you can rent one....but there are not a lot of activities to do during the day... WEATHER: We were there for 3.5 days - overall the weather was nice - around 80 degrees during the day and a little cooler (65-70) at night. It did rain 2/3 nights there from about 5-6 or so...but that is just luck and nothing that I would really think to complain about in a short trip - just posting it to be complete. CROWD: We were there with a lot of people for the destination wedding, but aside from us...the place was kind of dead...not much going on otherwise... SUMMARY: It was a very nice place for a destination wedding, but I could not imagine going there for a longer period of time and not having plans to take excursions to other places...especially after enjoying other all-inclusive resorts and what they have to offer!

Reviews.Title: “Lots of fun!”
Reviews.Author: CloudyDae
Reviews.Content: My family of 4, myself, husband and DD 12 and DS 8 had a great time at Vila Montana and Isabela last April! We had a room by the pool and the tennis courts and it was a short walk to the beach and the restaurant. We did not eat at the restaurant except for a bruchetta appetizer, partly because 2 of our traveling companions became ill after eating at the restaurant, so it made me a bit nervous. There is a hammock by the pool, which is nice. The rooms were kept very clean, but don't keep your windows open, I did to let steam out of the bathroom, and when we returned there was an iguana on the ceiling! There is a small area of swimmable beach, if you go to the beach and walk to the right, past the rocks, you'll see that there's an area that is relatively flat. We went here almost every day. Snorkling is good here as well. The gym on the property was good, w/ a treadmill and hand weights. My kids and I did horseback riding on the beach using Tropical Trail Rides and it was really good and definately worth the $$$. It may rain a bit every day, but remember that it is a rain forest, and it normally doesn't last long. The area itself is not very touristy, and a knowledge of a bit of Spanish can go a long way! There are very good places to eat close by, I can't remember their names, but one place was on the beach and had a man walking around w/ a little guitar serenading, it was a lot of fun and a bit comical; he would sing spanish songs to the locals, then come to our table of 14 and sing "I did it my way" in English. I smile remembering it! My husband, son and a few others chartered a boat in La Paguera where they went deep sea fishing, where my brother in law caught a blue Marlin and others caught Mahi Mahi. We also drove down to La Paguera a day earier and went on a private snorkling trip through the mangroves for I think $200 for the 4 of us including sandwiches. There is a grocery store close to the hotel, but beware: it has very short hours on Sunday. Also, there's a "donut shop" in a strip mall by the grocery store, and we went in there and had sandwiches that they toast, very yummy! We had a great trip to Isabela, and the Villa Montana was a very nice hotel and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!! and so will you!”
Reviews.Author: Dupra
Reviews.Content: I wanted to write a review about Villa Montana because of how wonderful my experience was this weekend. My situation may be a little different from the average person's because I am planning a wedding here. After a year of emailing and calling back and forth, I was so excited to finally see the resort and meet the people I have been communicating with for so long. As you can imagine planning a wedding from thousands of miles away is a little nerve racking but I must say I was pleasantly surprised! All of the pictures I have seen were beautiful, but to actually be there is 10 times better! We (me, my fiancÃ©, his mom and dad, and my mom) stayed in a 2 bed room villa. It was not your typical hotel room. Beautiful cherry wood furniture and little accent pieces gave this villa character. The rooms were a good sized too. It was very comfortable and clean. I saw a few more of the rooms when they gave me a tour and they were just as nice. Every villa is different, so if you want something specific just ask and they will accommodate you the best they can. The grounds of the resort were beautiful. Green grass, beautiful palm trees, tropical birds, and lots of flowers! I liked the beach a lot. I notice that a few people in previous reviews were complaining about the beach being rocky... and it is, but it is not fault of the resort. It's not like they put the rocks there. It's called nature!!! My advice is to bring water shoes. The waves are very strong and I got knocked over a few times but I had fun! It was great being able to watch the surferâ€™s early in the morning also. The staff was amazing! Our plan arrived on the island at 3am. I feel bad because I can not remember the man's name that was at the front desk, but he was so nice. He gave us a ride to our room on a golf cart and help us bring our bags in to the room. I had to call him back because we needed an extra set of sheets for the couch. He was back at our villa in 10 minutes. I wish I could give everybody we met a shout out but I don't remember everybodyâ€™s names. Melany, who is my wedding planner, is one of the sweetest people you will every meet. We have been talking over the phone, emails, and IM's for over a year now so when I finally met her, it was like seeing an old friend! Cynthia and Stacey were also very helpful with our food tasting, showing us around the resort, and helping us make final decisions about our wedding contract. Ashley was one of the bartender's that we met and she was very accommodating. My family likes to have fun and joke around with people and Ashley fit right in and had fun with us. The food!!!! Mmmmm is all I can say. I know that in other reviews people were saying how the food service was slow and it is a little slower than what you would be use to. Keep in mind that they do not microwave their food. Everything is fresh, made to order, and is presented to you as a piece of art almost. Chef Jeremie loves what he does and you can tell through the food that is served. My family was ready to buy him a plane ticket and bring him back to the states. We found our selves just ordering food to see if we could try everything on the menu before we left! Ok I know my review is getting a little long and drawn out, but I really enjoyed myself. If you are really looking to just be able to relax, this is so the place for you. We live in DC where it is full of not-so-nice people and lots of traffic to even get down the street. SO to be able to sit on the beach and literally be by myself was great. There are other activities outside of the resort that you can take advantage of too. I am so excited and happy that I found Villa Montana to have my wedding, I can not wait to get back there in April! I will be sure to write a review about my wedding experience too!

Reviews.Title: “All in all, a great vacation”
Reviews.Author: Laughguard
Reviews.Content: Read the many reviews carefully, for they contain the good and the bad about this resort pretty much the way we saw it. We had a perfect vacation, a great deal from Expedia, and perfect weather, so it's hard to complain about the many little flaws with this place, but had things not broken well, I might not have been as happy. The grounds are immaculate and beautiful, the beach is right there with great sand (miles of walking) and excellent lounges (with shade available). The water is Carribean warm, but the reef along this shore makes swimming a bit tricky (although doable). Surfers, snorkelers, etc can have a lot of fun. The tennis courts are free, and in good shape (the surface is a bit strange, but kinda fun). They have night lights, though one of the two courts has a missing light. We had a one bedroom unit, which was a bit small, more than a bit shabby, but clean and adequate. There was a small leak in the toilet, a broken wall mirror, and a shower bar fell off while we were there. There were lots of little service glitches .. phones didn't work for a while, a power outage, spotty cellphone coverage, but housekeeping was good. They could have used more or better building maintenance. Everyone was VERY friendly. We had a continental breakfast buffet with our Expedia deal, and started the day off at Eclipse (their restaurant) overlooking the surf with fresh juice and a set of food that varied in quality and availablility each day. There was often yogurt, croissants, toast, cereal, and fruit, although many days they ran out early or just didn't have things. We had a few billing glitches, but they were all resolved pleasantly. Everybody went out of their way to be very nice and helpful, and that goes a long way towards making issues like those mentioned above less burdensome.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasurable stay at Villa Montana”
Reviews.Author: fdom
Reviews.Content: Although our stay was just for a single night, as we were attending a wedding, our experience at Villa Montana was definitely a pleasurable one. The wedding itself was magical, the ceremony held at a small gazebo overlooking the ocean. The food for the reception, held at the small beachfront restaurant, The Eclipse, was superb. So was the breakfast buffet the next day, and lunch too (we found prices very reasonable, and the food creative and fresh). Our accomodations were spotlessly clean - we could'nt even find a single spot on the glass shower enclosure - and spacious. Our villa was a one bedroom unit, with a very large and comfortable kitchen (also spotlessly clean and well-kept) and also a full-size dining and living room, plus terrace. Although our stay was so short, we can imagine coming back to stay longer, relaxing in these very comfortable facilities. Our kids had a lot of fun by the pool (they have two, one near the center of the resort, another by the beachfront restaurant). Overall, my wife and I thought this was a great place to relax, amidst the beautiful tropical landscaping. Kudos to management and staff, as they made us feel wanting to come back for more, which we will do.

Reviews.Title: “not the service I expected...”
Reviews.Author: jwb3rx
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Villa Montana to attend a wedding that our friends were having here. The wedding was beautiful and the property is nice as well. The resort is in a remote part of the island and if relaxation is what you are looking for this is the area to be. The beach is small and the ocean is very rocky which makes it a bit challenging to enter and exit the ocean. If this is important to you I would be cautious of staying here. The property consists of mainly villas which we stayed. Let me start with our check-in. This was certainly not what I expected. Once I completed my registration, we had to wait 30 minutes in the small office area for one fo the employees to escort us to our villa. Why this is necessary I did not understand and was not given a very good explanation. We were with other guests as well who waited along with us. Not a good way to start our stay here. Our first villa was a bit small for our liking and I went back to the office where we were quickly upgraded to a 2 BR villa with 2 bathrooms, 1 with an outside shower which was nice, kitchen and living room area. We were helped with our luggage to the next villa which was a nice gesture. Once in our villa is where things were not exactly what I expected from a resort like this and from the prices they charge. The upgrade to the new villa did come at a price of course. The villa was cleaned that day but overall it was a bit run down and not worth the money. The location is what you are there for, not the accommodations. One of our ceiling fans was broken, the fridge light was broken, there were bugs we had to take care of and the biggest pain was that the villa had one phone which was broken. Since we were there for a wedding we needed to keep in touch with people for daily activities. Cell phones did not work so the villa phone is important. I went back to the office to request we have someone give us a new phone. Our original employee came to the room to try and fix the phone which he could not. He said he would be right back and after an hour later he did not. I had to go back to the office again, to be told there was nothing they could do till the next day. Why couldn't I be given a new phone to plug in? No one could tell me that. So for 2 days we had no phone to keep in touch with our other friends on the resort. The front desk was not helpful at all with this and actually seemed annoyed when I expected this to be fixed. Overall, the resort looks great from the outside and is in a remote and beautiful part of PR. The rooms/villa are in need of an upgrade and I think they need a couple more people to help with check-in and maintenance on the property. The wedding was a success and that was the main thing. If not for the wedding, I would not return to this resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway”
Reviews.Author: dsklar
Reviews.Content: I decided to spend a week in PR as a result of serendipitously finding the Villa Montana website: I was planning a return trip to Glacier National Park in MONTANA. And it was a perfect choice for us this year. My wife and I usually leave our kids with the grandparents to go hiking each summer, but I realized that it would be too adventurous since we had a newborn with us this year. Our one bedroom villa at Villa Montana was steps from the ocean, the pool, and the restaurant. With our patio just outside our room, we were able to let our daughter take her 2-3 naps/day inside while we enjoyed the soothing breeze off the ocean or caught up on sleep ourselves. Nightly babysitting allowed us to play tennis, relax, swim under the stars, eat deliscious meals (thank you, Jeremy, for making special vegetarian dishes for us) , and walk along the beach. During the day, we enjoyed reading under umbrellas or palm trees, my wife reports two terrific massages, and I snorkelled daily just outside of the resort. A wedding at the resort was unobtrusive and didn't effect our enjoyment of the resort one bit. We felt so relaxed here, that we cancelled plans for a side trip to St. Thomas! As for activities near the resort, I can only speak about a one tank dive from Isabella (average diving); Areceibo, the Caves, and diving at Desecheo island were all on my potential activites list but we were too tired to do much of anything. The Villa Montana was a delight: Actually, it is true to its website.

Reviews.Title: “Destination wedding? Prepare for sticker shock”
Reviews.Author: Reactor1966
Reviews.Content: A word of advice for anyone planning a destination wedding in Puerto Rico - if you decide to check out the Villa Montana, be prepared for sticker shock. To give you some context, when we started to look for something in the Isabella area, Villa Montana seemed like a good choice, and we were very excited. However, once we received the contract it became a major disappointment. The number of fees this resort charges for a beach wedding and reception are astronomical. $55 per person for "decoration fee", $7 + tax + tip (per slice) + $40 delivery charge for the cake? If money is no option, then I suppose you should check this place out. But if you think that $200+ per person is obscene, then stay away. There are other places that are as good or better.

Reviews.Title: “Poor management”
Reviews.Author: madge21
Reviews.Content: Our family has been to the area of Isabela/Rincon six times now. On one of these visits we decided to try Villa Montana. We had a two bedroom beachfront villa. The resort was not full when we were there (during the summer). I was so angry when we returned from our stay there that I did not want a review then. Why my anger? Because for two of our days there they decided to power wash all the chairs and tables from the restaurant. The restaurant was just off to the right of our villa. The power washing, of course, required the use of a very loud and noisy generator. The cleaning was done between our villa and the beach, right off the restaurant. So, not only was the noise unbearable, but it also detracted from the beach view. As I sat on our porch and tried to read, I was listening to that awful generator go for two days. This is an example of poor management. The resort management should have shut the resort for two days (not taken reservations for several days at their slowest time) so they could do the necessary cleaning. To subject their guests, paying almost $500 a night at the time, to such noise and pollution, was clearly a mistake in judgement. We decided when we left that we would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: John066
Reviews.Content: Although the setting is lovely, the service is poor, and there are security issues to deal with. And be prepared for the electricity to go out periodically as well. Also the pools are very small, considering that this is labeled a resort. The restaurant was also below par, and since it's in an isolated part of the beach, it's difficult navigating out at night to another eatery unless you know your way around. Pretty disappointing experience overall.

Reviews.Title: “Dream Wedding in Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: mudhen1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently got married at the Villa Montana. After doing extensive research on destination wedding sites, we decided the Villa Montana was the perfect location for our small intimate wedding. We loved the resorts isolated location, its close proximity to the Aguadilla airport and its reputation for great food. Many larger resorts have multiple weddings per weekend unlike the Villa Montana who caters to one bride---This was a huge plus! Despite rattling my nerves by not returning phone calls in a timely manner, missing several important scheduled conference calls, and seemingly ignoring some emails, the wedding itself was spectacular in every aspect imaginable. Our wedding weekend exceeded all of our expectations and our thirty guests continue to rave about the entire experience. With the help of our wedding planner Melany, we arranged for taxi service for all of our guests on Thursday night to the Ocean Front Restaurant (3 miles down the road). Great food and amazing views---I would definitely recommend this restaurant to all. On Friday night, we had our rehearsal dinner at the O Restaurant, the tapas restaurant at the resort. The ambiance was spectacular---dark wood, comfortable cushion seats, candlelight and Asian inspired decorations. The food was out of this worldâ€”Chef Samuel Hernandez did a fabulous job preparing the dishes! After the rehearsal dinner, we arranged for salsa lessons for all of our guests. Two instructors came to the Villa Montana to teach us the basic salsa moves. This was one of the highlights of the weekend. The wedding itself was an amazing event. The ceremony and reception sites were beautifully decorated---the floral arrangements were gorgeous. Melany, our wedding planner, took care of all of the little details we requested. She was attentive to all of our needs. We had a very talented guitarist play at our ceremony and cocktail hour while a DJ played great dance music at the reception. Our guests spent most of the evening on the dance floor. Executive Chef Jeremy outdid himself! The food was five star quality! Our guests keep raving about how great the food was at the resort. I am so grateful to all of the staff at the Villa Montana for making our wedding a truly memorable experience. Melany, Lizbeth, Diana and Mildred of the wedding department as well as Shakira at the front desk and Eva who worked both events, made sure our guests had a great stay at the Villa Montana. Our wedding at the Villa Montana was everything we hoped for and more.

Reviews.Title: “My Fairy Tale Wedding”
Reviews.Author: SyndiQ321
Reviews.Content: I had my wedding at the Villa Montana Beach Resort on July 14, 2007. Words canâ€™t describe how absolutely gorgeous this event was. It was literally a dream come true. My husband and I are from San Francisco and did not go visit the hotel before the actual wedding. As you can imagine, I was completely nervous that things wouldnâ€™t go well or that I would be disappointed in the resort, but this was completely blown out of the water as soon as I arrived. The grounds of the hotel are very well maintained and the villas are gorgeous, especially the larger 2 and 3br villas. The dÃ©cor, cleanliness, and spaciousness of the larger villas are unlike anything other Iâ€™ve ever seen. My husband and I stayed in a 1br garden view villa, which was the perfect size for us and was literally steps away from the beach. It was about a 1min walk to the sand and you could hear the waves crashing from the patio in front of the room. We spent 9 days at the hotel to get a feel for the place before the wedding and had a great time. We had a total of about 40 guests and rented a total of 10 rooms at the resort. We were happy with all of them and had no complaints from our guests. During the wedding planning process, I was worried because things seemed TOO easy. I know that sounds silly, but when planning a wedding, you expect to be running around like crazy! But Mildred (our planner) and her staff made it sooo easy for me. We literally just chose what weâ€™d like from their options (music, food, dÃ©cor, etc) and I sent her photos of the idea I had for the cake, bouquet and flowers. They nailed it and got everything perfect! My flower arrangements were so lovely, my bouquet was perfect, and the FOODâ€¦oh manâ€¦the FOOD was to die for!! So good! We went for the 3 day event with a beach BBQ on Friday night, the wedding and reception on Saturday night and a brunch on Sunday. Every meal was delicious. Our guests were sooo impressed! And to be honest, everyone left thinking we spent way more for the wedding than we actually did. The prices are very affordable for a wedding and we got a fabulous 3 day event for less than a 1 day wedding in San Fran. The icing on the cake to our special day was that the hotel arranged for me to arrive on a white horse and meet my father at the end of the aisle. Our guests are STILL talking about that horse! Talk about a fairy tale wedding. I also took advantage of the spa at the hotel. Alfredo, the massage therapist, was so wonderful! I left feeling so relaxed and at ease. The only thing I would write about the hotel, particularly the Eclipse Restaurant is that this is NOT the place to eat if youâ€™re in a hurry. The food is delicious, however, the kitchen is on island time. The upside to this is that it gives you a chance to really kick back, enjoy the sounds of the coqui and the ocean crashing and feel the ocean breeze. For me, when Iâ€™m on vacation, Iâ€™m not in a hurryâ€¦so I had no complaints. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. I brought my dog to the resort as well and they listened when I asked for them not to come in the room when I wasnâ€™t around. I really appreciated that. Overall, the 9 days I was there was very well spent. I was so pleased with the entire staff, particularly Mildred, Melany, and Lizbeth. These girls rock and made my wedding a dream come true. If youâ€™re looking for a laid back place to have your special event, this is the spot. I canâ€™t wait to go back for our 1 yr anniversary. Feel free to email me with any questions or to see more photos of the event....I know that helps when trying to pick a wedding destination. Thanks! (syndiquiles@gmail.com)

Reviews.Title: “Great Wedding at Villa Montana!”
Reviews.Author: A567
Reviews.Content: I held my wedding at Villa Montana in Jan 07 and coudn't have been happier with the event. My husband and I are from Boston and were looking for a small intimate beach resort to hold our wedding. The staff was wonderful and the accommodations suited our 100 guests perfectly. I made all my decisions regarding food, music and photographer based on recommendations from the hotel wedding staff and was very happy with the services. As with most weddings not all goes to plan...it's the kind of place that the overall results are so great that the minor mishaps have no bearing on the celebration. If you like the idea of a small island wedding without a lot of bells and whistles, this is the place. I would gladly do it again! A. Scheller

Reviews.Title: “Unique Resort; Beautiful Wedding”
Reviews.Author: kmizah
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our wedding at the Villa Montana. We traveled with 70 of our friends and family to celebrate our wedding which was 9 months in the making! I want to write about the 'resort' experience as much as possible in that I know how much people rely on these reviews when making plans; as did I. My wedding "planning " experinece was different and much less personal and much less 'fun' than our stay there so I really want to focus on the positive - and there was a lot of positive! I would advise everyone to visit the resort's web site as much as possible. It is busy but they honestly left nothing to be desired in giving the overall feel of the place. It is not perfect - and that, quite honestly, to us, was the best part of it all! We were finished with resort perfection and super-size a long time ago. If you are the same, then this is the place for you. All of the villas are different - all decorated differently and they were all charming - not perfect; but charming. The beach was beautiful! Yes, it's rocky but don't let anyone tell you it's not swimable. If you want to walk barefoot acoss the sand and walk right into the water - then you will be disappointed. It's just not that 'kind' of a beach but that does not mean it's not beautiful and does not have a lot to offer. Out of 72 people at my wedding, not a single person had ANY problem laying on those overstuffed lounge chairs all afternoon, snorkeling, walking 100 feet to the pool, or walking a few feet off to the side to a clearing that is swimable. It was just different - but still an awesome setting. The staff - WONDERFUL and I mean wonderful! From the Cabana girl (Rosita - we all miss you!!!) to Diana (the resturant manager) to Shakira (at the front desk) they, without a doubt, make this resort what it is. They were attentive, personal, pleasant, chatty, professional and very humble. They truly make the Villa Montana the relaxing and unique place that it is. The resturant and the food - fantastic! The setting is romantic and charming and every meal we had was great. Yes, service can be slow but if you watch very carefully you simply can not miss the fact that they are truly trying and they truly want you to have a good experience. I can't say that about too many places. And, if you got your meal in 1/2 an hour, you would miss the ambiance that the Eclipse has so it's a great trade off as far as I'm concerned! So, sit back and relax! Since we had a rehearsal BBQ and a wedding dinner there, we had the opportunity to meet with Chef Jeremy a couple times. And if you get this priviledge then you will love the food even more! His modesty, attention to detail, and descriptions are enchanting! The comments from our guests about the dishes served at our wedding have not stopped. It was fabulous! On the wedding side - I am addicted to flowers and I was amazed and floored by how beautiful they all were. The time that went into getting a feel for my colors, my dress, the wedding party attire, the mood we wanted - all of it was breathtaking. Jessica did a wonderful job! For our BBQ we enjoyed the music of Mellow Pan Trio and they were perfect! For our wedding ceremony we had Alexis Espada (saxophone) and a guitarist. This was the highlight of our wedding! They were incredible! We could have listened to them all night. The ceremony music was very important to us and we could not have asked for anyone better or a better combination than these two! The resort did have power outages while we where there - one very long one and some of our guests had issues with the air conditioning in their rooms and a couple with the shower water. If you are counting on internet service - don't; it's just too sporatic to be relied upon. With the power - not a lot they can do! And with almost every issue, they responded in a timely manner. Like I said - the place is not perfect and most of the staff really do try very hard to please! They do have an area of opportunity that would make a big difference to guests - especially wedding guests and that is the check in time. The flights into Aguidilla are either very early or very late. Since most of our guests were coming from JFK, that meant most got to the resort at 10:30am. And it's hot...really, really hot so it was frustrating that so many could not check into their rooms until 4pm. That really gets to be an unreasonable period of time for most to sit around and wait for a room to be ready. I think the resort would go a long way in customer satisfation if they would compromise a bit more on these flight arrival times vs. check in times since many travel with children. Just a suggestion. Again, the resort is small and the staffing likewise but this would go a long way in easing a frustration that can develop at the very beginning of a stay. Other musts: Tropical Trail Rides and Happy Belly's!!! And the Lazy Parrot in Rincon. Bioluminescent Bay - forget about it! It's a long way to go for a town that does not even really 'open' until 4:30pm! Just stay on the beach at the resort!! My wedding planning experience was not as soothing and personal as the resort is and that's sad. But, the issues I had were seamless to my guests (for the most part) and I can say with certainty that they all had a wonderful time - even the ones that didn't think they would and each and every one of them said that our wedding was beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful alternative to "big-box" resorts!”
Reviews.Author: pitbulls
Reviews.Content: My husband was in PR for work, so we took the opportunity to take a short vacation. We had Marriott points to use at the San Juan Marriott, but had one night that wasn't covered. We both surf, so after finding that the northwest corner of the island is the place for this, I researched tons of hotels in this area and decided on the Villa Montana. We loved it! We wished we could stay the whole vacation. Once we got to the very nice Marriott resort in San Juan, I still wished we were at Villa Montana! This place is totally different than your typical high-rise resort like in San Juan. It's quiet, small, uncrowded. It wasn't perfect...the check-in staff took their time getting to me, and yes, the service at the restaurants is slow. But other than that, not much to complain about! The water was actually quite calm when we went. It is rocky, but there were planty of sandy gaps in the rocks to enter the water from. In the evening after dinner we went down to the beach and literally had it all to ourselves. I also went to the pool a time or two and had it all to myself. We loved this. We stayed in one of the regular hotel rooms. It was nice. Nice private patio. It wasn't as typically fancy as a Marriott-type place, but we liked that it felt a bit more exotic. The resort looks very big from the map, but in fact is compact, so don't worry that the hotel rooms appear to be far from the beach...its really very close. This place is all about expectations and what you are looking for! If you want a Marriott-resort type place, you might be disappointed. But if you want a peaceful, quiet, private place, this is it!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: chriske5
Reviews.Content: This was an incredibly romantic and secluded experience! The beach was beautiful, the staff was excellent, and the villas very romantic. I have one word of caution. I had a massage, (I've had them done before by women only), and I would caution you that it was done by a man, and there was no modesty involved. I don't consider myself to be a prude, but it was a very uncomfortable experience. It was done in daylight, and at times I was concerned that I was exposed. I was more tense after the massage than before. I left my bathing suit top on because I was a little uncomfortable that it was a man, and he proceded to remove my top while I was lying on my stomach. If you have any modesty, I would not recommend the massage. Other than that, It was a beautiful, relaxing vacation. I would definitely go back here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Villa Montana-a resort with heart and soul!”
Reviews.Author: PolarBears
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay at the Villa Montana in April. Not only did I get married there but my new husband and I stayed there for our honeymoon as well. We absolutely loved our entire stay there. We felt extremely lucky to have had our wedding ceremony at such a beautiful and romantic location and feel tremendously grateful to the exceptional staff there who gave us the wedding of our dreams. I could go on forever about how special and terrific the wedding was (in fact our wedding photographer from the states liked it so much she is planning her own destination wedding at the Villa Montana!), however since this is a hotel and resort review, I focus my comments on those aspects. First off, I would like to say that the Villa Montana is truly a special, unique resort with heart and soul. The staff at the resort are warm, caring and unpretentious and the overall ambience of the resort is about making sure you relax and enjoy your stay. Not only are the grounds gorgeous, but they invite you to enjoy them with hammocks and comfy cushioned lounge chairs scattered throughout the complex. There is a peaceful, garden oasis in the center of the complex where guests can get massages/spa services, a tennis court, 2 pools (one that is open 24hrs and the other which is next to the bar), 2 fantastic restaurants--each with its own personality-- and of course a stunning beach. If you want to kick-back and relax in a tropical paradise drinking pina coladas on the beach, this is the resort for you. We chose this resort based on the numerous Trip Advisor reviews we read. While we can understand some of the complaints brought up in previous reviews for us, a lot of these issues/complaints were minor and did not detract from our stay at all. Furthermore, our impression is that the resort is concerned about those same issues and working hard to make improvements. We visited the Villa Montana in October 2006 and in the 7 months since our last visit, we have already seen improvementsâ€”sheets, blankets and towels have been upgraded, there is now wireless internet access in rooms, â€œOâ€� restaurant is up and running, Diana (the former events and sales coordinator) has been promoted to manage both restaurants to improve service because of her outstanding success running events at the VM, and service has gotten better and faster. Since this will be a rather long review, I have broken down the rest of the review into topics to make it easier for readers to browse through. Service: The service at the VM is friendly and enthusiastic. While some people may perceive the service as slow, we feel that it is just more in keeping with the â€œsit-back, relax and enjoyâ€� attitude of the Carribean in general. Rather than staff constantly interrupting you to check on you, the attitude here is let people enjoy their food and surroundings but be available when needed. We definitely didnâ€™t mind soaking up the sun and watching the beautiful waves while waiting a few extra minutes for tasty food. And in fact, we were very impressed with how genuinely dedicated all staff were in trying to make each guests stay comfortable. To give a couple examples (I actually have many more)â€¦during our reception dinner, since our wedding party was occupying half of the restaurant, our wedding coordinator and the restaurant manager waited tables themselves to make sure things ran smoothly for everyone. Another night, there was a torrential rainstorm (which was a fluke) with rain blowing into the open-air â€œEclipseâ€� restaurant horizontally. Staff ran around completely drenched to make sure guests were dry and comfortable and that food was still delivered hot. I believe that given the circumstances, most restaurants would have suspended service and I was impressed with the way the VM/ Eclipse displayed grace under fire. The most important thing to know about the service here is that rather than expecting to be treated like a king/queen, expect to be treated like a friend. Rooms: Clean, tastefully decorated and fun. We stayed in a â€œGarden-viewâ€� (although in reality, we had a partial ocean view) 3-bdrm villa (unit A8) that was about 50 yards from the beach. We loved it. In fact, we were only supposed to stay in it for the wedding weekend, however we loved it so much that we upgraded to stay in it an additional 5 days. The kitchen and living room are sunny and airy with high vaulted wood ceilings. There were 2 bathrooms with distinctive hand-painted tiles and the master-bathroom had a sunny outdoor garden-shower. Amenities include A/C, ceiling fans, CD player, telephone, 2 TVs w/ DVD player, wireless internet access, dishwasher and laundry machine w/ dryer. DÃ©cor is Balinese style dark mahogany furniture and tropical floral print fabrics that look like it belongs in a Pottery Barn catalog. However, each unit is different with its own personal touches. Housekeeping would come daily (although sometimes later in the day) and even washed dishes! We also stayed in a cliff-side hotel room for a few nights which actually had an ocean-view and a well-manicured backyard. There was a 4-poster king bed and hand-painted tile bathroom again. FYI: Garden villas are larger than Ocean villas and cliffside hotel rooms are larger than garden view rooms. However Ocean villas then garden villas/rooms are closer to the beach. Cliffside rooms are about a 5-7 minute walk from beach. Food: Tasty, fresh and innovative. There are 2 restaurants at the VM: â€œEclipseâ€� and â€œOâ€�. Chef Jeremie Cruz (who used to be at the El Conquistador) oversees both. Eclipse is the main restaurant open 7 days a week 3 meals a day. It is a stylish, open-air (i.e. wall-less) beachside restaurant with gorgeous views of the water. Food is delicious and seasonal--French/American with a Carribean flare. Favorites: Eggs Benedict for breakfast, black bean shrimp quesadilla for lunch and pan roasted corvina (tasted like Chilean sea bass) with beurre de blanc sauce over pureed yucca/taro root for dinner. Favorite drinks: pina coladas and passion fruit daiquiri. â€œOâ€� restaurant is an Asian-fusion tapas restaurant/lounge/club open for dinner on weekends. The dÃ©cor is romantic and chic. You enter through an antique, wood sculpted door imported from Bali. The restaurant has 3 eating areas. The first has red curtain day beds perfect for couples who want a romantic, private dinner (definitely make reservations in advance). The main dining room has dark hardwood floors and Japanese style sunken dining tables. The third room is an outdoor tatami room with Safari animal print dÃ©cor. Favorites: lamb tangine and then chocolate tempura for dessert. We tried a couple of restaurants off the resort but loved the food at the VM so much that we ate most of our meals there. Prices were reasonable: Breakfast: $10-15, Lunch: $15-20, Dinner: $20-30â€”definitely worth every penny. Facilities: well-appointed, with distinctive charm. There are tons of green grass, colorful flowers and swaying palm trees throughout the resort. The layout of the resort is multiple, well-spaced 2-3story villas/condos (not just one large concrete building like many beach resorts). Even hotel rooms are incorporated into the villas. Rather than posh (no valet parking or Jacuzzi tubs) the setting of the resort is stylishly comfortable with a fun and friendly ambience. What I love about the Villa Montana is that it has a distinctive personality and is not like your standard, chain hotel. In terms of activities, there is snorkelling, sea kayaking, tennis, and gym facilities (all for free). For extra fees-- rock climbing wall, horseback riding at a next door ranch (highly recommend), massages/spa services. The front desk can also help arrange tours, snorkelling/scuba trips. There is no casino here but with the addition of â€œOâ€�, there is more of a night-life at the resort now. However, if youâ€™re like me and enjoy peace and quiet, taking a private dip in their 24-hour pool was the perfect, romantic night for me. Location: rustic but absolutely gorgeous. The Villa Montana is located in Isabela in the northwest corner of Puerto Ricoâ€”about a 2 hour drive from San Juan but only 10 minutes from the Aguadilla aiport. The area has historically been a sleepy surfing town and tourism hasnâ€™t quite hit the area yet (which is actually something we loved about the place), but its an absolutely beautiful piece of land. I think this is one of the most important things to keep in mind in choosing your travel destination. This is a place to escape from it all and not a place to expect tons of museums/city life/casinos. The Villa Montana is the main attraction in the immediate vincinity (other than the beach and water activities of course) however other attractions nearby (about 30-45 min away) include Rio Camuy (underground river/caves) and the Arecibo radio tower (where Contact was filmed). There is also a public golf course about 10 minutes away. However if you want to get away from it all for a relaxing, romantic retreat, staying on the resort is perfect. If you do plan to leave the resort, a rental car is definitely recommended. Beach: The beaches of the area are varied in terms of surf but all beautiful. The one right in front of the VM is idyllicâ€”clean with tall palm trees, thick purple-cushioned lounge chairs, day-beds and bright yellow umbrellas. There are smooth flat rocks that lead into the water so water socks are a good idea. The surf can be a bit roughâ€”remember this is surfing areaâ€”but definitely swimmable. If you surf or kite-board (or like me, just enjoy watching), this seems to be the place to be. However, around the corner is Shacks beach which is a bit calmer and easier for kids and snorkelling. There are also beautiful reefs to exploreâ€”we saw tons of coral, colorful fish, and even squid! However, there are also lots of sea urchins so be careful. We read in some reviews complaints about the beach being dirty and littered. Our experience was that the beach at VM and Shacks beach were very clean but when we took the horseback ride further down the beach (maybe a mile or 2 down?) where the beach is public and not owned by the VM, it is not as well maintained. Pros: friendly, unpretentious, personalized service; beautiful setting; delicious food; clean, comfortable rooms with character. Cons: a lot of what other people may consider cons, I actually loved about the resort but depending on what youâ€™re looking for, you may find the following problematic: quiet night life, not located near city/museums/casino, web-site is hard to navigate; once youâ€™re there, you wonâ€™t want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Villa Montana is Awesome”
Reviews.Author: kuiarra
Reviews.Content: We just came back from celebrating our wedding in Villa Montana on 5/19. Let me tell you that they did an exceptional and outstanding job. They catered to us and our guests need as best as humanly possible. The staff went above and beyond to make sure that we were happy. I recommend anyone who wants to marry in PR to go there. If you are looking for laid back and quiet this is your place. Alot of people dont seem to understand that the part of the island that Villa Montana is located at is known for surfing, that is why the beach is rough, this is not Villa Montana's fault. Nature plays a hand in it entirely. Both restuarants are awesome Eclipse and O, I have read negative comments on them and let me start by saying that this is not the United States Mainland where everything is done quick, even in New York we see negatives. Villa Montana runs on a limited staff and is working at its best to make sure that everyone has there orders. I personally believe that with time they will be above exceptional. Most people should stop comparing Villa Montana with bigger hotels, it is not it is a remote place to spend quiet time and relax. Our wedding was held on the beach and it was marvelous. Lizbeth the coordinator went above and beyond and she deserves praise and admiration, it is not an easy job dealing with brides aboard, I am one of them. I am extremely great ful to her and Shakira from Front Desk who showed us what a real employee- guest relationship is. We loved them both and can not wait to go back. The rooms were great. We had our moments, but it happens with any hotel even the most expensive bigger name kinds, and I can tell you a thing about those hotels, and in all honesty put Villa Montana at the very top of the best list. They have a beautiful beach, if it is too rocky for you to swim, take a walk and you will end up at the Blue Hole, a spectacular snorkeling spot just a few steps from V.M. we spent hours there. V.M.'s pools are awesome our son loved it. Again I say Villa Montana and there staff, especially LIZBETH and SHAKIRA are awesome. And we cant wait to see them all again, I hope they dont mind me keeping in touch with them at Villa Montana, they are great workers as well as great friends. And we will miss them dearly now that we are back in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Resort, wonderful in every aspect!”
Reviews.Author: Webgemgamer22
Reviews.Content: I have lived here in the beautiful resort now for about 9 months. Let me start off saying that this place is paradise. It is located on the west coast of the island which is beautiful and perfect for relaxing under the sun. Not to mention it is located on Shacks Beach, known as one of PR's most beautiful beaches, with awesome coral reefs, and beautiful fish. The resort has two wonderful restaurants, each with completely different styles, each excellent in their own way. The employees are wonderful people and very kind people. The beach on which Villa Montana is located is very beautiful. One is able to walk as far as they can before they reach the end! The west coast of Puerto Rico is completely different than any other place I've ever visited in my life. It is sooo relaxing. Back at home, I was always going every which way, but the lifestyle here has slowed my life down and is is great! The last thing I want to talk about is the grounds. This part of the resort is awe inspiring. The beautiful landscape, the path's to get around, the restaurant, and everything else. I could go on and on about the beauty within Villa Montana Beach Resort. They have two pools, tennis courts, a spa, and of course the beach, the bestr part of PR. This excellent resort is the perfect getaway for those looking to have a great time experiencing the west coast of Puerto Rico. I definetly recommend coming down here for a vacation. If you come in with the right attitude, this place will exceed all expectaions you have for it. It is truly a masterpiece hidden on the coast of tiny PR, come visit, its simply amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Very Beautiful, but.......”
Reviews.Author: medfordpoker
Reviews.Content: I purposely waited to write this review until I calmed down a bit so I could be fair. The resort is very beautiful, but it is very disappointing. This will be a long review, so there is the Villa Montana 101 at the end for your benefit if youâ€™re in a hurry. But please read the whole review when you have a chance. I read all the reviews to this resort, but still had to stay there for an event we attended there. My conversations while making my arrangements went very well and Shakira and Janet helped me make changes before I went. While we were there the owners of the resort were there to. So 1st you need to get there. You can either take a 2 hour drive from San Juan in a rental car(250/week), Fly to Aquedilla and land at 3 am in morning($100 more to fly here), or take a cab from San Juan and pay $150each way. Once you decide that that directions the hotel gives are poorly written and only make since once you get there you'll be better off bringing your GPS or googlemapping it. Our friends who used the hotels info all got lost. The resort uses words like "look for" but doesn't say do this or that. They also say take 110, but not whether it's east or west. It's a stressful ride so if you do drive, try to land during the day so getting there is easier. Once you arrive at the front desk all you can smell is flowers and all you see and green grass and palms trees. The resort is absolutely beautiful. The grounds are clean like Disneyland. The rooms, or in our case the ocean view villa, was great at first look. But the floors are sandy and there is quite a bit of wear and tear. I have pics and will post ASAP. Our phone was messed up and always lit up there was a message. When we called they said there were no messages, cleared the line but then sent all calls to voicemail with no ring so we thought there were no messages once they said they fixed it but in actuality our friends were leaving messages and we thought because they cleared the lines the light must have been just broken. We were not the only people who had their phones forwarded. Again we were here for an event and needed to communicate with other guests. The restaurant, wow this is a nice looking place. All candlelit, hanging white linen blowing in the breeze and super comfy chairs. But get comfortable, because youâ€™re going to be sitting for a long long time and paying high end prices from delicious SOUNDING food. Being so isolated in the west of PR, Eclipse is the only place around. O was open but it is only open on Weekends. O is swanky and indoors. It has an open air area, but not ocean view like Eclipse. Thereâ€™s plenty to choose from, but each item is pretty basic tasting no matter what the description. Service is unbearable. Lunch is a two hour ordeal for a burger. Dinner is 2+ at a table. I think another chef would be helpful. From what I hear there's only one. Ok, so you ate, sat at the bar for another drink, and went to sleep on an average mattress. Youâ€™re a little stiff, but you smell the breakfast and are drawn to the PRican coffee. Breakfast is the best meal here; it's quick since there's less items and less customers. But as your eating you glance at the beach chairs and realize there are only 30 of them out and they all have towels on them. Yup, you read it right, even here at the sit back and relax place...you have to deal with getting up early and saving a seat that you may or may not use!!! Who needs this drama on vacation? What to do while your here: If you read the website, youâ€™re supposed to be prepared to relax and do beach activities. Well, the resort has a couple of snorkels and masks, and 2 2 person kayaks. Yup, that's it. No boogie boards, no surfboards, no 1 person kayaks, no jet skis, no nothing. Seeing this I went to the front desk to get info on surfing and horseback riding. The resort made my reservation for the horse riding, but messed up my friendâ€™s reservation. The front desk never called. As for surfing, since this area of PRICO is supposed to be renowned for it's surfing, they front desk gave me a brochure to call for a lesson. They surf place doesn't visit the report, you need to visit them. So, for beach activities, you are going to be very bored. You can go for a walk, but the 3 miles of beaches they brag about is littered with everything from glass to car parts, that is of course once you get away from the wild dogs all over the place. The event we went here for was spectacular. I'm not sure how any of the other guests got anything, since the event took up most of the restaurant and bar, but if it was me as a guest not at the event I would have been making arrangements at another location because there is no way Villa Montana can handle a 100 person event and cater to the other guests. A few more details for you. I saw 3 hammocks not plenty like the brochure, we had two ironing boards no iron, no rooms safes, ran out of milk at our meal, room cleaning came at 5pm, mixed up our rooms keys, they resort is very buggy bring plenty of bug spray, there is 1 masseuse, we scheduled a couples massage and canceled since one person has to wait for the other one, plenty of kids in pools and beach. Not that there is a problem with that, but they are bored and always looking for their parents to occupy them. We were so thrilled to go to this event and had a great time at the event, but Villa Montana needs more help. The owners were responsive to some of my concerns, but if they don't step it up this beautiful resort will lose all clientele to a competitor, if one even comes along in that area. Getting there: Either a 2 hour drive from San Juan in a rental car, Fly to Aquedilla and land at 3 am in morning, or take a cab from San Juan and pay $150each way. Rooms: The villas are cute and spacious, but dirty. The other rooms are like any other hotel room you've seen. Beach: Rocky, so you need to be careful getting into the water near the resort. You can move down, but thereâ€™s no service, restrooms, or chairs. Service/Food: Deathly slow. Average quality for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Chic...Chic...Chic”
Reviews.Author: EdithWharto
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from the Villa Montana where I stayed in one of the villas with my teenage daughter and adult nephew. Being a Manhattan family, we have access to good food and quick service YET we could not have been more impressed with the ambience, attention to detail and general level of service provided by a very dedicated staff. In the front of our villa was a pool with very comfortable lounge chairs and a shaded hammock. In the back there was a beautiful garden with hammocks, shaded chaises and beautiful rows of orchids, herbs and indigenous fauna. The incredible beach was a two minute walk through the beautiful grounds. I believe that the web site is quite clear that this is not a place for casinos and wild partying. By no means does that mean that this is a boring place. We amused ourselves with good books, the beautiful views, terrific pina coladas, swinging/napping on hammocks, swimming and enjoying one another. Perhaps we felt that we did not have to be entertained every second. In the evening, we dined on delicious food at both the tapas bar and the hotelâ€™s main restaurant. We

Reviews.Title: “Resort Shmesort; Stay Away!”
Reviews.Author: Goldie111
Reviews.Content: This is the first time in my 32 yrs of life that I have taken the time to write a review. My boyfriend and my experience was so bad at this "resort" that I felt that it was my duty to write. It was so ridiculious that I almost want to call John Stossel from 20/20 and tell him about the Villa Montana "resort" as it provides perfect content for his Give Me A Break reports. Some highlights from our trip: Due to an average rainfall, the road to the "resort" was flooded enough that not even a SUV could get by and the front desk had no clear solution or timeframe as to when we would be able to drive through. This was our first experience of the "you are on your own" mentality at this place. This behavior would be more acceptable if Villa Montana called itself a condominium complex, not a resort it claimes to be. Let me point out that this is after 2.5 hrs of driving over the speed limit from San Juan despite the website indicating it is a 1.5 hr drive. In summary, we had no way to get to the "resort" for hours and there is NOTHING in this area other than some manufacturing facilities (Hewlett Packard, Tyco) and a couple of very bad and overpriced restaurants with extremely depressing atmospheres making us wish we had vacationed in Secaucas, NJ. Don't expect fresh fish or fresh produce. The restaurant at the "resort" and a seafood restaurant down the street both served frozen fish for the price of an expensive New York City restaurant. Entrees were $20-$40. There are no other food options in the area. The only place we were excited about was this little food stand outside of the resort but unfortunately it was never open....the stand guy must have taken a vacation or something. Given the hassle we experienced, they upgraded us to a 1 bedroom villa. While the room, superficially, looked somewhat charming, the infestation of ants in both the bathroom and kitchen was annoying. Although we we were aware that these ants were harmless, it was hard to relax when our toothbrushes we were about to use or the pinapples we were excited to eat, particularly given the depressing food options, were covered in ants. We called the front desk and told them of the ants issue, and although they said they would have someone come to resolve the problem, no one came. The beaches are not nice either. In fact, on our walk down the "3 miles of untouched beach" Villa Montana writes about on its website, we came across trash that truly amazed us. The more interesting ones included a rusted sofa bed and washer/dryer. I wish I had my camera for that walk. I could go on and on about our bad experiences if I had the time or energy. In summary, although the landscape at the restaurant and pool are actually very pretty (this must explain why Vogue and Elle magazines did photo shoots here), there is NOTHING else appealing about this place. The place is in a romote manufacturing area, the beaches are dirty, the service is horrible, and the food options are beyond depressing. We were happy to get back to New York City and need a vacation from that trip.

Reviews.Title: “If Only They Cared...”
Reviews.Author: arohm
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed this past Sunday & Monday at the Villa Montana. The resort looked wonderful on the website, the reviews were good, and the prices were reasonable. Upon arriving, the resort did look beautiful. However, that's when the fun started. The front desk was oblivious to our arrival, and carried on side conversations rather than check us in. Once settled in after a 20 minute wait (with no other guests checking in at the same time), the room was nice, and things seemed to be in order. My girlfriend enjoys sleeping with 2 pillows, so we called to request an extra pillow. We called and were assured that it would be taken care of and went off to dinner at the resort restaurant. Don't go to the restaurant. I preface this by saying that we are two easy-to-please people. Decent food served expiditiously and some seblance of service is good enough. Even though the restaurant was 1/2 full, we were asked if we made reservations, then asked to wait. And wait. And wait some more. After asking if we could sit anywhere (not by the water, but at any of their multiple open tables), we were seated after a 40 minute wait. Once sat, we were ignored further at every turn by our waitress. We ordered an appetizer after a 20 minute wait, waited 30 minutes more, then asked if we'd have mussels since they're out of clams. Ok then. We took whatever food they offered at that point. Dinner showed up roughly 45 minutes to an hour after that. In total we waited two hours just to get to the main dishes, which were nothing to write home about and superbly overpriced. Perhaps there is a cultural disconnect between what we expect from dinner service and what level of service is provided, but they should know their clientele well enough to make the appropriate adjustments. To ignore us while talking with other staff members for hours is ridiculous and insulting. The restaurant was a waste of time and money due to their lack of service and lack of care for us. We get back to the room, and there is no pillow to be seen. We call again, and are told that the walkie-talkies aren't working between the front desk and the bellman. I volunteer to pick it up. I'm then told that it is "on the way". An hour goes by. I call to cancel; they seem confused. I'm not asking for the world, just an extra pillow. We used a spare comforter as a makeshift one. That night/the next morning around 4 am, my girlfriend wakes me up and spots a huge fire below our room in the trees adjacent to the tennis courts, about 200 yards max from our room. We could see it at the treelines, so this is no small fire. No fire alarm goes off in the whole complex so we knock on doors in the building to alert them. We obviously see the threat and report it to 911. Trucks show up quickly and take two hours to put it out. Next morning, we call the front desk to see if they are ok. It turns out the housekeeping building burnt down completely. They say everything's fine, and don't even ask how we are. OK, terrific! The beach looks nice but it is tough to go wade in the water due to rocks. We were happy to leave on Tuesday. The Villa Montana staff topped off their non-service by not even asking how our stay was. We did not feel like valued guests, and I doubt you will either. Avoid despite the nice scenery.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Familty R&R”
Reviews.Author: jayh-7
Reviews.Content: We spent our spring school break at Montana. Our party included,myself, my wife and three children 13, 11 and 8 years of age. We go someplace warm every year and prefer smaller, less crowded resorts. We don't need entertainment, casino's and the like just a clean and beautiful spot to rest. Montana was perfect for this and we would come back. The facility was beautiful. Our two bedroom apartment was clean and well kept. The staff was friendly and the beach was very nice especially if you like to snorkel. Montana's decor was done by someone with taste - its very nice,I would call it upscale Polynesian. The beach chairs were comfortabel and plentifulof the variety that you don't see everywhere.... really first rate. The towels and bedding the quality you would find in an expensive hotel. The resort has great tennis courts and two nice swimming pools. If you are going for glitz and to party into the night don't go to Montana - not that there isn't a beautiful oceanside bar with great drinks and music...( try the "MOHITO") but this isnt Atlantis (Paradise Island) and we were happy about that. The one negative was the resort restaurant. "Eclipse" is on the property and occupies a beautiful spot right near the beach. Unfortunately this gourmet establishment is overpriced and the service from the kitchen is slow and inconsistant. Entrees never came out at the same time - half out party was finished by the time the other half of the food came out. All the food took an inexplicably long time and you can expect to spend $50 per head without much to drink. After eating here a few times we decided to avoid it. We don't go to the Carribean for gourmet meals, we would have been happy with a restaurant that didn't try so hard to pretend it was an upscale Manhattan eatery..Eclipse fails at this. Eclipse needs "rework". The good thing is that you can go up the road to eat at more casual places with more Puerto Rican fare - the Ocean Club is the best we found - the rooms at Montana also had good kitchens so if you are with a family go to the Supermarket down the road and take care of some of your meals this way - rent a car. Overall though Montana was a great place and we will probably return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Like Renting A Condo”
Reviews.Author: BFPW
Reviews.Content: A little about your reviewer is always helpful to know when judging how the review fits your situation, so here's about us: Sunny and warm were the two top priorities for our February trip -- and a carribean location, not Florida. Lack of passports and the new requirements dictated that we go to a US territory, $700 round trip airfare counted out the USVI, our first choice, and so we picked Puerto Rico. We wanted island, not high rise heaven, not hotel chain, mcdonalds cut out, Disney world type island, so we selected Aguadilla over San Juan. As a family of five, finding accomodations can be difficult, especially with two teen girls (hello, two bathrooms.) We read the reviews and took a gamble on Villa Montana. This is a condo complex with villa style duplexs on the beach, townhouses behind them and garden view two level buildings behind that (we were in the garden view two level on the second floor). There were several units that had personalized furnishings and were occupied by local families. Other units (like ours) had the standard issue couch and no personal art. In the distance on the cliff we could see the hotel but did not go to it. Best part -- the resort was full, but you couldn't tell, and the grounds are very, very well maintained. This is where they put all their effort. It was a fine choice, but we were realistic in our expectations. First, you are renting a condo, not going to a resort. Don't expect prompt mainland-type service, concierge help or other typical resort features. We did get a clean, cheerily decorated, roomy two bed, two bath villa, with washer/dryer and two lovely decks. The kitchen was equiped but missing a few items I expected -- like dishtowels, dish soap and potholders. (We stay at a lot of Residence Inns). I emailed a grocery list but no groceries were there and staff did not rush to get them, so the first day we did have to eat at the restuarant for lunch which was $70 for four people -- one child, two teen girls and my husband. Ouch. If the price is right (and JetBlue airfare plus $460 a night for all that space is a pretty good deal during February break) and you do choose to go to Villa Montana here are our recommendations to make it a pleasant experience: Rent a car. Bring dry goods (flour,rice, cereal), including small laundry soap and dish soap, and go to the grocery store on your first day to stock up. Full selection and reasonable prices (Unusual for the islands!) $150 got it done for four days. Bring all the stuff you think you'll need -- except for the grocery store, there are no tourist services like gift shops, etc. (The airport has the only gift shop, and it's only open when flights arrive and depart). Bring snorkling gear, boogie boards and beach towels. Book snorkling in La Parguera with Paradise Scuba for the afternoon and evening bioluminescent bay. It includes some great, well guided snorkling in the cays and open water, terrific chicken empanadas and beer (soda for the kids) and the bioluminescent evening dip is great. (60-90 minute car ride from the Villa Montana to the far south end of the island, down commerical route 2, but worth the effort). If you are a a diver, this is the side of the island where you want to be. If the weather cooperates, the beach at Villa Montana is fabulous and the pools are great, but not in a carribean sea kind of way, in a kiteboarding, surfing, wave crashing kind of way. Wake up early and get out on the comfy loungers, bring the towels from your room and don't sign any out at the beach. Drive down 4466 to the OceanView restaurant for your dinner out . Local food but tourist-friendly, be respectful of local custom and get dressed up -- skirts for ladies. Fun live guitar and kid/adult friendly food. Drive through Rincon and check out the beaches, very pretty. I called twice prior to our arrival to confirm and had booked via the internet so I had written confirmation -- I recommend that you do that. I sat in the lobby for internet service (the only location on the resort with high speed internet service) and witnessed one digruntled guest who wasn't getting the two bedroom they requested on the phone, after submitting an internet request for a one bedroom. The front desk person did try an alternate arrangement (a second room in the "hotel" portion) at a very reasonable price but the guest turned it down. Front desk personnel are very friendly and have lots of information, but info is all you get. A fun story -- my daughter wanted a conch shell from this trip. None to be found on the beach at Villa Montana. She didn't buy one or take one from La Parguera, and so we went on a local quest, which involved info from the front desk, the staff person of the tourist bureau calling her mother and a visit to Mom's house where she makes shell jewlery. My daughter got her conch shell and a wonderful lesson about life in PR from a local perspective, but as always when you are a guest in someone's home, it pays to be courteous, friendly and flexible.

Reviews.Title: “La Isla Bonita”
Reviews.Author: neutrino
Reviews.Content: After a weekend holiday returning from Villa Montana the moments spent soaking in the environment were priceless. When you walk to the lef tof the resort theres seriously miles of untouched beach to walk. I felt like I was Survivorman and or part of Gilligans Island. The service is considered slow to the reviews I read but I would say it is island speed. The service to me was great. If one were to look for speedy service than there are hotels that thrive on throwing you the bill after your last bite. Villa Montana makes sure you relax enjoy. If you need the check quickly and or a towel ask earlier and expect it on time. After returning back to the fast pace life I bow to the staff for slowing me down. I rented a room to sleep 5 and we got a 2 bedroom, living room with a sofa bed, kitchen, 2 bath (with bidet), air conditioners in all room with ceiling fans, and a washing machine and dryer. Im not sure if all of them have it. Some rooms are small but like a cruise some of the rooms are only to sleep... We had a chance to rent out the gazebo next to the beach for our reserved picnic I would totally recommend this if you like to be romantic and or experience lifes simple pleasures. If you also get a chance make reservations for "o" the restaurant only open on Friday and Saturday. The A/C is blating and the Tapas is tasty. The restaurant Eclipse is great too. Different menus throughout the day. The water is somewhat rough since it is facing towards the Atlantic but there are pockets where you can enter and swim. Those who love to surf this place is like paradise with icing on top. This place has enough you never have to explore outside. We stayed the whole time within the resort. Taxi costed $35. and takes 15 minutes felt like 5 minutes. This place is a giant gem on the North Shore. Im sure in the future things will change. I totally recommend this resort if you love the serene, peaceful and relaxing atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “A return visit”
Reviews.Author: baskin
Reviews.Content: We recently completed our second prolonged stay at Villa Montana. The hotel consists of one or two story 1-3 bedroom condos. The buildings are widely spaced from each other. The condos are spacious with the two bedroom units being over 1000 sq. feet. The units further from the beach are somewhat larger. There are a few "hotel rooms" which are quite small. We have found that the condo's are well furnished and extremely clean. The hotel is beautifully landscaped and the beach is spectacular. You can walk "forever", either to the East or West and see no one for long periods. The surf is quite strong at the hotel but on many days it is possible to go into the water. Swimming is limited to strong swimmers. There is kite surfing about 100 yards to the East that attracts international surfers. In addition to Eclipse at the hotels, there are a number of very good, informal restaurants within a five minute drive of the hotel. These serve excellent meat and sea food with less flair than at Eclipse and in a more Puerto Rican style. Unfortunately, noise somewhat dimished our recent visit. A new hotel is being built at the western edge of the hotel. The noise severely impacts the units nearest the construction but does not those room further east, ie closer to the restaurant.
