We were awoken twice by dogs barking and once by a very late party outside one of the condos. The hotel responded very quickly to our calls about the noise. The front desk of the hotel, including the issue of beach towels, does not work as smoothly as in large resort hotels. However, the individuals at the front desk all mean very well and will respond positively to requests that are presented in a reasonable manner. This hotel is a perfect place for a couple to have a quiet restful vacation. A car is very helpful, especially to see some sites that are an hour away. It is not an appropriate place for individuals that are looking for the actions available in many large resort hotels.

Reviews.Title: “For the price, I'd expect a lot more. There's bettter value elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: Zwithapggb
Reviews.Content: We were in PR for a wedding, which was held @ the Villa Montana. We actually arrived early, and spent some time in other parts of the island before going to Isabella for the wedding, so we do have something to compare this to. (See our review of the HoJos in Mayaguez, and the CopaMarina Beach Resort). The Villa Montana is OK as far as it goes, but I wouldn't compare it favorably to other resorts in its price range, in PR or elsewhere. The specific problems we had were: Front Desk/reservations: Not the most on the ball people on earth. When people ask for a room with two beds, they say "there are no rooms with two beds" even though plenty of the villas have multiple rooms. That's an example of the sort of mentality you run into at this place: They will answer the question, and do what is asked, but they don't take any initiative to make you really enjoy your stay, which is what you would expect in this price range. Phone service: Room to room worked spottily, there is no cell coverage, so you have to rely on the (one per villa) land line, which went down several times. Water Pressure: Watch out when someone flushes the toilet while you are taking a shower: HOT HOT HOT. Internet: The Internet in our villa never worked, since it was dependent on a wireless access point in another villa, which I would gather was not plugged into the Internet at all. I was able to get it working in another wedding guest's room, by plugging it in. Television: We never had working TV service in the 3 days we were there. The hotel has no competent technical staff to fix any of these items, and the guys they rely on seem to work one day a week . Restaurant: Expensive, slow service. Activities: None on-site that I could see. There are tennis courts, but it is pretty much self-serve. All the activities they recommend are run by expensive, off-resort, local businesses. Pool/Ocean: The pool is small, the ocean unsuitable for small children. I'm a certified rescue diver, and a surfer, and I didn't swim there due to the waves and currents. The waves were the worst part: blown out mush that makes it bad for anything except kiteboarding. One of the other guests, who surfs Stinson Beach SF with some regularity, cut his foot up pretty badly while trying to swim there. The villa itself was nice and spacious, the kitchen well appointed, and the beds comfortable. Think of this place as more of a gated vacation rental condo place than a hotel or resort. For that, it's par for the course.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Setting BUT!”
Reviews.Author: Meguelito
Reviews.Content: We loved the incredible tropical landscaped setting on beautiful beach. The atmosphere was peaceful and relaxed. We enjoyed the oceanfront restaurant, the tennis courts and the pool. BUT the ocean view unit we stayed in was run down, furniture was worn out, stove was dangerous to use and there was no hot water in bathroom sink. On first day on their beach one of the towels they provided disappeared from the beach chair and we were treated like criminals by the towel girl when we could not account for it. We were charged $60 for the towel and complaints to the Manager about this charge have gone unanswered. Given the poor condition of the unit, how we were treated and the $400/day cost we would not recommend it. We plan on returning to the area next year and are already looking for a different place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Beach, Horrendous Service”
Reviews.Author: KarlaG.
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Villa Montana for four days to attend a wedding. The property is at the eastern end of the island in a spot where there does not appear to be many other hotels. As such, the beach is beautiful. I often found myself walking on the beach completely alone. They also offer other services, such as tennis, which were adequate (a near by horse riding facility). However, the service and other amenities at the hotel were lacking. Although the food was good, every meal took between 2-3 hours to be completed (even without other guests in the restaurant!). A drink could take a 1/2 hour. The water pressure was low and the hot water bordering on luke warm. Old, noisy air conditioners; pitted bathroom decor; overloaded check-in desk, unable to deal with normal requests. A non-existent towel desk. Room service that doesn't come until 5:30 pm and must leave by 6:00 pm. Balcony doors that won't open. Etc. I can say that the execution of the wedding ceremony and reception (from the guest's perspective) was very good and the food excellent. Perhaps they were working so hard on the wedding details that they couldn't tend to anything else -- but then they should hire more staff.

Reviews.Title: “Our Magical Wedding!!!”
Reviews.Author: edjob210
Reviews.Content: I went to Villa Montana in 2003 and silently said to myself this is the place I want to get married. Three years later, I'm engaged and looking at destinations. My husband to be sent me a link of Villa Montana and I fell off my chair! This was the place I went to!! We flew to Villa Montana in May 2006 and met with Diana Perez, the wedding planner and Jeremie Cruz, the star chef. The food and wine tasing was just delicious and fun! We got married on October 21, 2006. We had arrived on October 19th with our guests at around 11pm. The resort was staffed and ready to accomodate us. My guests loved their villas. Most of them cannot stop talking about the beauty of this place and will return! We had our rehearsal dinner at O, the asian fusion lounge. The food and surroundings were fabulous! We sat on pillows and shared the delicious food. Chef Jeremie and the wait staff were extremely friendly and accomodating. Our wedding was magical. The path was lined with roses and the gazebo was just breathtaking with the view of the beach behind us. During our ceremony, a rainbow came out!! Throughout the whole day, Diana was there, checking on us, making sure we had something to drink or eat. Our reception was beautful and alot of fun. Our guests did not want to leave, so we had an after party at one of the pools! Overall, we would like to thank Diana Perez, Lisbeth,Chef Jeremie Cruz,Shakira, Josvany, and the entire staff at Villa Montana for a truly memorable wedding! We will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Not a resort its a motel”
Reviews.Author: BostonFamily2024
Reviews.Content: This resort is nothing like the web page, I was a little worried when my wife booked a trip for the kids and us and didn't do a little more searching around. If you look at their really poor web page that some kid did during his lunch break...there are no large pictures for you to get detail of the motel? The first page doesn't even show a clear picture, mostly likely because it would saw trashed on the beach. Second there are not 21 different activates to do. My kids were bored during most of the trip and there was not other large family there. I don't know where they came up with that, and if maybe the GM or another manager can list them the front desk sure couldn't. Nothing is worst when your talking with someone and then they speak another language to there co worker, this happen many times and I always had a feeling that they were talking do to may family and me. My main problem was the resort and rooms where dirty, the pools were filled with bugs my daughter wouldn't go swim during our 5-day trip. They the ocean is not swimable, its not that the waves are rough, its because there are large rocks throughout the whole beach area. The beach also had a lot of trashed and bottles. Oh and you better bring towels with you if you visit this motel (resort usually has live entertainment and a hot tub) You can find any towels near the pool or beach, they you go to the front desk and you get more [--] from them and of course they continued to speak another language. The rooms are not rugged anywhere, the floor was all dirty, there were bugs thought out both rooms. There wasn't even a desk for me to do some work and the couch was ripped in a few area's. We called a head of time to get a roll away bed, but when we got there they were all be used...come to find out later there are only 2 rollaway beds for 50 rooms. They called their rooms a suite but it was just a large motel room. Finely the check out, they never did come to my room and help with the bags...check out took more them 45 minutes, they called us a taxi that didn't take credit cards, and wouldn't cash my the travel checks??? So I just left, didn't want to waste my time fighting with them because I had a plan to catch. So we drove off to the airport where I just thought there would be a ATM, however the taxi driver didn't say anything about there being no ATM till after were got to the Airport. So I had to leave my wife and kids at the airport as I drive to find an ATM. In this time the taxi driver said that he knew there wasn't an ATM there??? Well I thought I wonder if the Front Desk knew that. So I called them acting like I was still at the Resort and checking out soon. What was great is the front desk agent that I dealt with answered the phone. So she when on to tell me that no there is not ATM at the airport...thatâ€™s when I couldn't take it anymore....I was so upset that the front desk didn't even care to tell me this important information. They didn't care to deal with it, they just wanted me out of their hair when I wasn't even that rude to them. So my final thoughts are never go to this resort, after thinking about my trip...even if the fix every problem quickly I still won't of been happy with my over all experience.

Reviews.Title: “Dream wedding”
Reviews.Author: GlBo7
Reviews.Content: I always had a wedding in my mind... in July it became real. Since the beginning Diana was woderful, taking in consideration my ideas, my budget and helping us with her expertise in the matter. After planning for approx 8 months it finally became true. The night before the wedding we arrived to Villa Montana and a bottle of champagne, and a fruit + cheese platter was waiting us. The accomodations were wonderful. The villas were espacious and well decorated. The next day we enjoyed lunch at the Eclipse restaurant, excellent as always. During the afternoon, while some of our family members enjoyed the pool by the garden I had to start getting ready for the event. The great thing is that they think of everything. I can say that I was as stress-free as a bride can be. The hairstylist and make-up artist were just in time. They did a great job in accomplishing what I wanted. The only thing that no one could control was the weather. Despite raining all day long, it stopped 5 minutes before the wedding. I know that I need to thank God for stopping it, but the staff did such a great job. I saw how they started transforming the area. It was beautiful! The ceremony was wonderful... The pastor was inspiring. It was as if he knew us for a long time. The reception was more than I anticipated. The food was exquisite! The staff was extra helpful and attentive. The music by Deborah Brum was exotic and fun. Thank you Diana, Jessica and all the staff at Villa Montana for making my dream into my real wedding day. People are still talking about what a majestic time they had... and I know they are going to keep at it for a long time. Thanks again!!!!! You are the best.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place”
Reviews.Author: malm
Reviews.Content: We stayed 8 days in July and had one of the best vacations we have ever had. There was a misunderstanding when we checked in as we had reserved an one bedroom ocean front villa with a king bed and when we got there we found out there is no such thing; all of them have only a queen bed. The desk people were upset that we had this wrong information (it came from their call center and not the hotel) and found us a villa that had a king bed but was further back from the ocean. This was quite a task as they were fully booked and had a large wedding group. We got over the initial disappointment, especially with the Manager bringing us a bottle of champage and her personal apologies for the mix-up and realized the villa we had was more than adequate and much larger than the first one. The young men that take you to your rooms are exceptional and take the time to be sure every need is met. The main restaurant was closed the first evening as the wedding party had it booked. We ate in the "O" Restaurant the first night; it is very unique and the food was good, but very small portions and everything was ala carte. It was Asian style and I am sure that it will get better after it officially opens. Staff is so gracious and we found that the Ecslipse had staff that was just a good. We ate there a couple meals but enjoyed local places to eat for other meals and cooked in our villa for some meals. The beach lounge chairs have to be the best ever! The beach man puts a sparkling white fitted terry cloth cover on them in the morning and the thick foam pad underneath is so comfortable. My husband spent 6 days; all day; sitting at the beach. We did not go to the pools as we are beach people, but the 2 on site are clean and nice. The grounds are spectacular! We highly recommend Villa Montana and hated to leave truly a piece of paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort-Beautiful wedding”
Reviews.Author: wineluver
Reviews.Content: July 6, 2006 wineluver1@comcast.net - Galloway, NJ After more than a year of planning, and searching for the perfect location throughout the Caribbean, we settled on Villa Montana Beach Resort, in Puerto Rico, on the North West shore, for our June 17, 2006 wedding. And without ever having seen it until we arrived, 5 days prior to our wedding day! I must say I did rely in part on Trip Advisor reviews and photos providing by the resort. Getting There: We flew into San Juan and rented a car. It takes an hour and a half if youâ€™re good at driving in traffic. I highly recommend you find a way to arrive using the airport at Aquadilla, only ten minutes from the resort. The last mile or so we began to wonder what we had got ourselves into, as the road narrows to almost one lane, and we thought we were in the middle of nowhere! Then we came around a corner, saw the gated entrance, and drove into one of the most beautiful places we have ever seen. We had 43 friends and family joining us for the wedding, and every one of them loved the resort, and the surrounding area. They had a ball! I reserved a 3 bedroom villa for my fiancÃ© and me, plus our kids (this was the second time around!) and it was right on the beach, nicely decorated, and as the 3 br is really a 2 br joined with a 1 br, the extra small kitchen was perfect for our son and grandchild. We loved the outdoor shower off of our master bedroom! The villa was well maintained, and any minor items were taken care of quickly, based on island time. (A note here to TripAdvisor readers: we are experienced travelers and have stayed at 4 and 5 star resorts and hotels throughout the Caribbean, Mexico, Hawaii, England, Scotland & Ireland, as well as the USA. If you think of house keepers, food servers and hotel staff in general as servants there to do your bidding, demand instant service, and have no interest in, or respect for, the local culture, well you probably should stay at home. We have found that if we introduce ourselves to staff and local people and show a sincere interest in them, there culture and language, we get great and genuine service. Sorry for the lecture, but not one negative thing we read among the mostly positive reviews regarding this resort ever happened to us, or the 43 people who joined us. Your attitude directly reflects the level of service you receive.) Some of our guests stayed in villas, and some in hotel rooms, all were pleased. One had asked for a king bed, when shown to the room and it had a queen, they were quickly upgraded to a one bedroom with a king. The pools were clean and well maintained. The grounds were stunning and constantly attended to. A group of 9 of our guests arrived at 11:30pm and the staff were waiting at the reception area to greet them. The bartender stayed open until probably 1am, and the staff even prepared sandwiches in case they were hungry! One night I called the front desk at around 11pm to ask if they had a corkscrew, as the one in our kitchen was broken. They said they would check, and a few minutes later one of the managers, Edna, arrived on a golf cart with a corkscrew she had taken from the bar. We opened our wine, she left, and the next day we had a new corkscrew in our villa. Things To Do: There is horse back riding available adjacent to the resort, Tropical Trail Rides owned and operated by Michelle and Craig Barker. Considered by many the best on the island, most of our group went. The ride on the beach is incredible. I also have to mention the Ocean Front Hotel & Restaurant, just a few miles from the resort, right on Jobos beach. They have an air conditioned restaurant, but the fun is out on the ocean deck. The bar and deck are covered, and the staff was great. We went by ourselves our first night, and the food was very good and inexpensive. Two nights later we went back with our two sons and daughter and 19 month old grand daughter. We had such a great time we decided to have all our guests come back with us on Friday night. I called the owner, who was kind enough to set up extra tables for us, and we showed up with 40 of our friends and family! They just loved it. Itâ€™s very laid back, the view is fantastic, and we had so much fun that most of us went back on Sunday! The Wedding: It was a beautiful setting on the grass by the ocean, (note: in the photo of the wedding gazebo, the chairs had all been covered in white, but had been removed due to the rain. See the Villa Montana web site for a photo of the wedding gazebo all set up) with the wedding gazebo decorated with fresh flowers and flowing linens. The path covered with flower petals. The guest chairs all lined up. Then the heavens opened and it poured! I mean serious cats and dogs rain! So while we waited in our villa, and our guests mingled by the bar, the staff moved everything onto the restaurant patio, which was covered, so the ceremony could start. But then there was a break, and Diana, our wedding planner, and that Edna again, knowing we really wanted our wedding on that beach, moved it all back outside in no time! It was a beautiful ceremony in a beautiful setting. Following cocktails on the lawn we moved to the terrace of the Eclipse restaurant. The terrace was also gorgeous, with long tables we chose (at the suggestion of Diana) instead of round, flowers everywhere, and wonderful lighting that gave it a magical air. The menu, prepared by Executive Chef Jeremie Cruz (named Caribbean Chef of the Year 1997 -98) was excellent, and served in a timely manner; there when needed, but not rushed. Diana, our wedding planner was there throughout to oversee. And when my 82 year old Mother, who uses a cane, was ready to go back to her villa, there was Edna with the cart! The next morning we hosted a breakfast for everyone and once again, the food was great and the service fine. (Here I will offer a suggestion to management: people will wait a long time for their breakfast, with that beautiful ocean view, but they need their coffee and juice quickly. A coffee thermos placed on the table means your staff doesn't have to keep checking, and won't forget, and the customer doesn't have his nice hot breakfast in front of him but no coffee to drink with it. Minor detail, but island time aside, more than several people mentioned this.) After Thoughts: Since we have arrived back home we have talked with all 43 of our guests and all agree it was a well run wedding, and a beautiful resort, and not one complaint. Thatâ€™s hard to beat! We canâ€™t say enough about the staff throughout the hotel. The bartenders, food servers, house keeping staff, and front desk were all very accommodating, always friendly, and ready to help. The hotel general Manager and owner, Jessica Tiphaine, came out several times to greet us and ask how everything was. And last, Diana Perez, our wedding planner. We thank her for all her effort, before and during our stay. She helped us to make decisions on the ceremony and reception, and saw to it that all went as planned. She was in on her day off, waited with us until 11:30 one night for guests to arrive, and just simply went above and beyond to insure our wedding was perfect. The other special mention is Edna Bosques. She was always there, always helping, and we loved her attention to detail. We will go back, and some of our friends and family are already talking about a return trip. Honey Moon: We left Puerto Rico for our honey moon, and went to Zihuatanejo, Mexico, to the Hotel Villa del Sol on La Ropa beach. I will write a review of that experience shortly.

Reviews.Title: “A Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Each year my husband and I return to Villa Montana to recharge, regroup and relax. Living in a big city, it is so nice to visit the Puerto Rican countryside and be pampered by the first rate staff at Villa Montana. The grounds are simply breathtaking. The lawns are well manicured and the bougainvillea, hibiscus and other tropical foliage flourish throughout the area. This year we were pleased to stumble upon the quaint, organic garden and green house. The whole area smells like the herbs and freshly turned soil. The pool areas are relaxing and offer comfortable areas in the sun and the shade. The lounges in the bar area are especially comfortable, even more so, with the creative refreshing drinks made by the friendly, talented and meticulous bartender. The beach chairs and lounges in front of the ocean are plentiful and many can be moved in the shade or the hammocks provide shade with the palms. While the ocean in front is a little rocky, there are plenty of sandy areas to swim . The local dogs and cats provide great entertainment as do the kit surfers, surfers and fishermen. My husband and I love to watch the old local fisherman fish by hand with their leathered hands standing right in the ocean with only fishing line and a hook! The restaurant continues to improve with nuevo cuisine and local favorites. In fact, the chef uses many vegetables, lettuces, and herbs from the organic garden. I had a pumpkin soup that was better than anything I've ever had in Chicago, and the lobster salad was so great I had it twice! My husband and I have had the opportunity to stay in various different villas, including the hotel room, one bedroom villa, and cliffside room. Each room is unique, clean and a mix between Polynesian and Caribbean. The ocean views are great, but the cliffside also has spectacular ocean views and views of the whole grounds. This resort is definitely not in a metropolitan city like San Juan where there are the old standbys of hotels with chains all over. There are definitely snags that don't run as smooth as one of the hotel chains. But, that's part of the charm of Villa Montana. This the puertorican countryside. If service feels slow, or the water doesn't get as hot as you want its because you are in the country. It is a different way of life. It is a happy, laid back, friendly atmosphere--it is all part of the experience. Instead of a rigid, regime-type staff and hotel/resort feel, the staff is friendly and makes it feel as if you are a part of the family and Villa Montana is your home for the length our your stay. We come from a cold city and can't wait for our week at Villa Montana every year to feel warm, relax, and enjoy the company of the staff, owners and guests--snags and all! There is no place we'd rather be.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Slow, and Sleepy”
Reviews.Author: wilcoam
Reviews.Content: We were among 60 guests at Villa Montana for a family wedding. The drive from San Juan is anywhere from 90 min to 2 Hrs depending upon traffic. Nice scenery, but very americanized. The resort itself is WONDERFUL. It's a nice contrast to the hustle and bustle of San Juan. It's perfect for a larger group, because it has simple but great amenities, and a very warm cozy atmosphere. The 2 pools are great, the beach is nice. it's a little rocky, but you get used to it, and if you snorkel or scuba, the coral reef is spectacular. There's only one restaurant, but it has inexpensive non-resort prices, and some great local food on the menu. The rooms are nice, especially the 2 bdrm suites. My only complaint is that for the prcies charged, better quality beds n linens should be supplied. Also, the bar closes a little early (11:00 PM) in tune with the sleepy lifetstyle. If it rains, there's not much to do. Lastly, staff moves at snail pace, but that maybe be cultural (lol). It takes forever to get food n drink, but then again, if you are on vacation, sitting on a beach, things could be worse. If you only have a couple of days in Puerto Rico, San Juan would be still be my first choice, but if you have an extended stay, and want out of San Juan, although sleepy, this is a beautiful place to stay, and a healthy change of pace. JC Toronto

Reviews.Title: “An Amazing Time”
Reviews.Author: MBG13
Reviews.Content: We visited Villa Montana over Memorial Day weekend looking for a place to have our wedding next year. We visited many hotels such as Rincon Beach Resort, Caribe Hilton in San Juan, and the like. Although we had a bad experience when we checked in, we immediately fell in love with the place. The owner seems to be regularly on the grounds and is very approachable with a great sense of humor. We saw her decorating the pool area with items she just received from Pottery Barn and it was great to see her excitement in making the resort even more comfortable and beautiful than it was. It was also refreshing to see her passion and dedication to the resort and the fact that she cares enough about the resort to decorate it herself. This is something I am sure you will not see in any hotel â€“ anywhere. As I mentioned, we had one experience in which ONE particular check-in individual was not friendly and seemed to be in a bad mood. When we mentioned it to management, she immediately corrected the situation and spoke to the individual. This person also apologized. Everyone else was absolutely wonderful â€“ the bar staff, wait staff, and housekeepers â€“ everyone was wonderful. Diana, the wedding coordinator and her assistant (Rosio) were also wonderful and listened to our needs and quickly devised a plan for our wedding. We are completely at ease and comfortable that they will take care of everything. I know that Iâ€™m going to have a stress-free wedding and that everything will be taken care of. Best of all, if I need to ask her anything as the date gets closer; sheâ€™s just an email away. The food was delicious and we had the opportunity to meet the chef, whom like the owner was friendly and approachable. He came to our table and spoke to us for a few minutes. At first, I thought that he made it a point to come to our table because we were still undecided about having our wedding there, but then I noticed that throughout the night he visited at least 5-7 other tables. We did wait about 35 minutes for our food â€“ but trust me it was worth the wait! Absolutely delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds...service/competence is another matter”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Attended a wedding there. Beautiful surroundings and perfect sunsets every day. I thought, what a way to showcase this place to wedding guests who may make it their own destination in the future. However, service remains to be desired. I stayed at one of the cliffside hotel rooms. At check-in, I asked for a second key to my room. As we were being shown to our rooms, the staff member told me the wrong key was given. Turns out my 2 other friends also were given the wrong second keys. Don't know if it is the front-desk staff or their organization system. Later the first night, the toilet was backed up. Housekeeping came to clean up the mess, but they didn't change the rug placed in front of the commode. It wasn't smelly or anything, just that any one looking at it could tell it was soiled. Next day when we came back from the beach to get ready for the wedding early afternoon, the room was not made. We had to call housekeeping so we could have some fresh towels for the shower. The maid came and said she would come back later to clean the room. What an unpleasant surprise to come back from the wedding to see the room in the same condition we left it. The maid never came. We complained to housekeeping and since we were heading back out again, we asked if they could come even though it was a bit late. Front desk said no problem. Guess what, we came back 2 hours later and still no housekeeping. We gave up. The night before checkout, our party decided to look up our portfolios. My friend saw charges on her bill that was incurred before she even checked in. She got it reversed, but still. My bill was correct so I didn't think much of it. I balked when I got my credit card statement and saw a charge posted on the day after I had checked out. I don't know what is wrong with this place. I had traveled to many places and never had these problems. It's a shame because it is beautiful there. By the way, there is no hotel information in the rooms. You have to ask the front desk about everything. Even the voice messaging system doesn't work. If you follow what's printed on the phone you get a busy signal. My friend got a flashing light but couldn't get to the message. He asked the lady at the front desk and was told to dial a completely different extension and passcode. Some things they do at this place just make you scratch your head.

Reviews.Title: “nice when theres not a wedding”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We really liked this place, its great and out of the way. Surf in the area is nice and the staff is great. The one big problem was there was a wedding there for three days. Two of those days they wanted to serve us food in the little confrence room away from the beach and next to the gym. The highlight is the restaurant and bar, when thats closed you loose a lot. When its the last day of your wedding anniversary holiday and you can't go to the restaurant on the beach or any other, its not so great. Place is great staff is nice but management seems off. Cheers
